pros: It's our second home and family :) Collabera has given me a identity what I am today as a person
cons: I know we work in US culture, but leaves should be given on Indian festivals as we miss sometimes some special moments with our family too
story:
We at collabera always work as a team and work with a very healthy competition

We are   insanely competitive

pros: I love the support and partnerships built through my work. I feel we make an impact with our end clients, but also with each candidate - at the end of the day, my job helps others, which is very important to me!
cons: I feel there is too much dumped on some, while others have a light load.
story: Work hard/play hard - numerous accounts of my team staying to support positions in the evenings and weekends! I love the mentality that Collabera brings to do things quickly and efficiently.

pros: Culture and work environment along with my team is the best reason I can say.
cons: Yes, It's truly a pressurised environment to work with deep pocket profit. Required more employee centeric approach
story:
1) Underpay fixed income which is a major concern.
2) Employee can't depend on variables.
3)Flexibility on leaves specially the earned ones.
4)Work culture is really really good which includes employee engagement activities.

pros: I don't feel like just an employee, here my opinion matters. individual development has equal importance.
cons: pressure to deliver best at all time is some time difficult and can drain you out.
story: "Work hard, Play Hard"... we work hard everyday to outperform the competition and when the time comes to celebrate no one no better than us be it "Employee appreciation week"  "President's club" weekly fun activity, lot of contests etc.

pros: The management team I'm a part of, my manager, my team, the spirit, the passion, the drive, the aggressiveness.  Our company rocks.
cons: Lack of communication sometimes which ends up hurting us rather than helping us.
story: There are so many stories about our culture.  Spending Employee Appreciation Week together and seeing the smiling faces of our employees feeling thankful and having fun.  Planning and being a part of International Women's Day and seeing the women at Collabera loving what the company is doing for them.  Traveling around to the different offices and spending time with people on the floor and seeing their passion and the comradery between teammates.

pros: The Culture and Passion of Collabera, it is incomparable.
cons: The downsides depends on person to person basis. As of now the one that i can think of is the attrition of the mid level managers joining their competitors.
story: Winning the PC award and visiting Dubai as a token of appreciation for year hard work, reflecting the Work Hard Play Hard culture of collabera.

pros: Good wokring culture and environment arounf everywhere in office
cons: we are deeprived with our social life and stuck in night life
story:
we feel like family we share a bond to each other .
we care about company as a single entity

pros: Best part about working at Collabera is the culture we follow here, the open door policy. I don't have to think twice before reaching out to someone who is 3 levels above me. The management is always very considerate about to professional as well as the personal challenges anyone might be facing.
cons: Growth opportunities are not available in all the departments, after a certain point it comes to a point of saturation for some people.
story: Collabera is the only organisation I know that thinks and spends so much on the well being of its employee, be it global EAW or yearly Blaze.

pros: I like to work with Collabera, because I started my career here. I am so comfortable with the work culture and moreover I like working as a Recruiter. I know incentives are there for a hire, but then there is a different level of satisfaction to help someone get a job.
cons: The only downside for me is working in night shift and also too much team change for me due to management's decision, and got very less growth here.
story: I like how they are trying to implement employee engagement & Performance management plans, but then it is not fully implemented. Lot of work needs to be done.

pros: Work culture, Recognition, work environment, people, reputed company among other staffing companies, Local to my place
cons: Sometimes undeserved person gets promoted, we talk about cross regional / department recruiting but support we get from other regions/department is less
story: Since I like Collabera culture, I have a positive stories only. Approx 2 years back I was really frustrated with my performance. I was thinking of leaving  but kind of support I got from my colleagues/managers were exceptional and I decided to stay, not just that I won Blaze a year after that :)

pros: Collabera makes us feel comfortable work wise. If the managers are understanding it makes work at lower levels smooth and easy.
cons: Monetary recognition is the major booster for any employee. i feel collabera tends to suppress those kind of rewards.
story: Working in a team for 3.5 yrs, never got any recognition no matter how hard i tried. However after changing the team my work was recognized as it should have been. The moral is collabera has to bring similarities in their values at all level and all department rather than pushing it in few places only.

pros: culture, people, and helping my fellow human being find employment to support themselves and their families.
cons: I do not have any downsides working at Collabera. Working with new college grads and helping them start and thrive in their careers along with helping people find employment - there is nothing negative about that.
story: I work a lot with new AAMs, training them on how to articulate Collabera, our services, culture, and diversity and inclusion. There is nothing better than to see the lightbulb go on in their head about how fortunate they are to work for Collabera and be in the Staffing Industry!

pros: Many companies invest money but Collabera invest time to bring their employees at next level.
cons: Under value potential and under pay employees in management. There is no sanity in pay for skill.
story: Collabera Culture, events, appreciation is limited to RDs, SM, AM, NAM, VPs. In last 10 years with Collabera I had not seen Delivery management  is getting awarded or rewarded for anything. Positive thing is Collabera has made a huge difference in my professional career and I cannot thank you enough for that. Huge learning opportunity keeps us going well and positive.

pros: It is a people centric to work for. I have enjoyed my tenure until now.
cons: I haven't seen much but if I have to then we could be a little better with benifits, Agile, Transparent, flexible in some of our processes
story: Well I have met a large variety of people. Leadership is a little centered but we have good people that have some good qualities

pros: Excellent work environment, culture and motivation to give my best.
cons: Working in odd hours leading to health issues as well as reduced face time with family.
story: great passion to go above and beyond expectations and achieve more.  A very open and transparent environment where an individual to ask for or get help from multiple people.

pros:
I Proud to be part of Collabera. There are Several reasons why anyone should work with Collabera. Few of them are:
1)	Transparency (Process, updates, etc)
2)	Growth plan (Roadmap) 
3)	Best Incentive structure in market. 
4)	Values of Collabera.
cons: I don't see any such Cons while working with Collabera.
story: We were handling a client where after putting our best for 6 months we have not seen any success coming out of it. But on same time we know this is going to be big client for Collabera and we can’t stop serving it. So, we did what we do in Collabera we make sure to serve this account with more passion, with more discipline and best in response. Which help us to crack this account and know we are growing day by day.

pros: brand image; chance to work with fortune 500 clients; good incentive structure;
cons: too many changes in very short period; Overtime culture in baroda office
story: responsive beyond imagination - this is latest example- we got a rec in Wells fargo MN  and we submited two resumes in next hours time and we got interview from client.

pros: Collabera has given me an opportunity to grow very quickly. I could not have imagined being what I am had it being any other organization. Collabera has understood my talents very well and helped me grow horizontally.
cons: There is an overlap in roles and responsibilities at some levels. There are place where people do not know what they are supposed to do and some places where people do much more than their role.
story: It can be a series of stories. Collabera culture teaches you how to celebrate small wins, how to come together when there is a 911 situation and how to have each other back in not so good times as well.

pros: Working environment and collabera culture is really fun
cons: only passionate ablut recruting and delivery as whole. other departments are not given much importance
story: Ample amount of differnt jobs available for different kinds of employees

pros: There are many reasons to work with Collabera like Work Culture, Ethics, environment.
cons: What i feel some times manager did not speak properly and they will not give respect to others.
story: I have been completed 5 years because of collabera's work culture and environment which I like the most

pros: Culture, enviornment, and motivation from people around me.
cons: Night shifts, working nights affects our biological cycle, so that is the only down side i see.
story: Celebrating every festivals with everyone around, i don't believe people would be missing their home while being at their 2nd home(Collabera).

pros: A company with a great balance between work and play. It understand that if you work hard you need to play hard too.
cons: Nothing as such, but favouritism is something that should not be there.
story: People at Collabera don't feel isolated during local festivals despite of working on local holidays. They work on those days but get ample time to celebrate at the same time.

pros: Good work-life balance. Our organization allows mid-managers to take initiative rather than micro-manage. Which allows employees to grow within the organization.
cons: Always keeping your guard up against internal and external forces of the organization. Sometimes feels as if others are gunning to take your place.
story: Collabera's culture has always been to uplift individuals within the organization. Considering my personal experiences, I originally started as a Technical Recruiter, today i am part of the mid-management team. Changing multiple roles and learning a ton about our industry. Other organizations don't invest back into employees.

pros: Collabera is very exciting place to work at. Though the nature of the work is not a rocket science, there are still internal and external challenges that keeps me alive and active. Collabera's client portfolio and service offering is the richest in the industry which puts Collabera in the best position to meet the goal of constant growth.
cons: In some scenarios, standardization of the financial reward structure is not favorable for everyone, knowing that every client has different characteristics than other.
story: The way that we have established our 5 cultures is unmatched in the industry. Be is a red zone call, or external and internal responsiveness, or project 333, or fill ratio, or response rate, we have not left any stone unturned to provide best services to our clients.

pros: Collabera is blessed to have Great clients and hence they provide good incentives to the recruiters as well.
cons: Collabera is becoming too much dynamic and trying to execute several things at same time which becomes hectic for ground level folks.
story: We live and breathe Collabera cultural values. One example that I witness each day is being insanely competitive. We jump on reqs and try to beat our competitors

pros: Collabera provides an equal platform oF opportunities for those with potential. An individual with right attitude and core values would be able to see good career growth and development.
cons: Since Collabera is scaling up at a fast pace, though there are multiple opportunities individuals will need to be more competitive and work harder to be the top performers.
story: One of Collabera’s core values is passionate about serving employees and clients. In spite of facing severe personal and infrastructural difficulties, individuals went over and beyond to deliver seamless, exemplary service to our employees.

pros: Friendly and semi formal work environment, Open door policy, Young vibe in office, Cheerful Friends & teammates
cons: Night Shift affects health specially for women, sometimes initiates goes unnoticed
story: Collabera Employee Appreciation week & celebrating festivities truly represents "Work Hard Play Hard" culture

pros: Salary credited in account on time. We celebrate Indian festivals so it feels good while working as we working in US timings.
cons: Our shift timing is of 10Hr with 1Hr of break so sometimes it is feel like too much workload. It should be of 9Hr with 1Hr break.
story: Collabera's environment is good and I saw few people join back to Collabera as they like the environment. We work hard and party hard on Blaze.

pros: People first approach, The culture of Collabera and If not me then who else approach helps me to own the task and drive to completion.
cons: Not any but yes at times someone may feel that the financial growth is not enough.
story: Just focus on your task and do not get distracted by others growth or failures. Just focus on your own task and align your growth plans with your business units/company's gowth trajectory.

pros: I feel Collabera is the best company in the market to work with,  the kind of hire managment support we have and the managers are very cooperative. We can easily reach out to them and talk of any issues if incase we are facing. Collabera provides lot of trainings to its employee groom better. Collabera is spending so much in training its employees, it helps us to better in our job.
cons: Nothing to say. Don't have anything to talk about. I feel Collabera is best place to work.
story: We have the best culture in our office - everything is transparent. We do get the opportunity to learn more and we can always reach out to our managers for any questions that we have. The amount of hard work we put in we equally enjoy our time at work - work hard play hard is followed properly and all other Collabera Cultures.

pros: Great culture and environment, competitiveness, success stories and growth opportunities
cons: I dont have anything that I can say about Collabera that I dont like.
story: Blaze event, when the whole team is standing in the crowd for you when you get an award, that shows team efforts even there is competitiveness.

pros: Work hard, play hard, challenging,, learn something new every day,
cons: Work from home Flexibility(after covid), delivery struggles, metric struggles sometimes are unrealistic
story: Collabera Christmas party! We all can have so much fun together and then go back into the office the next day.and grind!

pros: Work Culture and Environment. Getting opportunity to learn new things and good opportunity to grow. Also the way company thinks for his employees is one of the reason.
cons: In some cases may be not it is not justified to see everyone performance through same parameters. We need to keep in consideration the region/business in place.
story:
Work hard Play Hard - All the tournaments company organize.
Responsive beyond imagination - I get good feedback from candidates\AM\teammates for being responsive before time.
Disciplined in execution - This has helped me only professionally but also personally. 
Insanely Competitive - Helped  professionally but also personally in a positive way.

pros: Work Culture, Flexibility, Technology, Office Infrastructure, awesome team-mates.
cons: Salary in (GBS) is low as compared to (Delivery/Sales) along with incentive structure. If every dollar saved is dollar earned, then we being in GBS saves ample amount of money by following proper procedures, so we in GBS should also be considered as equals when it comes to salary & incentives plan.
story:
"Disciplined in Execution" - In 2016 I was assigned to review the voucher prepared by AP team in which I had saved around $1.4 million. 

It was for the insurance premium payable to Cigna for Q1 - 2017 in which if I was not "disciplined in execution" in my work, Collabera AP team had paid Cigna twice of the premium amount.

pros: Passion and empowerment to new ideas. We believe in our people and give them right opportunities. we also invest in nurturing the talent and have created many such leaders who were just fresh out of College.
cons:
For me personally there are none but this might differ person to person. 
 But if we try to compare it to other jobs then I might say sometimes night shift :-) could be a downside.
story: when put in tough conditions i have found that we at collabera tend to do better and think outside of the box. At the time of initial lock down Collabera went WFH in just few days and people still produce results that shows how passionate we are about our work.

pros: Collabera has created a supportive environment where the top all the way to the bottom feels supported and accounted for.
cons: Not enough transparency on changes that happen internally
story: I think one of the best experiences is when we celebrate president’s club. It’s a unique experience where you meet so many people from different parts of the country, and world, and get to interact  for a couple days. You feel the energy & motivation from everyone that is parallel to what i feel.

pros: Collabera is the best thing that has happened to me since I completed my engineering. Great working culture alongside passionate employees.
cons: Nothing as such but Salary Structure could have been improved.
story: Collabera has helped me to grow personally as well as professionally throughout all these years.

pros: There are many reasons to work at Collabera but few main ones that I love are Environment, Growth Opportunities, Work Ethics, Training, Overall development.
cons: There are not much downsides of working at Collabera but to name a few, work hours are one of the biggest downsides sometimes. Working from home has also been a concern nowadays but that is not in our control. It becomes difficult to maintain the work life balance.
story: Collabera has been really helpful in terms of overall employee growth. I was an STR when I had some trouble understanding the GP/GPM calculations. I was feeling shy in asking about learning the same but one fine day when I asked for some help, I was provided training on the very next day about the same. One or two times my name was missed in the appreciation meetings or the monthly award ceremony but the management has been kind enough to make sure everyone deserves the recognition they deserve. These 2 incidents show how Collabera is passionate and caring about the work we do.

pros: One of the best reason to work at Collabera is the great work environment and its safe as well as working in a night shift.
cons: One of the downsides to work at Collabera is the work pressure. Its so competitive everyone is having competition with each other. Everyone is running to achieve great things due to which it makes work place stressful.
story: Collabera is a big company people know its name and value as well. I like to work here because I learnt lots of things from here.

pros: It's employee satisfaction plans are amazing. Also, the managers are keen to work with executives closely for their growth.
cons: I don't think of any downsides of working here at Collabera.I
story: Back in 2018 we had a big bulk project for our client UBER and my manager initially handled the 1st bulk of around 40 people and than all upcoming bulks were offered to me to handle on my own.

pros: Collabera is a second home to me. It's been a decade I have spend with Collabera and have found lot of life time memories. Starting from my better  half to what I have been able to achieve in my professional journey is all because of Collabera. I have got utmost care, respect and knowledge required to be a successful individual within staffing industry. It's my bread and butter and I am thankful for it.
cons:
There have been instances where I felt company could have done better on some of below things -
1. Better evaluation of training needs for individuals. There have been many instances where company has been repetitively giving the same subjective training year over year which I feel is not required and should pick and choose some better subjects for individual and self development.
2. There is lot of overlap in hierarchy and unwanted titles within the departments which doesn't give clear picture for individual growth.
3. At times, there have been instances where people are wrongly promoted just to elevate other favorite person.  
4. Biased approach at times have been visible in different offices/dept with offshore and onshore.
story: Employee centric culture is the best what I have seen all these years where starting from CEO to execute level management person is approachable to give solutions to your problem.

pros: Exposure to the coorperate industry. Provides a good distingush between onshore and offshore models.
cons: Reduced work-life balance. Processes need to be more streamlined, and there shouldn't be a scope for modification on the basis of teams and departments. Excessive manual work at the ground-level, though we are transforming all the systems with the help of advanced technologies.
story:
Positive:

Blaze: There is a collective celebration of successes on a large platform which encourages the core value of Collabera, 'work hard, play hard'. 
Team trips: A company sponsering a trip every year for each team is a gesture to appreciate. 

Negative:

The approach is delivery-oriented, wherein both sales and delivery should have an equal footing and respect. 
The regional sales teams are still getting appreciated and acknowleged for their efforts; however, the offshore sales team does not receive the similar recognition. 
Another point is the incentive structure which does not seem as lucrative for the employees.

pros: I have enjoyed the work culture and team. Working for one of the greatest manager.
cons: long work hours (its more because of the industry). Too much process involved and overlapping of the efforts.
story: its been a learning  experience working with lot of passionate colleagues.

pros: It's dream of many people around me and i am living that dream
cons: As of now, i don't feel such, its always a perfect place to work
story: There are many good stories with Collabera, But what i experienced here, is like we at Collabera are one big family, who work together, achieve together and enjoy together. i am from Finance and accounting team in GBS. SInce, the day i joined Collabera there is not a single day that i have not enjoyed it, i have learnt to communicate with other, i learn about discipline & best thing i learnt from our Boss HP is to enjoy our work. so there are many stories with collabera can't tell it in this small tab

pros: Work environment,freedom of speech,opportunities,value of resources workimg in company
cons: uncertainity in business (but its the type of business so we have to be flexible and ready)

pros: Growth Opportunity , Culture and Environment that Collabera has developed for the employees over the years, Constant efforts and investment in employees through the medium of L&D,
cons: The salary structure is not very good. Base salary for the employees is way to less as per company standards. I know money is always not the motivating factor but is also one of the biggest motivating factor for many employees depending on the kind of situation they are into.  Also with Promotion the scale of your salary should also increase, which happen in most of the big company and not in Collabera.
story:
Insanely Competitive - Because I always believe in doing the best to my capability. Also I am kind of person who do not like to come 2nd. I will do anything and everything to beat my competition no matter what . It could be either by smart work or hardwork . I believe in winning and I always try by best to be the best . 
Responsive beyond Imagination : This quality comes by default since you are competitive. People working with me say one thing very proudly that I am best when it comes to taking action, helping recruiters to their needs and so on and so for.
Passionate to serve client and employees: I always go above and beyond my job role to serve my team and my client whether if at all it will yield me something out of it or not. I believe in helping others and I think this exemplifies this quality very well.

pros: The lively environment. Open mindset. Young workforce. Learning opportunities. Communication exchange with people on domestic as well as over internationally.
cons: The more concentration is on the delivery and business teams supporting the external customers as compared to the other teams who support and work over with business teams on the backstage to achieve the company objectives.
story:
Collabera is the first professional experience of my life. The culture of motivating and working together as a team to execute and deliver the things prevails in the blood of the people working over here.
Collabera always promotes the new learning skills to groom the individuals to develop within the organisation and achieve the objectives of both (company & individual).

pros:
New things to learn
Great incentives
A good Atmosphere
A great culture
cons:
Canteen facility not up to the corporate standard
Employee appraisal could be better
Extended working hours expectations from the managers
story: As far as i'm concerned, what i have witnessed so far is the Collaberites tend to have a grand party after finishing a task. Either big or small

pros: Freshly out of the college and Joining Collabera, I was a little scared since this was the 1st time I was joining a corporate world. Collabera definitely provides a great basic framework for someone to start and grow in an upwards manner. The environment is very supportive and the leadership has great patience to nurture the talent. The kind of work environment that is created does motivate everyone to grow exponentially and excel in there work.
cons:
The good thing is we have very fewer downsides from a ground-level employee perspective. 
1. Work hours are stretched a lot.
2. The average Base Salary for a 4-5 year experienced recruiter is way less than what competitions are offering.
 3. Fewer certifications/training programs are available
4. Better operation infrastructure like Laptops/Big Screen ( Alike Us offices) instead of desktop.
These are a few downsides that definitely affect the motivation of employees in direct/in-direct ways.
story: Freshly out of the college and Joining Collabera, I was a little scared since this was the 1st time I was joining a corporate world. Collabera definitely provides a great basic framework for someone to start and grow in an upwards manner. The environment is very supportive and the leadership has great patience to nurture the talent. The kind of work environment that is created does motivate everyone to grow exponentially and excel in there work.

pros: Good mentorship and allows to try things your own way.  ( Culture)
cons: Nothing really to say about downsides. I enjoy in what I do.
story: Collabera cares about their employee.In COVID situation Collabera did not remove any employees, and treated us really well.

pros: Great Infrastructure, Amazing work culture, Employees' appreciation, Company's growth
cons: Cannot think of any downsides of working at Collabera
story: We are proud to be Collabera. There are many stories that exemplifies Collabera's culture but most important is that each one working believes in Collabera's Values - Being insanely competitive, Being responsive beyond imagination, Passionate to Service the clients & employees, Being Disciplined in Execution & Work Hard, Play Hard

pros: Good Work environment and atmosphere, People engagement in everything
cons: I do not see any downsides of working at Collabera. because I enjoy working here in this organisation
story: As the team in which I work use to take care of the Client compliances part. and we have scored 100 out of 100 in many client audits. which describes the Value "Excellence in execution"

pros: Creative Liberty
cons: Lower incentives

pros: There are liberties on DHR that I am afforded that would never be given elsewhere.
cons: We are not supported from an IT side to better get us to where we need to be. There is no clear communication on who to contact for what need.
story: Collabera supports my sobriety 100% and that means the world to me.

pros: Fair and loyal to its employees and treated with equality to all of them.
cons: Doing jobs in Night shifts may lead to your health problems due to lack of sleep.
story: Best place to work as a company, it is taking care of its employees in any situation they are into.

pros: Amazing team to work with . Collabera is a place where I get both personal and professional development. I thoroughly enjoy my role at collabera.
cons: Nothing as I really enjoy working with collabera.
story: Broad culture with tones of opportunity to develop.  I takes cares of Onboarding For Bay Area hires and when I need help, everyone starting from my regional director, delivery director, account manager, ops lead will jump in. They always have my back. There is zero micro management where you have full freedom in thinking out of boxes in reaching your goals. One of the best company in Bay Area to work for. I am seriously blessed to have found this company as every single day will be a new learning and one step ahead in your career.

pros: Me being a recruiter, I always want a best client/responsive client to work on, where i really can see some ROI, in terms of time and effort I put. Luckily my client is doing good, gives enough business and I am able to convert those opportunity to hire, so I am happy here. Again very comparative environment and it feels great to work with all growth minded people. Atleast interms of growth Recruiters and management both thinks alike and do their best, so that they both can grow.
cons:
favoritism/Biasness
Every other manager/every other team has a separate way of evaluating performance and rewarding recruiters, which definitely discourages a performer more vs. an average/non-performing recruiter
Managers act as devil's advocate to create conflict within team and just strict in following process, without realizing how much it's impacting team's cohesiveness.   
Monopoly of managers
Throwing a decision to recruiter and ask them to follow without even evaluating how beneficial is that outcome will be
story:
celebration of employee appreciation week is an example of work hard/play hard.

We are definitely passionate to serve client and we show this in our act/our turn around time/ER team helping consultants/AAMs working closely with HMs to get business/tries to get 0 escalation from client,

We are only responsive beyond imagination towards client
, not to employees.

Insanely comparative in each manner--we try our best to stay on top of competition--Digital training must be a great example to it.

We show "Discipline in execution" only to client, to get the work done, management put lots of pressure, create internal stress   ......

pros:
Work Environment is awesome.
managers will support/help weather it's personal or professional
learn new things related to life and professional ways
cons: I do have negative points but rather sharing those negative points I am more focused on positive part of my career with Collabera
story: Work Hard Play hard: Tons of opportunities to show talent while working.

pros: It gives better opportunity/platform to grow personally and professionally
cons:
Work life balance, it is difficult to be fit.
To be updated/about day life what is happening around
story:
Work Hard Play Hard, keeping employee motivated in every aspect

Always keeping employees as part of Collabera family

pros: As a fresher I joined Collabera and working since 4+ years and as a new comer I was not aware about the professional ethics and culture a person should possess in team and company. I am always ready to learn new things which make me confident and Collabera and the leaders under whom I worked in past has helped me to achieve that sense of pride and satisfaction and honestly I have heard and saw that the collabera culture only exists here either it be fun, activities, programs to enhance and build a pipeline for our future career
cons: There is nothing such as an downside I have experienced till now truly on Collabera's perspective.
story:
When I joined , in my initial days I have been trained under some awesome leaders of Collabera who taught me how to be competitive and be ethical, fair towards that.
I say this because being competitive, confident, you need to ethically fair towards work and people. If we dont or if I dont, then I can not think of personally taking my career pipeline in an upward direction. Collabera has taught me that hunger to achieve anything and everything.
Secondly, the fun, activities culture in a floor, team helps us to be engaged and relaxed apart from all the work that we have which have always helped me to contribute well and being productive at same time.

pros: I see this opportunity to attain what has been my long term career objective. I like the working environment and the values of Collabera.
cons: the only downside I see is favoritism. Sometimes I feel that I am denied some opportunities just because someone needs to be favored.
story: I have all the good things to say about Collabera but given this opportunity I would like to share my experience where I was moved from I team in which I was one of the top performers but I was forced to change my team just because all the other performers were some personal favorites. I was at the peak when I was moved but I had to start from the scratch in new team and no one bothered.

pros: Appreciated for the work, good clients to work, team culture, new things to learn and grow
cons: Stretched working hours, some national days are not observed, less salary as per market standards
story: All the five cultural values are followed in Collabera and the examples I can think of Performance meets, POB, celebration, etc.

pros: Collabera has given me great career and success which help me to support my social, Financial and emotional needs.
cons: I personally believe every area (in my case region) has different challenges and i should get my career growth based on that. Comparison should be within the same department/region.
story: Many success stories i have and i cant specify one - as if would overshadow my other good memories (Success stories).

pros:
Culture and Value System
Autonomy and Trust by my leaders on me
Employee centric decision-making environment
Getting the opportunity to Learn - Perform - Grow
cons:
Working in the night shift-continuously impacting health in a longer run

story:

pros:
Continuous opportunity to learn and grow are the best reasons to work at Collabera. These factors have helped me and various individuals to achieve various small & big life goals in a timely manner which is what anyone would expect from their employer.

Above all the core values of Collabera, add a different level of spark in individual lives.

story:
Though the journey has been long, I would add about the time when I started with the organization. There was a day when the whole team received offers for their candidates. We were on day-end huddle and client shared 3 offers that day. During that call we received confirmation from client for 7 more candidates belonging to each recruiter in the team and each sales individual had atleast 1 offer.
We celebrated this win after hours as a team.

This clearly displays the competitiveness & passion while each sales was pushing hard to get those offers, the hard working team which made sure that they play hard post their hard work.

story:
Collabera is one of the best companies when it comes to working culture.
It gives a ton of learning potential. Work environment is too good. There will be people around you to help you out, but make sure that you achieve the targets.

pros:
direct relationships with the clients and hiring managers, our submissions don't go waste. we definitely get the feedback with Yes/ No/ May be.
Very good incentive structure.
No much distance between the employees of different levels. Senior level managers are easily approachable.
Complete security for women employees in the office.
cons:
Some of our managers leak out the issues that we discuss with them in cabins instead of keeping them confidential and help us in resolving it. 

Not everyone gets an opportunity to be a part of particular task, rather same people gets to participate/ enjoy the benefits. 

Penalty/ deduction of incentives if we don't have a start in a month is wrong.

Deduction of part of our incentives towards the bank amount every month is very painful because incase things don't work and we leave the company in between then we lose the money [our own money] deducted towards bank amount.

Friendliness between managers and favorite employees on floor leads to those particular employees getting considered for most of the opportunities/ perks, resulting in the other employees getting effected.
story: I would always appreciate one of the 5 principles that Collabera follows - Work Hard, Play Hard. The way festivals are celebrated in office even after having so much work pressure is really great.

increment which did not happen this year was also downside for me because i put in all the efforts previous year to get raise

story: I don't really have a story, but yes whenever, I have had any sorts of issues or even personal issues or professional issues I have been in the scenario to easily communicate it to my Team manager and let her know each and every aspect regarding it. Which show cases to me the ease with which I can reach out to her and let her know about anything and everything I am going through. Even though we work from separate cities it is very easy for me to communicate anything to her, which tells me how the managers have made their employees feel quite comfortable in the working scenario.

pros: I love working with Collabera, as it helps in overall development of a person in terms of skills, knowledge, confidence, maturity, self motivator, competitive, hard worker, responsibility etc. Work culture & environment is very good, we get a chance to learn from the seniors and a lot of motivation from management to achieve personal ans company goals together as One team One Dream.
cons: Not specifically, but equal opportunity is a concern from my personal point of view. Less opportunity in my region to earn, or to make an impact or name in the company with achievements. Efforts is same but rest is different in terms of incentives and achievements. Overall no big Cons
story: Motivation from seniors helped me to achieve more that my targets for 2019. I remember a phase where i was confused and was feeling low, while comparing myself with my colleagues. But one of the manager came into picture and he asked to concentrate on my work rather than concentrating on things which is not in my hand.

pros: Professional environment (Ethics), Women friendly (respect, safety & equality), Cultural interventions (Blaze, festival, special days), Pay on time.
cons: Basic cons are common when working in any firm, but i have not experienced any major flaws which requires attention. It feels safe & sound with Collabera.
story: World faced a massive environmental disaster which impacted the economical growth of every firm. There are several who lost their earning and are left jobless but i fell lucky and privileged that Collabera stood strong by keeping our job safe and secured. Collabera also made sure to pay full salary on time with not laying off 1 single employee. My family is proud for me taking home responsibilities single handed and heartily owe Collabera for this blessing. This proves Collabera serves their Clients and employees both passionately.

pros: This is my first job and I always thought its a big challenge to  work in a corporate world. But nothing happened like that, the environment and the culture is very good and I like working
cons: Nothing as I remember. Company has taken care of every aspects. If we talk about work culture or celebrating the festivals.
story:
The best thing is everyone is ready to help you and support you anytime.
When I had a bad day of even a bad month, there were everyone who supported and encouraged me. 
The best thing is I never felt down when it was my bad day because I had someone to support.  Also talking about the culture, never seen any festival going without celebration. Company definitely follow the rule i.e. "Work hard and play hard"

pros: Great team work, great people to work with, independence
cons: Most of the time my department doesn’t get noticed, the only people that get noticed or get shout outs/praise is sales and recruiting, management is inconsistent, and pay is inconsistent/sexist, not a lot of growth in my department, inconsistent or lack thereof performance reviews/engagement, low retention/high turnover, lack of training, management very impersonal.
story: My manager told the sales team that I engage with that if anyone does something they think is wrong to go to them first. My manager has a 1:1 on my schedule but since working from home hasn’t been doing the meetings. My manager set up a meeting with me and my counterpart and didn’t show and told us she forgot. I’ve been having computer vpn issues for a month and finally got a new computer and outlook doesn’t work, lack of response from IT. When the executive Vice President visited our office, he met with all the sales and recruiters but doesn’t bother meeting with anyone from my department because my job is to retain our contractors and keep them happy, I don’t bring in money/profit, I save our money when they are unhappy and ensure they finish their assignment successfully. My coworker in the same role as me who’s a guy makes more money than me and I’ve been in this role 3 years longer than him.

pros:
One of the main & the best reason for me to work at Collabera is my manager Nisha Gor. 
The freedom to work in your own creative way, lot of development & growth opportunities given both personal & professional. the way we celebrate all festivals at Collabera, haven't seen any other company in India doing it.
cons: umm difficult to think of any, but one thing is that one side of business  is given all the limelight and importance and other departments/teams are not given any important or least no matter how much they matter to the company.
story: I have been working with one the best AM's Kelsey Davies, her work day schedule and the way she partners with me & keeps everyone on toes to ensure we provide the best service to the consultants and the client, truly shows Collabera's value - Passionate to serve clients, employees etc.

pros: A beautiful and self-sustained work environment where the leadership goes above and beyond to care for your personal well-being beyond the office premises. They see that you get accustomed to the roles and responsibilities that are allotted to you and also to see that you acclimatize yourself to the cultural environment of Collabera.
cons: None at all. This is my first job and absolutely glad and feel privileged to be working with this organization.
story: It was my first Diwali at Collabera and was just the time when my Manager, Ingrid Nelson(no longer with Collabera) had flown down from US. I had come all decked up but was ready to work and was sitting besides her making keystrings and searching profiles to call candidates. She said, “Today is your day. You should go out there and celebrate. I know you are in the office but it is okay to not work for a while”. That struck me hard and it really meant a lot to me. She was never one to let us go without working but she also knew when we wouldn’t have to. Demonstrating one of our Collabera cultural values “Work hard, play hard” quite literally.

pros: Company give value to individual achievements, even small success is being applauded, great connect with the immediate supervisors help in making task easy, despite being in night shift all festivals are celebrated.
cons: Very low base salary compared to industry standards, one of our core value is slowly fading away that is work hard play hard(No more fun Friday, Team dinner or Talentika or Employee appreciation week...), We have same KRA/KPI for all regions/Recruiters (each region has different potential and different growing pace, we can't judge everything on same scale, hence a recruiter from a underdeveloped Region suffers throughout the year from incentive to salary due to low H1/H2 review rating),  work pressure leads to extended working hours
story: This is a Story when I won the Quarterly Award for the best recruiter in Q2 of 2017, it was my first time walking the Red carpet and I was the youngest recruiter in my team but I didn't thought much about myself in a building of over 1000 people or about the work that I have done and I never knew if anybody even knew of my existence but after the award ceremony there were like 100's of people who knew me shaking my hand I am getting calls from my onsite manager and DD’s it was a big thing or at least they made me feel it was a big deal, that shows how your achievements are being celebrated.

pros: Collabera's environment is totally freely, Always having high energy while doing daily task. With Good management and leadsership motivates all the time with High Josh
cons:
In my 2 years journey i haven't seen any Downside of working at Collabera.

story: They welcome new ideas that is the best thing I can say about Collabera.

pros: Main reasons to work at Collabera: Revolutionary journey & progress of the company in past decade, great clients to work with, strong internal culture & diversified teams, investment in development of employees & other areas.
cons: Heavy dependency on a few clients (need faster expansion model to win new/additional clients), no matching on 401K plans, too pricey family health insurance plan,
story:
1. Passion to excel has always been my work style, which resonate well with Collabera's cultural values.
In the beginning of my journey (as a recruiter), I was given a challenge of submitting 25 resumes/week. Not only I took that challenge but met/exceeded that target for 7 consecutive weeks, and received performer of the week accolade for all 7 weeks!
2. Excellence in execution: I was tasked to manage a large transition project with a very aggressive deadline; and with the help of my winner team we successfully completed transition of about 300 resources to Collabera within 4 months, with excellent client satisfaction & appreciation.
3. Work hard Play hard: Everyone needs an opportunity to show their personal side! I have won Collabera's Pumpkin Carving/Painting Competition twice in last two years in our regional office.

pros: There is opportunity to move up but only if you fit into the Right category. If you work really hard you will see success. You can be a change Maker here. We are not completely set in our ways so there is opportunity
cons: Very hard work, very long hours, can feel a glass Ceiling, high stress and anxiety about metrics. Not enough bandwidth on teams. Lack of urgency on people who offer solutions
story: We aplaud making sacrifices in our personal life to  an extreme degree. If a loved one is sick and a family is hit with extreme hardship we glorify the people who keep working instead of making them feel supported to take care of their family and get back to work when they are ready. We are expected to pick up when ever a Manager calls. Even late in evening when you could be spending time with a sick loved one. And if you don’t you are considered less than.

pros:
Collabera believes in people, we care and respect our employees and their needs.
We believe in working really hard, however, we've multiple extra-curricular opportunities
Very High Growth Opportunities.
Competitive Environment Makes It Interesting!
We don't give up just like that, we believe in creating a success story
It's easy to communicate with the leadership group
Appreciation in regards to the performance and effort an individual is putting is commendable
We believe in excellence
cons:
It seems a bit unfair with GBS and Corporate functions when their success stories are not shared with entire Collabera
On a smaller scale, there's favoritism, which at times results into disengagement
Some of mid-level delivery management are still working with the old mindset, wherein they're not ready to evolve with the new and advanced culture
story:
A race to reach the Blaze stage or to enter into PC or 10K club clearly shows how insanely competitive we're in a healthy manner
Day-in-day-out, we work with the recruiters whose performance is not upto the mark, we don't give up unless we've tried each and every possible way to enhance the same, shows we care about our employees
Various small scale competitions, Fun-Fridays, CPL, CVPL signifies our Work-Hard, Play-Hard Culture
And there're many more great examples!

One incident on an area of improvement side:
Recently, I won quarterly award and a friend of mine congratulated me with an Instagram story, due to which a Sales Manager of Collabera congratulated me for the same in-front of the Delivery team. 
Followed by the congratulations from various DM/ ADM/ LR, they mentioned, why isn't this shared with Delivery? We're never told who is winning which award! 
Maybe a little transparency between various functions in terms of achievements will really help!

cons: Well the only downside I have so far felt is the Work hours- 10 hrs, as we work night shifts (India), even an hour matters when it comes to spending time with family. Apart from being financially stable we also need to invest time emotional stability, and it's achieved through more quality time with family members, a lot of our stress just fades away with good time with family.
story: Well, I have always been loyal to workplace where respect/trust mirrors alongside. I have been into some emergencies at mid work place and had to rush over! All I needed to convey was - "I have an emergency", no questions asked, help offered and boom, I was where I had to be. Resect the trust factor and help taking care of priorities. These thing strike whenever you are stressed or an opportunity strikes and have dual thoughts.

pros: I think that unlike other firms, Collabera believes in engaging with each employees giving them equal opportunities and making sure to up-bring them to make their future.
cons: Sometimes, the pressure is too much. This work from home has resulted into too much micro-management which is not healthy for a person and results in demotivation.
story: In my previous team, they attributed Collabera's values when it came to my work. I remember my Lead and my Manager used to make sure that we dont get demotivated while working so we worked diligently and then had fun diligently. This freshened us up, kept the team spirit going and created a great environment to work in. I don't see this happening now.

pros:
Our Reputation in market
Our cultural values
Our initiatives (Specifically most recent training programs)
Our Leaders
cons:
Consideration of just Numbers (Same targets in pandemic situation- no relaxation)
Loss of money/incentives everytime due to new plans/load factor/restructuring incentive plans, etc.
story: This is my first job after my Master's degree in 2015. If I compare my first year at Collabera, when I was struggling to get a single hire with my current spot where I got success to maintain magical number 10K(Trying to hit PC), everything was possible due to Collabera's Culture and Values. In 2015, Collabera gave me a golden chance of proving myself by putting me in PIP program when I over achieved my target by 800%. I learnt how to be insanely competitive, providing better service to clients/candidates by improving myself to create a better version of mine each day, working and playing hard & smart at each step in a disciplined way. These things have been always helping me to grow professionally & personally. I believe all these things will be helping me in future as well to achieve my goals.

pros: I feel like my voice gets heard and that my opinion is valued. I have worked with 4 different managers and I've had the opportunity to grow and manage myself within the given work environment without feeling helpless. The commission is just okay now but I know it will get better as I have see success for myself within this company.
cons: I recently moved offices and started working with a new team. The first few months were challenging. Moving from an enterprise to a regional team has it's differences. But overall, I'm happy here. And I love WFH.
story: Responsiveness - one of our core values. This is an attribute I feel I have and it's part of my whole experience here with Collabera. I made several connections with my clients in one state and most of the time I didn't get a successful hire. However, my relationship was strong because of my responsiveness and willingness to help with whatever my client needed. When I moved to a different state, one of my past relationships gave me a referral. This new referral turned into a new client and I received my first five hires since I started working with my new team 5 months ago. I truly believe that kindness, willingness to help, and being responsive is what matters to our client. And in turn, the commission helps too.

pros: Cultural, multiple avenues to take up new responsibilities, freedom to share ideas and lead initiatives, friendly colleagues

story: Every day we come across people who go above and beyond. Most recently my team took a product from concept to reality in 3 weeks. Every member of the team contributed immensely to make it happen to help business.

story: We are very welcoming to hew hires in the office. We take them to lunch on their first day and usually have welcome to Collabera happy hour. My last company definitely did not do this.

pros: Coming from a different work background, I would describe my journey as a learning one and in the end a fruitful. I admire how my hard work has been appreciated at every stage and my leaders who have supported me to achieve it. Working with Collabera, I feel like a true professional which helps me behave mannerly in other aspects of life as well
cons: Even though there is appreciation given at every stage, I feel based on an individuals tenure, their opinions/suggestions should be considered for the betterment of the organization. Also one's past remuneration and title should not be considered while offering a job after analyzing the individual thoroughly. I have seen people coming back to with such suggestions and is my personal experience as well. Another thing that can be inculcated is TRUST. I feel that my piers do not trust me on my decisions made even though they turn out to be fruitful.
story:
I recently received the below email from one of my client VMO team member and I feel is the right story to share:
"I am very happy that Collabera made it through the rationalization and will be continuing their relationship with Conduent. 
 
As you know I very much enjoy working with you because of your friendly, prompt, accurate followup and knowledge/adherence to our processes...but really what makes Collabera stand out is their high fill rate, quick response times and building relationships with managers. I feel that Collabera would not be as successful in the program as they are without you - so keep up the great work!"

This email clearly highlights the Collabera values which I have given a face to.
Insanely Competitive: Collabera was always part of every challenge given by this client.

Responsive Beyond Imagination: This is something that Collabera has taught me from day 1 and I have been appreciated for it time and again by the clients. Once again in the statement above from the VMO, "quick response times".

Passionate to service clients and employees: Always the number 1 priority for me taught again by Collabera ("building relationships with managers")

Work Hard Play Hard: We worked hard for this account and got rewarded by making it to the final 8 list in the recent rationalization for the same client ("I am very happy that Collabera made it through the rationalization and will be continuing their relationship with Conduent")

Disciplined in Execution: Always treated the client with respect and never took anything for granted. This is the primary reason there has been no escalation for the last 3 years for this client.

story: Recently due to Covid, we made a decision to take pay cuts across the entire management cadre so as to minimize the business impact and prevent layoffs. This I think encapsulates why people stay on at Collabera. Even during past recessions we banded together and did not lay off people because we knew that when the market turned around these were the same folks that we stood by the Company in good times and bad.

story: When I joined Collabera back in 2015, I would've never thought of staying for 5 years. There wasn't a single day in the last 5 years where the work was monotonous. The company strongly believes in change. My own personal values have grown alongside Collabera's own of adapting to change. From working on the ground level to handling a team as a manager, this has been a great experience.

story: Collabera has given me the best platform to grow and analyze my skills to the top level. Also it has helped me become a better person. For me Collabera is the my very own company and I see ways and out how to make myself most useful in the growth of the company. Collabera's culture and environment has given me the vibes, that I am a part of it and has recognized me to the top level.

story:

story:
Disciplined in Execution & Insanely competitive:

I will go back to the days I was managing Toronto as a business owner and not as a DM, because I created all the tools and online portal for Collabera working hand in hand with AppDev team and Operations, it was one thing that has helped my team to do better at work and also they were able to do multi-tasking like other US recruiters.
The second story is when we got CN as a client, we have worked very hard which helped us to be a top-4 vendor list from total 34 vendors, It was only possible because of the motivation to see the account grow and also to see myself growing in this fast-moving industry.
Work Hard Play Hard- I have had a pleasure of hiring the best talent for my team and also I have a record in Baroda with no attrition as I balance work & personal zone which helps all of to be better at work.
All the people hired by me are still part of our family & that's all I have as an earning :)

pros:
1. Associated with Collabera, I am into serving the humans with a way to earn their bread. It gives me happiness when I am able to provide a job to a deserving person which in turn will act as the source of bread-butter earning. 

2. It gives a proud feeling to work with Collabera, a company which is the market leader and a trend-setter in the staffing industry. 

3. One always wants that the company he/she is working, should value its employees. Collabera stands to this statement. I as a Collabera employee has witnessed this during the COVID pandemic. The company announced that no lay-off would be done, no salary deductions would be made. This gives a happy feeling and satisfaction that I am associated with a firm which not only says but proves by actions when it comes to valuing employees. 

4. The open and always charged work culture, with nearly same age-groups working with you, the energy that one can feel in the company campus is something which you won't find in other companies. I have my many friends working in spreaded IT companies and while discussing with them, I feel that they all are lacking the atmosphere which Collabera has in its offices.
cons:
1. Working with Collabera somewhat hampers the social life. I feel that there is no social life after the working hours, it might be due to the night working shift because of which the majority of the daytime is spent in sleeping. 
The same thing happens on weekend too.

2. I personally feel that until now, people in India relate a night job to "Call Center/BPO" only, and this makes a task of explaining what our job is about, a bit tough. 

3. I won't say it as a downside but when works with Collabera, the open ground and the opportunities that he/she gets while working in Collabera vanishes when you switch to any other competitor company. In any other company you feel tied to some rope. This shows the working environment that Collabera provides.
story:
It was during July end of 2019 when heavy rains lashed Vadodara. Complete city was flooded within hours. Me and my manager too were among many who were stranded in the city, far from home, away from office. Some who managed to reach the office were working to keep the business going. 

Me and my manager were stuck in the flooded water till midnight, after which we somehow managed to our home. 
For the next 3 days, due to continuous rains, we were locked in our homes. Employees were not able to reach our office. During that time, many managers and senior leadership of Collabera was on the ground working like hell to carry employees to the office. They were running their cars continuously picking up employees from their locations and bringing them to the office. 

This showed the company's culture of valuing its employees. The company would have easily deducted the salary of those employees who failed to make it to the office in those floods. But Collabera lived to make the culture a truth and not just a saying. 
********************************

The second experience is from the lockdown that was imposed from Mar - May during the COVID situation. Majority of the Collabera employees are not local to Vadodara and announcement of a sudden lockdown created panic among the people. Everything was closed, whether it be rations, medical, logistics! 
Although the Indian corporate world was gradually shifting to the WFH culture at that time but as Collabera never did a WFH ever so we weren't sure about it. 

But sensing the situation, company shifted to WFH within 2 days. The complete Vadodara management was on toes to implement WFH without any problem. 

Not stopping at this, Collabera also came as a savior for those who were not local to Vadodara and were facing severe food related problems as all the shops, public canteens, supermarkets, ration supply was closed. 
During that time, Collabera arranged for a regular meal service for the interested employees. The company also provided facility for any needed ration supplies. 

Also, the company announced that the job security would be taken care of. This announcement sparked a feeling of trust and safety among the employees during those very dark unprecedented times.
