pros: There is a lot of recognition and praise of achievements by peers, managers, and other individuals within offices/teams. For birthdays, promotions, all time highs, new hires, more subs, etc. Not much goes unnoticed.
cons: Non-comprehensive and inconsistent training. AAMs are taught nothing of workflows, how to do specific (yet very basic) tasks on Metal, how to enter leads, and so forth. It's a very very long list.
story: I honestly can't think of one because as soon as I think of a good experience to use there's a bad one as well. I think there are many things Collabera does well, however, many employees feel as though they're just a number. We need to be more quality driven, not quantity driven. By having higher quality sourcing we will have more quality candidates and then even more hires than we currently do with overly-stressed high volume producing lack luster results.

pros: Some best reasons are - the exposure to different kind of jobs and industries, the work culture environment, strong network, learning updated technology, no limited work – there is always a chance of exploration to different departments, the happiness of finding the right talent for innovating client’s businesses, & last but not the least feel-good factor to work in a space where we’re making people’s lives better.
cons: Some downsides can be – it’s a cutthroat competition between the agencies and so it’s a highly competitive and target-oriented structure to everyone at every stage working there; which can sometimes lead to hectic arguments and stressful days. Rigorous working hours, as there isn’t any flexibility of working from home usually in normal scenarios. (Albeit, company has been very supportive during COVID-19)
story: I remember talking to one of my managers and expressing how I wanted to grow in the company and how I wanted to add my expertise the best. I am glad how the manager listened to me and help me route the best options available instead of thinking that he/she may lose one of the performing persons from their own team. The manager was very supportive which helped me to be where I am right now. Thank you.

pros: First of all the Work Environment of Collabera is Great. And there are managers who are supportive sometimes and the best part is Collabera knows how to take care of their employees in good and bad both times.
cons: Sometimes we have lot of pressure of work but we need support and motivation from our managers. And unfortunately sometimes we don't get it.. Healthy work environment and relationship is most important to work together.
story: There are lot many things. On the daily basis the routine followed by employees given by collabera is itself the example of the same.

pros:
At work, it never felt as if we worked at night.  Lively environment.
Pay package is decent
Challenging tasks at times
Good facilities and security
No nonsense attitude
Continuous training and development 
Monthly awards and recognition to keep the staff motivated
cons:
Frequent change of processes
Difficult to get work done - due to non-responsiveness of internal teams
Portal/Websites need to be fixed - so as to save time
People management
story:
The story that comes to mind is during the start of the Pandemic when Collabera took it up to keep the staff safe.  Hats off to the entire team to get the IT, logistics etc who arranged to get everyone working from home that fast.

PC's where shipped at home, VPN's installed on personal laptops and all were up and running within no time.

This shows dedication on the part of Collabera and teams

pros: I have met the greatest, most out-going people. I have also learned so much from my director.
cons: management in my department (besides our director) is poor. they are not supportive, communicative, or helpful.
story: Last summer during employee appreciation week, our whole team (even those who weren't a part of culture committee) came in early/stayed late every day of the week (not including the preparation before the week itself, to decorate and set up. Even though it's decorations and fun games, we served the employees. Everything included was to make the employees feel special and appreciated, and I think going above & beyond for others is something huge to recognize.

pros: Meeting new people through your work. Also I feel like I have learned a lot about business as a whole and how to gain new business.
cons: The way issues/short comings are handled are inappropriately in my opinion. Sometimes feels like I’m in high school again.
story: It has made me get out of my comfort zone, which is amazing!

pros: Helps to build self confidences, communications skills, behavioral skills. Helps to understand own responsibilities. Getting appraisal of good work that motivates to work more and more.
cons: As per gov. rule company working hours are 8, but we are working for 10 - 11 hours a day. So, Working hours are very stressful at times. Also, there should be some physical gaming activity for every employee of Collabera once in a week.
story: Collabera is wonderful place to work with. Proud to be part of Collabera family. Every festivals or functions at the best. Collabera always runs on "work while you work, Play while you play" moto so that's the best thing.

pros: The culture & opportunity. Enjoying your coworkers & spending time with coworkers makes the job positive.
cons: Strong emphasis on metrics. The metrics in place are necessary to an extent. however, i don’t think metrics are an accurate reflection of hard work or passion about the job. i think that if we were at least somewhat set up for success, metrics wouldn’t be as necessary.
story: I love spending time with my coworkers at happy hours/events. we are all close & bond over work & non work related circumstances. On a negative side, the large emphasis on metrics can be extremely stressful & isn’t an accurate reflection of effort & passion.

pros:
It's a competitive environment here that promotes healthy competition and encourages you to bring out the best in your work daily. 

There is a lot of interaction involved with Onshore-Offshore teams that not only helps to build bridges for more efficient delivery but also makes people culturally aware. 

Collabera as a brand has a very good reputation as compared to many other staffing firms. It's in the top 20 staffing firms list in the US. So, this definitely adds value to me as a recruiter and helps me build a rapport with my candidates faster. 

The values that Collabera follows are very progressive and it will make sense to anyone who believes in evolving and growing. Not just surviving. 

There are training programs not just to make you a better recruiter but also a better person by fine-tuning your abilities to interact, approach, decide & react to situations that you can easily relate to in your daily life. 

They have daily/weekly/monthly shoutouts and RnR meetings to celebrate and discuss success stories. So no good work goes unnoticed. This keeps people pumped all round the calendar. Attractive goodies will also be showered upon you if you perform exceptionally well. 

At Collabera everyone is on a first-name basis - STRICTLY. While its a professional thing that every other firm will agree to be following but that's not true. But in Collabera this is actually practiced and no one gets offended if you do not address them as Sir/Maam. 

There are many more Pro's but these are a few that popped up right away.
cons:
You can not give your 100% every single day. As its a competitive environment, days when you are emotionally or physically low it becomes stressful to do your work and you hate your work on those days. 

10 hours shift (50 hours weekly) is too much. You work 7-8 hours and rest 2-3 hrs you just wait to pass. For someone who is very fast and does the work in 7 hrs that someone else needs 10 hours to complete, it becomes very frustrating to wait a couple of hours just to clock your daily shift hours. 

Promotions only after you complete 2 years in the company. In extremely rare cases you get an early promotion. I personally haven't witnessed any rare cases yet. 

If the region you are hired for has slow-moving clients or new clients then you are doomed. You will find yourself in various performance enhancement plans leading to terminations within 1 year. 

Recruiter Spread target sometimes feels unrealistic as its equal for all. So doesn't matter what process/direct client, the region you work for, what your cost to the company is, the target is the same.
story: Collabera never stops, sleeps, or backs out. It has a fighting spirit and no matter what the size of trouble it, Collabera always moves forward. The DNA that Collabera has makes it operate at optimal efficiency all the time. Its sales team always wants to do more for the client and the delivery is anxious to exceed 100% quality. With such a team you can never fail. People are trained, shown how it's done, taught to break records and there is nothing mediocre here.

pros: Collabera is my first Family since i spend my most of the time in office while i am awake. I love the work culture in Collabera
cons:
There is nothing downsides for Collabera, 
Collabera always
story: The best experience would be always on time - passionate to serve,  when we receive our salary on time.

pros:
In the past: liked the people/team, work culture, transparency and rigor
Cant say the same anymore
cons:
Internal challenges w.r.t. group integrations and co-operation
Fake work relationships
Over the top behavior
story:
Positive:
Coming together to get the customer proposal/submission across the line. Even after working long/extended/weekend hours didnt feel the stress
Negative:
Regional offices are over the top and people are fake

pros: Employees are appreciated and rewarded and recognized in timely manner. Keeps us boosted for work
cons: During this tough ime, when a company feeds me and my family by regular salaries in timely manner, I could never think of something like that
story: Company though process of blend of work and fun, makes lively atmosphere at work. Fun activities, activities included in exiling in your work, Rewards to accomplishments of task. Transparency of company with each and every individual member. Amazing place to work for

pros:
1. Collabera's work culture and supporting managers.
2. The reward system for the acknowledgement of performance.
3. Encouragement and mentorship towards oneself by managers in my team.
cons:
Works hours tend to go beyond 10 hours a day,
Keeping the KRA's of an individual irrespective of challenging region and the skill sets they work on.
story:
I remember when i got my first hire, it was celebrated on the team like i won olympics, and all the consecutive hires were celebrated like they are my first.

This culture of collabera keeps us motivated to give our best and go an extra mile.

pros:
The work culture and Environment. The people here are quite friendly and always there to help. You can learn some new things from every new person you meet.
The managers here don't treat you like you are someone working under them, they are more like friends or rather I should say Family.
cons: the shift timings gets extended a lot sometimes. and the working hours get increased by more than 12 hours at times. Food is something which I don't like provided at Collabera Canteen, personally. Cab Service is also something missing here as sometimes it’s difficult to get Public transport.  Rest everything is Pretty perfect
story:
Festivals are something I love to be celebrated at Collabera House. It makes you feel like you are at home. 
Good food, sweets, decor and lights you have everything. This is how we Collaberites celebrate Diwali. And music is always there to double the happiness
Employee appreciation week, abbreviated as EAW is the best here because it includes everything again and each and every employee of Collabera is being appreciated.

pros: I joined Collabera for the brand that it holds ,also it gives me a soothing feeling to get attached with a Company like this,I like the overall refreshing environment of the company which not drags you only towards a monotonic working environment but provides you an overall personal grooming to show your talent and grow in different aspects.
cons: I think though Collabera is a brand name which is more prominent in the sector of staffing industries comparative to other staffing companies but the pay structure needs an improvement ,the basic pay should be increased a bit higher as per looking at the company's revenue.
story:
Positive : Collabera has proved each and every individual to show their talent in their own way,thus they ensure that if you are not performing in a specific field they will try to help you out with an alternatives to prove yourself ,That I would really appreciate.In my case I can relate to it as I converted from Proactive to Reactive

Negative : There is bit more layers involved in between and still transparency is needed to improved at some level ,like In my case equity and equality should be kept in mind while assigning a favor to an individual.Just a bit of change can improve a lot in between an employee and the management :)

pros: Passion and drive. Even when you are at your low, there are so many people to drive you away from the lows.
cons: Work from home has been making me work extended hours.
story: Readiness to deal with any and every challenge with a positive frame work. I don't have a particular example to share here as it is simply every day that we and our managers are driven to taken on any challenge.

pros:
Best in class when it comes to IT staffing.
Given me all the platform / tools / knowledge / education to grow personally as well professionally !
I am proud to be a part of Collabera
cons:
Nightshift :( As I am married now, sometimes its tought to manage)
Low Incentives
Long working hours
story:
I remember the incident where our Executive sponsorer in one of Happy Hour meeting with sales and delivery offered the service of snacks & drinks to each and everyone by himself and given respect in a way that u all deserve this and I remember he was having so much fun with each one of us and was very down to earth!

Work Hard ! Play Hard :)

pros: So far its been wonderful journey, I have seen lot of ups and downs but Collabera gave me strength how to bounce back with all odds, I feel so happy when Collabera recognises our work and efforts and they often conduct events just to make sure employees are not bored abouth the work and Im loving my job at Collabera and will continue give my 100% towards it.
cons: So far my only and only concern is regarding pay scale, because lot of us are facing these challenges, and sometimes people judge about our work without knowing the exact situation and start comparing about the performances
story: I feel lucky that I got an opportunity to work in Collabera, they encourage all the employees and often they conduct events and the knowledge that collabera provides is tremendous but compare to the outside market my only concern is with pay scale and bit more work pressure

pros: Best reason to work at Collabera is the working environment here, and also supportive colleagues.
cons: Working here in Collabera has made me realized that keeping work-life balance is difficult.
story: Collabera's culture of celebrating the smallest achievement is the best thing I have experienced, it actually gives you enthusiasm to work better, and give your best.

pros: The best thing is culture and opportunities provided to each individual no matter where he is in the hierarchy. Any individual have multiple opportunities to prove his metal and get rewarded for the same.
cons: Sometime long working hours, I personally feel overwhelmed with work sometime. Very high expectations from every single individual.
story: The presidents club best exemplifies Collabera's culture of awarding and rewarding the best individuals. This is an extremely prestigious platform and the take away is again something I haven't seen in any other organisation in the Staffing Industry.

pros: From the days of Ivory Building to CH1 & CH2, Collabera has always proven that how much caring & love they have towards there employees. Collabera is like a 2nd home to me.
cons: Individuals have to blame themselves on there performances if they are not able to get what they desire. Its a perfect place to work.
story: Well, don't ask me :) As I have expressed my feelings that Collabera is my 2nd Home. Best example would be our present situation - COVID19. Its definitely a nightmare to experience no raise in salary for which we work throughout the year, But also not to deny the fact that we still have our jobs. Paying my Bills & taking care of family without any financial distractions.

pros: The company's culture is one thing I would like to mention here which would be the best reason for me to work with Collabera
cons: Sometimes the targets given to you gets alot that it gets a bit on the downsides to work
story: Collabera tends to keep everyone together, whether it is a downfall or a good time. It understands the emotions of its staff.

pros: amazing co-workers, great pay and benefits, feels like family
cons: The AAM metrics are slightly unrealistic as you progress
story: I recently had a bad health scare and every person in the office checked in on me. Truly a family that cares.

pros: I have an experience of almost 2 years working as a an assistant manager at T.I.M.E. but I was not appreciated there for my work much and I wanted to a change and Collabera with all its ways to appreciate us is amazing and one of the main reasons I plan here to stay for long. It keep you going, motivated and what else do we need to perform better? In addition to this, I also was attracted with the big brand name, of course and I see it now how all of my mates have been working so hard to maintain that.
cons: Umm, I can't think of anything in specific but for me I guess I should be given more work related to my strong qualities which I'm not getting as of now. Let's blame COVID. I'm content with what I'm doing, learning new things but I also want to be a part of doing something more creative which I don't see happening here.
story:
I like the POB's, the performance meet theme ideas, the lucky draw box it is all so amazing!!!! The culture of motivation, appreciation is all I need!!!
Helping each other is the least we can do and I'm fortunate to have so many such people around me. To be honest, I did not think initially that I would be able to fit in here but I guess things are working in our favor. :)

pros: Helping Seniors and very talented managers , also the support and work environment
cons: There are nothing as such , Just sometimes the work Stretches the shift which tends to become more hectic taking a toll on health
story: A Positive goal oriented , Target focussed and a demanding culture from the Employees, Yet promising as well.

pros: The culture at Collabera is awesome. It feels like home away from home. The
cons: The salary is way too low for an employee in Baroda office. Work life balancing becomes difficult if you are too passionate about your work is what I feel.
story: When my mother came to visit my office from outside our AVP saw her outside with me and he knew how curious my mom would be to see where I work and how we work. He immediately asked me to take her inside the premises and then called my then manager (who was on leave that day) to attend her. I felt so gratified by this expression. It showed how they care about their employees & their families.

pros: Team work and if any one is facing some problem with their work some or the other one will be there to guide them in a correct way not only within the team even other team members will help each other.
cons: I don't think so any down sides while working with Collabera
story: As I was a new join my team members are so helpful to me and if any one is facing some problem with their work some or the other one will be there to guide me in a correct way not only within the team even other team members will help each other.

pros:
The first reason I know for sure is the system of everything how Collabera works. 
I joined Collabera not as a fresher but as a tenured guy so in the initial days my mind automatically kept comparing my last company and Collabera, very soon I subconsciously and consciously I realized that Collabera is much better.
cons: For me the one of the cons would be the work hours, as the work hours is of 10 hrs shift which is fine by me but what I do not like is the pressure of working extra hours to finish the tasks. I mean its already 10 hrs of work which is more but the pressure of extending still more is what I do not like.
story: Initially when I started with Collabera, I did not know anyone except for my manager whom I spoke with him in the interview. So one day I was feeling really lonely in the office, I was in training I looked around then I say everyone working so hard while having some kind of a happy expression on their faces. I was wondering how is it that they are so much enjoying their work. Then I took a break to have coffee, my manager joined me. We went upstairs and he spoke to me in a real nice way asking about my goals in life, what are my plans to achieve that, then he spoke about how Collabera supports employees, he spoke about his journey. It was really amazing to have that conversation with him. Then I realized how people working here are so much enjoying their work because Collabera helps people in achieving their personal goals in life as well.

pros: Collabera is a best platform to grow if you have true desire to succeed as you will get a great support and opportunities here to grow.
cons: Nothing like cons I felt so far about Collabera. only, the working hours which get stretched so longer i.e. everyday 11 to 12 hours which everybody can't like.
story: Initially, I was selected to work with Accenture Team but due to COVID-19, there were very less requirements coming in for that account. Due to which I was not deployed in the team even if they wanted me to take in the team looking at my performance. So the management decided to give me another team & there also happened the same that no new recruiter was needed & I got again new team & again happened the same and finally I got deployed to the 4th team. So, the thing here is, even in this critical situation of COVID, Collabera offered me several opportunities to grow which shows that Collabera cares for his employees. It is truly impressive to be a part of such an organization. A humble thanks to Collabera!!

pros: The very first reason in Work atmosphere and second reason is appreciation that you get by leaders for your efforts/success.
cons: I haven't seen any downsides of working at Collabera.
story: Currently, I am working with Data Refreshment project and there our lead has started a counter to make us feel competitive towards our daily targets.

pros: One of the best reason to work at Collabera is the money on the table. The second reason is the work environment and the my love of working at night.
cons: I have no such downside which I can think of having to work with Collabera. Initially I felt a bit odd regarding the time shifts but once I got to know about managing the time and food, it's all good now.
story: The best experience I had is after my training period, when I was deployed to my team. The work my team mates had put in and the level which they have set makes me work even harder to keep up with them. And I remember one thing which my manager told me on my first meeting with him, "Always be hungry, because the day you aren't that would be the last day of recruiting."

pros: Collabera has given me complete freedom to carve my own destiny. As a high level account manager, my leaders have allowed me to sell and operate at a high level of ambiguity without too much hand holding (as long as I maintain a high level of integrity)
cons: Operationally we still have some growing pains (but that is natural in a large company encroaching on a billion dollars).
story:
First, I think that Collabera is still building a culture, but the below culture is the one that I think we are building towards.

Selfishly, I have gotten a chance to be responsible for a number of promotions of AAM's, due to the business that I have brought in. But not just because they had the opportunity to work on my business, but because I guided them through it, and dedicated my time to teaching them. I think the mentor program is one that should not be overlooked, and we may lose our identity if we do not continue to foster that. I would love to go into more detail about my thoughts in this realm if the opportunity presented itself.

pros: My  reason to work with Collabera is  Brand Name , Promises are fulfilled , Good Work environment and It helps to reach your next level in your Carrier
cons: There is no down sides so far as my knowledge . But there are some Partiality is happening within the team like Team members are not measured in the same scale , Language discrimination etc
story:
Positives
1. Strong leadership Team
2. Training the employees as per the future recruitment cycle 
3.Promises are fulfilled

pros: Collabera is my first job, I could not think any better organization to start than collabera. The culture values and work environment is amazing. The encouragement that employee receives for every small and big achievement is what makes this place different and incredible.
cons: Collabera being an US IT staffing firm we do not get Indian holidays. I am not able to think any specific downsides working at collabera, I enjoy working here.
story: In this short spam of time with collabera I have seen and felt always positive culture in collabera. I had to go on a long unplanned break to my home due to serious family emergency. At that time my lead was very supportive towards me, this ultimately shows how much Collabera values there employees.

pros: I worked in Recruiting background before, but after jioining Collabera I feel like now I am with a company which is well known and reputed, which feels like joining my name to it for a lifetime.
cons: By my personal side, decision making sills and more time consuming taks, is the work which I do, slowly and gradually, I believe, I will learn.
story: Last week, I was working on an IT role, I am not from a technical background so I never got a change to learn IT terminologies, my immediate manager helped me out understanding the role in and out also giving some particular personal tips as, how to learn and undestand IT roles fast, this always keeps me motivating. This is the Cultural Value: Responsive and looking to find answer to every question, which I think is strongly followed in my team.

pros: I really came to know what responsiveness means here at Collabora and how fast you have to work to beat the competition. :)
cons: Sometimes due to this insanely competitive atmosphere, individuals feel pressurised & we don't want that especially in times like these (corona)
story: Me as a recruiter, what I felt is that if you bring something amazing on to the table then you would be highly appreciated and that motivates a recruiter to achieve more :)

pros: I think the best reasons for working at collabera are my team members. I love going to work to see them and have made friendships that will last a lifetime.
cons: Not all departments are treated fairly or get the same praises as others. Management in my group does not know how to delegate tasks appropriately.
story: My coworkers and I got a large project during quarantine that had to be complete in one day and we could not have done it all ourselves so our other team members volunteered and helped us complete it. They rescheduled tasks so that they could help us even though they didn’t have to.

pros: Working environment is very cool, When I need any support for any level I get it, Provide best opportunity for growth
cons: permanent and contract person are not same for collabera,
story: When I join the collabera, I am not aware of the collaberas culture. It celebrate the festivals, days, birthdays, ect. For Example, In a women's day, collabera was celebrate that day with all female employees.

pros: The professional growth and grooming i was looking for i got in collabera. People here are very much professional  and behave nicely it as organization known for Employee friendly nature and team mates the leaders mentors are nice. In all a nice place to work with good and sound atmosphere.
cons: To be honest i did not felt any such drawbacks or downside of collabera it a healthy environment to work with.
story: Have recently completed my 2 Years with Collabera family and consider myself fortunate that i am part of this organisation i have grown a lot learnt a lot and it had been wonderful experience here. The culture the environment which collabera gives to its employee its amazing really awesome.

pros: The best reason to work with Collabera is only due to its Employee friendly relationship and providing a platform to learn and develop. Scope to learning is  greater level and giving value to its employees. Priortizing on concept of "Employees first then Organization"
cons: The growth here very slow as compared to any other firm with similar work culture. Salary hike also very less  and business culture is totally unpredictable and the only way earn more is get more hires highly dependent on the nature of client, business which is a highly vulnernable factor (Like; layoffs,paycuts and termination andmany more). Schedule is heitic no more matter you have carry to your individual targets along with organization goals and additional role.
story: I think , Pandemic situation is the best example to explain the cultural values of Collabera, when the decision was made to make everyone to work from home, the manner the set up was made provided to enable us to work from home clearly represents the responsive beyond imagination

pros:
Work - Ethics and professionalism.
Corporate life of Collabera is good.
cons:
Extended working hours or working in weekend.
Work load or pressure is a bit high.
story:
Nice work ethics and environment.
Celebrates one success.
Need to be more employee centric.

pros: Provides enough growth opportunities, very co-operative people.
cons: Nothing as I've across yet, will definitely share once I witness.
story: Competitiveness one of the major key element of Collabera which precisely aligns with the values I praise and appreciate. Working in a competitive environment brings out the best in you, it makes you more cautious and aware. Helps to our tasks in the best way possible.

pros: Indeed a great work environment, great competition among people, and will be surrounded by amazing people who would be ready to teach you beyond what you actually need to learn and know and the best part is you will be always appreciated and recognized for your work.
cons: People sometimes take the competitions on a personal level which is just to enhance own self. So that should definitely be not there.
story: I have had a great time till now. So, there were 3 openings for one position(skill set I was alien to). I thought and worked really hard to fill all the 3 positions single handed. And when I did, I was appreciated right there. So, efforts, your hardwork would never ever go in vain. Here, In Collabera, you'll be recognized. I had an amazing time on Blaze where "people are celebrated". Additionally, I have a team here, who helps me to understand every bit of recruiting. Specifically, If I talk about how C2C works, all the VISAs and the documents which are required. It's been 10 months now, but I don't hesitate, neither do they judge, infact they'll let me know more about it and how everything works knowing that it's been quite few months I have been doing the same job and should have known. So, definitely I am surrounded by those amazing people.

pros: Best platform to make career, multiple opportunities to learn and grow. Collabera's culture, its always fun and happy atmosphere here.
cons: There is actually none such. It has always been good here actually great. The best fact is that every one here get equal opportunity to step up for their dream goal.
story: There was a down time when i was not able to perform good. At that critical time Collabera supported me very much. My team asked my about my challenges and helped me. Collabera gave me opprtunities to grow and made me believe myself.

pros: The work culture and the people you work with is very important and there's no other company I would've worked with except for Collabera. I love how people make it a better place for us to work and also cooperate with us,
cons: I dont think there are any to be honest but yes, I do have one tiny issue. Since we work night shifts and do not know how to drive, it is very difficult for me to commute from my place to the office. If Collabera could provide a cab service for ladies that would have been great. This is not a downside but I thought I would point this out. Nothing apart from this I see is a problem.
story:
One of the most favorite and important aspect is responsive beyond imagination. I take it too seriously. In my daily life I tend to follow that and I get really bothered if someone's not even aware of the fact that they should be at least responsive. 
One day I saw a person asking for directions to a particular place, a few didn't know but everyone around him kept ignoring him and didn't answer that they didn't know where the place was. I went upto him, googled the location and helped him with the directions.
If I look at this as a collabera employee, I see that I not only responded him ("Responded beyond imagination") but also the act also meant that I was passionate to serve him which in collabera's culture, one of the value is "passionate to serve our clients and employees".

pros: Improves personality and overall growth. Best company to work for when we think of working in staffing industry and heard about best incentives plans the company have.
cons: The interaction between Onshore \ Offshore teams is less, which creates a communication gap. So this is a downside what i think can be improved at some point.
story: If i talk about work hard \ Play hard is the best principle that I think suits me, I saw the downfall in my performance in year 2019, whatever been the reason, so instead of giving up, I kept myself motivated  and worked day in \ day out which results in giving me good results. I changed my team and worked on understanding new team & client, gave my time where i was lacking and improved myself at those part.

pros: There is always so much to learn, Training and courses over CCL are very helpful
cons: One should remember that in the race of getting our goal achieved we don't compromise with Organization goal.
story: Collabera always believes in recognizing the achievement which keeps people motivated and push to perform better, this is what i remember where i have seen people clapping in office when somebody achieved their targets

pros: Intriguing,exciting, and full of surprises every day,when i start to work collabera is full of surprises and its the best office atmosphere that you could ever find.
cons: i want the office to start ASAP,because i'm missing the working office atmosphere.

pros: Collabera's reinvestment in us and the cultural values, drive and consistent leadership interaction is the best reason to stay with Collabera! The message is always personal and inspiring.
cons: Collabera's focus sometimes to improve themselves, is with competitive companies I would never work for. This is a challenge but blessed we usually work through it. Also the AAM program is great, but not at the alignment level to Enterprise level Clients. We need some market value and retaining valuable employees!
story: My very first day, I was flown kand broughtt to the hub market office for that client I would be supporting. The fact that Collabera invested in me in my first week, without proving anything to them first, made me a loyalist on day 1!

pros: Collabera provides a significant platform to learn, grow, and develop. I enjoy and love my work, and that's the biggest motivation for me to work with Collabera. I strongly believe in collabera values and in some way they resonate with my identity.
cons: Less base salary and earning opportunity in DHR, Collabera. Long work hours(No one forces but I tend to work 12-15 hours on most of the weekdays). I think I require a strong work-life balance and spend more personal time with friends and family.
story: One of my account managers would answer my queries on emails at 12 am PST. (Responsive beyond imagination). I had some doubts and I dropped him an email in the middle of the night. To my surprise, he responded within 2 minutes AND also checked with the client regarding the same update at 12 am PT. He will always respond to all the emails/calls within less than five minutes. He is passionate about serving clients and believes in work hard play hard policy. He has been an enormous inspiration to me. Huge shout out to Mike Anderson from DHR. He is the BEST!

story:
Insanely Competitive:

The offer came and due to strong relationship we were able to smoothly deliver the candidate. That candidate is still working and it's been almost 3 years now.

pros: The best part working with Collabera is, its an employee centric company. We value our employees irrespective of level/designation and give equal opportunity to everyone. We provide the best conducive environment to our people wherein while working they are also getting the opportunity to enhance their learning curve. We have the world class Leadership group, Process oriented, Rewards & Recognition Program, Professional Environment, Employee Friendly Environment, The passion to drive, Responsiveness, Customer centric Business strategy, Strong Diversity Ethics, Stife growth curve for the performers, the list is endless but the most important part is when I'm at work in Collabera I feel like home.
cons: Nothing that I can think of and neither have any notion that any of the Collabera employee even think in that way. We all have our ups and down but we all stand together like a one big happy family.
story: There are many such example but one of the most important which actually helped me during my initial days and made to stick with Collabera family, even though there was many other better offers were there. I relocated from Delhi to Vadodara back in Oct 2018 with high expectation and lot of plans to contribute for the company. During the initial days I had lot of issue in finding the apartment and because of my religion people were saying no wherein I never faced such issue in Delhi. I used to invest sleepless day time to hunt the apartment and during the night used to work on a new job where people were expecting me to change overall team's fortune which was managed by the previous manager for 8 years. The initial hiccups were there for about 2 months though in the end I was able to find the solution but during this time every employee of Collabera extended help in whatever way they could and they ensured I should not face it alone rather get the solution together. I previously worked with 3 more employers and none them have these sort of people. I fall in love with our Collabera family's culture and it just took me short time to gel-up with the management group. So in short our company ensure to provide best support and help not just in professional aspect but personal. We all together are making the best Corporate culture where people are more excited and interested to come to office everyday with happy faces. It was a dream company for me and I'm proud to be a part of the squad.

pros:
My thoughts are valued!

I greatly value the?leadership in Collabera!

cons:
At times we are penny wise and dollar foolish with decisions we make.  At times we implement sales contests or make decisions to evaluate staff without seeking input from the managers who manage the staff.
We are email obsessed in Collabera and often times we answer an email only to be asked 2-3 more times for the data or answer.
There is still an school thinking that volumes of submittals will win business whereas I feel we need to train our recruiters to be more efficient in finding suitable candidates and being more thorough in our vetting of those candidates.
story: Almost weekly I learn of a recruiter and?an Account Manager going the extra mile by working late at night or on a weekend to find the best candidate and filling the position.

pros: Job duties, sharping my skills, gaining experience and
cons: Pay, negative family life impact, unrealistic expectations, not being recognized for achievements, not being taken seriously, little-to-no growth opportunities, and the unspoken culture (the culture that exists at Collabera for employees who don't generate sales/growth).
story:
If you take a good look at the cultural values of Collabera and how they are presented to the employees who don't generate sales/growth - they basically tell you that work is more important that anything else.  

Work hard and play hard - only at work though.   They want you to work hard and long and also hang out/do activities with them.  

Passion to serve - make sure you get your duties done without complaint. 

Responsive beyond imagination - don't stop working, you need to have your response before we even ask.

Insanely competitive - sell your coworkers out.  While not being told this directly, management has told me to find other people's mistakes, fix them, and then brag about it to them so they can show to the higher management that what you found is are worth your salary (this is outside of your normal job duties).

 Disciplined to achieve excellence in execution - Make sure you are disciplined enough to get your duties done correctly even with unrealistic timelines

pros:
In every org, an employee looks for an equal opportunity platform and being a woman, it matters to me a lot. Here, at Collabera we get the equal right to speak and express, and we have our voice over the table. Another factor that is important is the working culture; people generally feel that night shift is going to be boring and lethargic but it's not the case here with us. We have a lively environment and the cosmopolitan culture makes it more vibrant like "unity in diversity". We celebrate festivals, our families are at times part of it too, we encourage sports, and we learn new tech, take trainings and has options for further studies too.  Our work is recognized too and has a fair and transparent system.
Collabera gives us the best platform to not only grow professionally, but we see personal growth too.
cons: The canteen food is not at all hygienic and issues with parking area "it becomes mini vishwamitri". At times, I personally feel, onshore gets more priorities than we do.
story: I will take a recent incident to share. March 23rd, 2020; I was running temperature and all other symptoms of COVID-19 and there was no clinic open to get basic check up done and some medication. I somehow found one clinic and that doctor asked me to visit to SSG (as that was the only hospital that was authorized and doing COVID-19 tests in the initial days)I went there and all my symptoms were positive and doctors asked me to go for quarantine for 14 days. I informed my manager about this as soon as I came home. Since day 1; my Manager, my team and few executive level people never missed a single day to check on me and motivate me that everything will be fine and I can fight this. There were days when I felt I cannot take it any more but every day they made sure to call and text and keep my spirits high!! We are truly passionate about our work, our teams, and our goals.

pros:
'- Once you work for sometime here it becomes 'home' for your professional life. you live, eat, breathe, sleep Collabera !
- Ever growing, ever developing approach makes you want more of it
- Never missed to pay me salary in 13 years
- Open door policy
- Extremely safe working environment esp for females
- Well enabled IT systems/facilities
cons:
'- Frequent change in staff - both at ground level and leadership. depletes efficiency
- Undue Increased level of performance governance in recent years; Metrics are everything, regardless of what they measure
- Little work-life balance
- Female employee promotion/growth/development is hardly seen except sales role; employee development plans should include middle management
- Hidden bias esp amongst top delivery leadership; once labeled it remains with you for lifetime
- Different common objectives/goals even among the same team 
- Tenure renders zero benefit ; 
- Multi levels of undue approvals required even for non-financial transactions
- Diversity of thought is encouraged but not implemented
- Employee-first culture should be brought back
story:
** GCI /Collabera  used to provide food for night shift workers and during recession, it was stopped. as i had just started and was not in a team with high commission opportunity; Collabera management approved a sum of amount every month aside from pay for me to be able to afford my daily meals. This is what Collabera Cuture was all about , Welfare and Care at core be it for client, consultant or internal employees ! 
** Offshore was considered one amongst the team ; that developed the competitiveness and one team-ness

pros:
Reasons to work for collabera (indian perspective)
1. Weekends are holidays : not many companies provide sat & sun as holidays.
2. Prestige : Collabera is famous and people have a favourable opinion towards it, working for collabera makes people believe you're better than average.
3. Trips & picnics : Collabera takes its employees who win E3 contest on trips and picnics twice a year, winning that is a dream for many departments.
cons:
Again indian perpective
1. Overworked : all the employees are overworked and overburdened, there is no such thing as over time, many employees regularly stay beyond normal working hours sometimes as much as 12-15 hours, without getting paid OT, I guess US employees are lucky in that regard.
2 Low Wages : Collabera is not a good paymaster, when it comes to salaries. The amount of work done is inversely proportional to salaries received. Employees would appreciate if collabera gave higher than average salaries for once.
3. Holidays : getting sick days and holidays approved is a hassle, we do not get holidays on indian festivals, but we also do not get holidays on ALL American holidays. Being on American holidays in india is awkward and not fun when relatives ask your whereabouts on indian holidays and youre siitting in the office, we have many indian holidays. collabera should provide us atleast major indian holidays.
story:
I got a good story maybe this will help:

in 2019, it was raining heavily in a city called Vadodara, rains were so bad the entire city was flooded in mere hours, employees were trapped as several bridges were blocked by the police. During late evening the rains stopped but city was still flooded, in such times when the company could transport its employees to their homes safely, rather were busy bringing them to office from their homes in a company run car. Even in such dangerous times the company only cared about its manhours loss and not endangering lives of its employees. I somehow got home driving my car in 5 foot deep water with warning from police on radios blaring that turtles and alligators were in the flooded waters. That's the moment I realised the collabera values!

story:
I'd really want to express my gratitude towards the kind of support and faith Collabera has given me. We've heard many stories where people did something extra and they got recognized or awarded which is obviously how we celebrate success however this one incident definitely made sure that I would love to stick to this Company forever. This was around last year AUgust(2019) time when I happened to get severely sick. Initially I thought I'd get better within a month however it took me 3 Months to recover and get back to office. All these time only stressing part for me was my Job. I was so scarred to loose my job or after coming back having performance pressure however my superiors (Sid, Arpit, Saqib ) was so supportive and kept motivating me. They did not only help me while I was sick but they also helped me when I joined back and looking at my health issues they let me get into  Corporate Recruitment also Sanyam showed faith in me which eventually helped me to perform well.
At times what you remember is how were you being treated and that is where I did feel that this company definitely values their employee.
I am forever thankful to everybody who has supported me by far and after this incident I'd always make sure that my performance should always speak for myself.

Employee friendly working environment and one of the worlds best staffing organization.

pros: Opportunity to take a staffing firm to next level, career growth,, voice at the table, so much work to be done which is exciting.
cons: I know what we are trying to accomplish but there’s a feeling of desperation sometimes to be just like other firms VS being ourselves, minimal collaboration, minimal sharing of resources, technology is behind, basically we look at the way insight global does things and we just copy it when we aren’t built the same way. Truly need to rethink our strategy & direction to pave our own path and couple proper expectations around that.
story: I am trying to build a new division for the company and it feels like a war each day in the offices to gain trust or collaborate. Each division and even more granular, each office has a different culture depending on your prior staffing firm. No one is being held accountable to follow Collabera’s way / culture because there isn’t any. It’s “follow the best practices from your old firm and do it that way” which is why it’s so hard for us to share knowledge and trust each other. If you came from the same staffing firm as someone else, it becomes a clique and others are being left behind.

And he motivate us too when it comes a turn to play hard.

cons: There are not many career options to choose from in collabera apart from recruiting, so when an employee wants to switch to marketing or finance or some other field of work apart from collabera, there is not many options.
story: Once as a proactive recruiter, i closed a candidate and got them submitted over a req and my manager was aware about it. The req for some reasons wasn't fitting in the criteria of that candidate as we had to file for their H1 and the account manager wasn't ready to nominate her name, in this scenario, the account manager of that team started blaming me for getting that candidate submitted for her client, but my manager took my stand and said that he knew about this from the start and knows that this has been done correctly according to the process of collabera (as my manager strictly sticks to the process). Manager taking my side on something when i was falsely being accused was very encouraging and i liked the gesture.

pros: The pros of working at collabera is that the environment is very friendly and I can go and ask anyone a question in my Dept. and they are always willing to help. The work environment is also very fast paced.
cons: No cons;- Only thing is we have to work in night but we know that is necessity.
story: Its been more than 4 years working with collabera but i have never get bored. I love my task and love to participate in fun activity on friday.

pros: The company culture is encouraging and my coworkers are money motivated and there for motivated.
cons: It is frustrating at times when my work and accomplishments are numbers based and the work that went into other things that are not numbers based are not acknowledged.
story: One time, I received news that a friend had passed while I was at work. My account manager (mentor) and sales manager sat me down in an office and listened / talked me through the situation and then allowed me to go home. They knew that while work is important, often times life events come up and they are more important.

pros: Collabera is Family, My Role helps collabera to grow its family and I'm proud of that

pros: Working at Collabera like Hustle with Happiness, Punctuality with passion and each new task brings the best interest to do it. Collabera is taking care of all the employess like family memebers.

story: Collabera's culture believes in team spirit and togetherness. Everyone is treated here as a family member. Work hard and play hard, and being passionate are the best values of Collabera.

pros:
Collabera lets me be both independent and disciplined at the same time; and it's not easy to pull off such a quality with a bigger workforce. 
Imbibing the spirit of teamwork from the first day of training says a lot about "Actions speak louder than words". 
In my term right now, 5th month going on, I have seen that personal growth is determined the most by individual input; to outshine others you have to have some quality that helps you grow, the organization will only act as a catalyst.
cons:
Night-shift working takes time to adjust, given the fact that my work started and within 3 weeks I am working from home.
What everyone says about not having a really enthusiastic social life; is what I don't agree, we all find a new social circle within teams/departments/organisations.
I am a post graduate still I am on the payrolls of a graduate; there should be some distinction, I used to have this as a downside earlier, not anymore.
story:
One of the values of the company is "Passionate to service Employees and Clients".
I would just take the word Passion from this and I have seen the passion of people to get others the job, striving seamlessly and over and over the same routine to mark their presence.
Passion also when people take breaks they ensure they go together with the team that they are competing. Often same targets leads to competition but everything is fair whether competing or eating. 
And such passion results in "Work Hard (together); Play Hard (together)"

pros: Work environment,liberty , and open culture motivates me to work with collabera.it is giving ke sense of Oranizarional citizenship behaviour
cons: Long working hours is something which is taking toll at my health because of which I fell little disengaged . Otherwise i enjoy working with collabera
story: Collabera gives us accountability in projects and Initiatives.

pros: Good work environment, positive atmosphere, free of corporate politics, encouragement is usually given on worthy cases.
cons: Sometime too much expectations leads to negative peer pressure.
story: My first hire was celebrated on the whole floor and that made me felt really special.

pros: One of the main and best reason to work at Collabera is Collabera's core value for me. Collabera's value includes everything that is required for a great work culture.
cons: Only downside of working at Collabera for me is that growth at Collabera is time taking. If someone is better at performing their daily task and achieve their goals, I believe they should get a chance to grow and have better position than waiting to get tenured before getting anything as such.
story: I remember once I fell sick at midnight and I had no medicine with me neither the reception had the medicine I needed but when I reached out to them, they immediately called the cab and took me to the hospital nearby for treatment. After meeting the Doctor, I was well. Collabera's dedication to it's employee is at it's best and I believe that's what you need for a great working culture.

pros: Work Culture, Open Door policy & Celebrations. Along with these the transparency to discuss issues with your higher ups is really easy. You can discuss freely with your manager in regards to your issues. Moreover, you won't feel like working in night shift at all

story: Celebrating milestones like 1st hire, PC club, work anniversaries & BLAZE are best cultural aspects and on top of it other employee engagement activities like CPL, Talentika are all fun... Employee Appreciation week can be better than what it usually is in compared to what it's there in USA. At times it feels USA employees are given more importance than GDC employees.

pros:
Reasons would be many, but I would like to point out some:
1.Work hard, Play hard: This has never made me feel, night shift is too tough or monotonous, rather it has helped me to look into a more positive side.
2. For me Collabera has always been employee concerned, as an employee, what are my problems, how it can be resolved and it taking measures to help in every way in this pandemic as well.
3. I think one of the best reason to work at Collabera, would be because of Vinay sir, looking at his passion, looking things always at a positive side and always inspiring, but too down to earth as a leader, makes me feel I am working for the right organization in my career.
cons: Nothing as such in particular, but yes everyone has their own point of view, and making someone understand your point of view, would be tricky sometimes.
story: Well not a story, but many instance I would say, as I mentioned above, in this pandemic, it would also be very necessary to Work hard and Play hard, for our peace of mind as well. Because of need, I used to work late, but my manager who used to work in Collabera and current manager as well, always used to say, go home, its late, have fun, kaam hota rahega, kal kar lena. Seniors, managers in Collabera always strive for excellency, targets, but has been never let you down by putting pressure just to achieve excellency. I feel this should be one of the many things, which makes an employee happy and work hard and play hard as well.

cons: The reward for doing good work, is more work. Things are always done in a reactive way instead of proactive and we refuse to pay for good functioning systems. Instead, our systems are always down or something is not functioning in them. There is always way too much work and not enough people to do it. We also don't match 401Ks which is just incredibly frustrating and makes me feel like Collabera does not want to invest in me. Every time we try to discuss why attrition is so low we share 100 different ideas for solutions and all of them are rejected or ignored and nothing gets fixed or changed.

pros: Collabera is headed by visionary leaders and the agility at work keeps me on my toe. Acceptance of new idea and constant efforts to improve drives my passion to continue working for Collabera. Recognition & appreciation at right intervals have kept me motivated. Challenges & problems have given me opportunity to showcase my creativity & utilize my skills. Over and above these points my most important reason to work for Collabera is that I can see a career path for me.
cons: A competitive compensation is missing. Work life balance have always been a top concern while working here. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle & providing quality time to family has been a challenge. Another key observation is that majority of our leaders are home grown, they are best at their work but lack exposure due to less or no experience of other Industry/Company (Unilateral thinking. Company has seen lot of changes in recent time. I think too many changes might create confusion among employees.
story: After I joined Collabera, within 6 months I got the opportunity to change the existing new hire training process. They trusted a new guy with such an important responsibility motivated me to give my best. All the stakeholders were involved and each one was passionate to create a better & robust training module. I have seen all of us working meticulously for late hours, directors/managers making time from their busy schedule and governing the entire process so smoothly that we could be operational on the decided timeline. Results were better than we expected and we did not stop there, this process even sustains after 2 years and have been modified when required. A constant review of it's relevance with regards to new polices gave us a heads-up if we need to change. I think this event had all the 5 cultural values that Collabera stands for.

story:
I think it all comes down to our core values that we all work to achieve on a daily basis. The one thing that stands out in my mind is how our people have worked tirelessly to help our clients during this pandemic. Our culture is about being in the people business that includes caring about our employees and our clients. That means a great deal to me and makes me proud to be apart of Collabera. 

The first thing i noticed when i got hired was that every single person i worked with no matter where they were located are all over achievers and very passionate about their work. That is the first time I have experienced that working at a company. There's always some people that don't pull their own weight but at Collabera that is not the case. Everyone is extremely responsive and we all give 150%. We are disciplined and very, very competitive as seen on a daily basis in how we work until the job is done, and we strive to help Collabera grow year over year. I also love how we mix work and play to ensure there is a nice balance. That is so important in life. We have amazing parties, dinners, events and we care about the communities that we work in. Watching our employees volunteer to feed the homeless, or have fundraisers or just to reach out and help someone is what we are all about. I am 100% team Collabera!

story:
Some years back I was on planed leave from Monday and on Friday we got an email to arrange accommodation for new joiner’s batch and numbers of new joiners were high and to manage it seems to be difficult. 
Same time my Manager was on leave and it was difficult to take advice for managing the situation, so we spoke with him on Cell and as per His advice we made plan to give accommodation to few new joiners in hotel and for which we took quotes for hotel and went to Authorized Person to take approval for giving accommodation in hotel and for amount. But after having discussion with Authorized person we did not have the approval.
Somehow we were able to manage situation with given facility. 
From the above situation I had a very good experience and learnt that as we did not have approval to give accommodation in hotel from Authorized Person, but still we were able to manage the situation with given facility only.  We have to take things in positive way in any condition.

I'm really thankful to my company for that.

story: It's a blessing to work in such a reputed company.

pros: For someone who is just starting their career, I cannot suggest any other employer than Collabera (as of now). There is joyous vibe the office environment brings in, mainly due to the people around. I really really appreciate the fact that I do not need address someone sir/Ma'am, That'd be very weird. There are some magnificent people in Collabera, who at times have made myself question my own role, eventually helped me to better myself as a part of a bigger entity.
cons: This is sensational. Being a part of my team, I see this everyday. Because your number speaks volumes about your performance, does not really mean that you are ready to go up that ladder and be in leadership position. Before whatever role you play in the company, We need affirm-ate being a human first. It works the other way too. You do not become a good leader because your designation says so. We need leaders not bosses. Not the people who order and watch, but the ones who initiate and inspire.
story: This is not a pleasant memory. A little over 6 months into my journey with Collabera, I am really working hard and learning how to perfect what I was doing. On the other hand I was feeling more monotonous it was always the same. There was nothing challenging anymore in my daily transactions. I really wanted see if I can add behavioral training into my portfolio which really is my background. I might have needed real help considering the target audience, But I really wanted to to work. This is also because that is where I see myself in the long-run. I remember Reaching out to my manager at the time, who is also the HOD, to initiate a discussion on this. So I went inside her cabin and proposed the vision. There was another member of the team who is taking care of the same at the time. When I proposed the idea, my manager at the time gave me speech on what makes the other member of the team eligible for he is doing and how he made himself so incredible along with the role. this lasted for more than 30 minutes. Majority of the time I was listening to why I should not do What I really think I am capable of and interested in because I am unlike the other person. I walked out of that cabin trying to make sense out of what she said. I never did. And I still do not. I believe every organization is an ecosystem. But survival of the fittest does not apply here. We need leaders who are ready to create opportunities for their people because they believe in them, Not because he/she is your favorite. You need to make everyone of them feels like by doing the right thing from their scale, they are making a change too. every single one of them matters too. And then that is an healthy ecosystem. Otherwise you have employees who work for you because you pay them.

pros: The culture, competitiveness, the recognition given to the deserving, the platform given to grow.
cons:
I would not term it as downside, but just somethings that needs improvisation which will make us shine even more brighter.
1. Equal opportunities in regards to training, projects, etc for Sales.
2. Treat everyone equally. Lessen the favoritism which is clearly visible across.
3. Not only one group/designation level of people should be given all learning and trainings. It should be for people at all level/designations.
4. Individuals who are identified to step up the ladder should also be given opportunity to participate in the business meets and similar gatherings.
5. If you know that it is not an individual resources fault in getting something, then that should not become a reason to stop his/her expected growth/promotion.
story:
Retaining a candidate, who was super furious with Collabera and was threatening to sue us.
Getting the margins (GP/GPM) of that candidate to positive from negative, and then that candidate feeling happy about the help I did and giving a positive feedback to our business excellence.

pros: I love working at Collabera because of the people. My team and my bosses are absolutely amazing, caring, and hardworking. The teamwork is just top notch and everyone is ready to lend a helping hand if needed.  I also love that Collabera allows me to work remotely especially right now in the middle of a pandemic. I have never been happier at a job than I am here.
cons: The only thing I can think of is more of a personal thing. When I am on vacation or it's outside of business hours, I still feel like I am expected to check emails/respond to emails. Shutting off work completely for "me time" is very hard.
story: One of my favorite times that showed me Collabera's culture was when we had a sales meet in Florida. I had only been with the Collabera family for 2 1/2 months. We had meetings all day and then it was a BIG party at night. During the meetings, multiple accounts had to share their ups and downs in presentations and mixed in was team building activities. It was just amazing to see how everyone was so supportive of other accounts, giving praise on success' and suggestions to make things even better.

pros: I came to Collabera for the opportunity to grow with an organization and hopefully get into leadership. Collabera has taken the time to invest in me to get me to my professional goals. The culture of Collabera is amazing and our company is constantly trying to find competitive advantages in our industry. Whether that be new service offerings or rolling out new Applications that make our job easier. Collabera wants to be an industry leader and I believe the company is doing everything they can do that.
cons:
I would say there are a lot of growing pains at Collabera. From certain internal process, to systems, to overload of unnecessary emails, etc... I still think Collabera is still trying to figure out things since we have gone to a Regional model. That was a big company wide mindset shift and I think we are still learning. I think some of the training we could improve for recruiters and sales. 
I do feel that delivery sometimes does not trust Account Managers that are working directly with clients. We see this in having to jump through hoops to get positions changed to QP or Direct. That can be very frustrating at times when a sales person is doing everything they can to close business.
All in all I think Collabera is trying to do the right thing to improve our business. We just have a lot of internals things that need to be ironed out.
story: My favorite story is when I went to PC / Cancun trip within my first year at Collabera. I was blessed to make it to Cancun as a milestone achiever and on my flight there I hit $10K. Whenever I arrived people were congratulating me on the achievement and made me feel very appreciated. I think Collabera does a great job is showing this appreciation to its employees and celebrating the achievements.

cons:

story:
Client reached out with concern on one of our consultants working on their critical project and wanted us to address it asap so that their project does not get affected.
At Collabera all teams got together synced up and communicated with resource make him understand the client concerns and did mild course correction and made him realize his importance and his responsibilities.
All this was done in 2 hours and informed client, situation under control, Client was might happy and appreciated our timely response to attend thi.
Classic example of Passion to service clients and responsive beyond imagination

pros: Core values and the energy we all put towards our common and individual goals
cons: There is no downside but company should understand the skills resources have like as an example some one is better in recruiting and someone might be better in management.. you cant put all the flowers in one pot.. give all of them a chance..
story: Collabera culture is awesome, Management decisions, support all are best than other companies as per my experience but it's a request like favoritism affects the others and that is why we lose good people of the company. Some didn't get timely growth, some started under performing due to lack of motivation and left. Just want to say all the students are not same in class. Some tops by skills and some tops by hard work.

pros: Friends, lunches, OOCs, employee recognition, office outings
cons: micromanagment, long hours, work life balance, office layout

pros: The reasons to work at Collabera are , Respect , culture , Value, People etc.
cons: This is very difficult as i don't have any downsides to share currently.
story: It's been 9 years now that i am part of this family. Have lots of stories however one that touched my heart was coordination between all internal departments. I am working for Operations and do need to connect with almost all departments and i really appreciate the team work and coordination to get a closure on any issue or items.

pros: the people are amazing to work with and there is good training
cons: you can work really hard and not make enough money
story: employee appreciation week makes us feel valued and makes us realize that we are noticed.

pros: Here in Collabera the work environment feels like home. Everybody is helpful.
cons: Nothing major to be highlighted, but a open and independent ground to all employees would be great ! Thanks
story:
As most of us are aware of the initial phenomenon felt by everybody at a new platform like being comfortable with everyone takes considerable time.
Honestly it didn't take more than an hour for me to mix into the office environment and that is something I can never forget.

pros: One thing i like about Collabera is that they have Good Incentives, Competitions, Awards for all of their employees which is Open for all specially the Presidents club. The ofc setup and environment is good to work.
cons: Hard work sometimes goes unnoticed due to favoritism or dislike towards a person and promotion gets hampered. No proper communication among sr. managers and the HR team specially when it comes to any issues or promotions. No proper road map provided for promotions.  No proper resolution or attention to such issues at all from.  One more Con would be that you can be a winner in such competitions only if you have a good running accounts, which otherwise no matter how hard you try, you will not overcome it. So again these competitions would be fruitful to limited set of audience and not to those supporting low sided business. This point of awards I am presenting from every persons perspective and not just my point.
story: One of the best experiences so far with Collabera is the PC awards. They give the best experience of a lifetime in such events by having trips. 2nd is the Blaze awards. These are some of the best things about Collabera which I admire. One of the negative experience is that when it comes to promotion cycles there is no proper roadmap and promotion is only measured based on numbers achieved irrespective of slow accounts given by managers. Effort level is not considered. I believe its really unfair as when a person is given a slow moving accounts and then expect high numbers and still donot give them the promotions even after working on those for 2 years stating numbers are not inline. Team size is also cut down, seniors are moved out due to slow accounts and then the expectation is to build a backup of yourself when the team consists only of 1-2 years old recruiters. HR does not have much say or take any action here. Favoritism is at the peak in some teams. Have experience this not once but twice during my tenure.

pros: The best part of Collabera is how we allow individual's to be creative with their objectives and required tasks. I believe that often what most people are looking for is freedom to be creative.
cons: Some processes have too many individuals involved which leads to a decision-by-committee bottleneck
story: My best friend in the company is my Delivery Manager who lives in India and who I've only met 1 time in person. But I consider him to be one of my best friends inside/outside work, I trust him with everything, and I would do anything I could to help him. And yet we come from such different backgrounds and walks of life.. That's really cool.

pros: Best work environment, great management and awesome colleagues
cons: I cannot think of any downside at moment but we can surely improve a little on the micro management side.
story: I had the best induction in my entire career. I loved the environment it was fun being a part of induction training.

pros: I love the team environment - even during Covid I have always felt a sense of fellowship with leaders constantly calling out achievements both big and small
cons: The starting base pay rates are a little low - although that is great incentive to set more meetings.
story:
Competitive: I've experienced managers and teammates who are willing to adjust their schedules immediately in order to assist with setting meetings or completing meetings.
Responsive: I've had great success reaching out to multiple departments including payroll and IT to assist with issues. My needs and questions are always taken care of in a timely fashion

pros: Amazing experience as Collabera provides good growth opportunity
cons: Difficult to manage Work Life balance because of night shift especially as we are working from home
story: Engaging and extremely competitive work we do here so at first it was very difficult to fit myself in but Collabera has provided me enough chances and backup

pros: It is the best place to kick start your corporate career
cons: Night shift can be fun in the start, but you won't like to do forever
story: Whenever you feel low on energy , Collabera's event will never fail to uplift your energy and enthusiasm

pros: I feel proud working with one of the best and fastest growing staffing firm in the world. Collabera's core values drive every employee to do better everyday. I get to learn the business from the best in the industry. Collabera helped me become better professional with all the training i get.
cons: I do not find any downsides of working with Collabera as i feel while working here i have learned a lot. While working with Collabera i have learned a lot and grown together with the organization.
story: We at Collabera celebrate all the festivals in grand style. Employee satisfaction is the key, while we celebrate each and every success with everyone and celebrate an entire week to showcase our appreciation to all the employees across. Which makes everyone of us feel valued. We have multiple offices across the globe and any office that you step into you will see Collabera's core values being followed everywhere. According to me We(Collabera) are the best company to work with.

pros:

story: Good work culture and value for each individual emotion.

pros: I love my team and it is worth working with them. Also, they help me out with a solution whenever I fall.
