story: The way we praise the winners and the hardworking employees is the best thing.

pros: Flexibility on how to run your books of business with the guidance of National Account Manager and able to work globally with your team to teach you about the different environment and diversity. Able to connect with the team regardless of location and time. Work closely with Delivery, Sales, Operation, Time sheets, Employee Relations, Legal, and Human Resource and teaches you on working cross functionally. Get to work with the best clients. Since the environment is fast pace, you get to learn quick and hands on new challenges every day. Learn to just try even without knowing how to solve the challenge by being there for your clients and team.
cons: Not enough time and have to be quick learner. Understanding to know more the difference between ESG and Regional and how it can be combined into one Team. Doing more Town Hall as a whole Team to understand what’s going on each side of groups to be able to share success with future clients.
story: Made impacted with our BPO client’s delivery by providing the best service to our clients and candidates. Helped with interviews and on boarding by being imaginably responsive to both parties regardless of time and day.  Being committed by helping candidates with on boarding at Starbucks and helping them with paperwork and I9 to collaborate with Operation Team. Partner with managers to schedule all interviews with the client onsite and helping with the preparation on skills assessment on the interviews with our recruiters and managers. Being passionate by coming onsite to meet active consultants and managers at 6 am CST to 8:30 pm CST to assure both sides are happy at the project and with Collabera. Wanted to make all this impact to represent Collabera as the best staffing solution out there.

pros: Working at Collabera has been a great experience. I always feel like I have excellent support from my peers when needing to get tasks done. The friendly and professional environment at Collabera allows me to do my job in a thriving environment. I look forward to my tenure with Collabera.
cons: The only thing I will say that is a downside with working at Collabera is some of the recruiting software and tools that we have. Our applicant tracking system is very buggy and I usually have to write all of my process down with pen and paper.
story: Collabera does an outstanding job at recognizing when people are doing a great job. The team environment brings everyone together and encourages good performance across the board. Whenever I do a deal I feel like everyone is proud of me and is willing to help me when I have bumps along the way.

pros: Great Environment, Fun Fridays, Good and educated people to work with. supporting and friendly team and managers. Festival celebrations at Collabera.
cons: Can't think of anything right now.
story: Diwali celebration with full ethnical dress code. showing the best of our indian culture.

pros: Collabera is one of the best in terms of work culture. Its not just a workspace but like a home to us and all our colleagues are kind of family members
cons: I can't think of any but the working hours are the only downside of working at Collabera
story: The amount of competition Collabera has is unmatchable. Also, the five key fundamentals are very true which Collabera has

pros: Company investment in technology, global capabilities, strong client portfolio and successful track record.
cons: One downside that I have seen since joining Collabera is the continued changing in our messaging around what we are known for and our offerings to the market.
story: I'm thankful to be an employee of Collabera and one example of why the culture is sound is when Hiten committed to keeping as many people employed during COVID19.

pros:
Very important of all is my company Collabera stood and is standing very supportive during this difficult time of COVID-19. Today i am very awesome, feel safe working from home, caring for family members needs all is because of my job and my company support. 

The working culture, Top management Support, lead supports, team support, Recognition awards, Knowledge transfer from co-workers, transparency in all progress, A completely process driven, Promotions, Growing opportunity through various training programs, indoor competitions, Good Incentive plans, supported with Sick leaves, Insurance support, The salary date is always on time, Delicious Dinner for night shift bangalore team.
cons: I am very honest I dont have any Cons because company has taken care of me at its best during my difficult times. i even typed above only it is because i must minimum meet 50 characters.
story: I started my day 1 with Collabera on Oct 8th 2018, from the day 1 i never looked back till date, i am extremely proud of my decision. I joined Collabera after leaving a long time employment with my previous company. I have no regrets in my decision, i liked the challenges that was thrown on the floor, the appreciation awards i received for my success, My managers, leads and coworkers valued me very well and supported me with a 100 percent knowledge transfer of clients i was assigned and work. i was surprised by this support because in most of the company's the coworkers don’t share their success practice with their colleges being afraid of competition BUT in Collabera every single person i met was just ready to help me at work unconditionally, i loved the way i was treated. My Manager Jaspal Nandra who hired me for Cisco, Amit Sharma my first manager at Cisco, My First lead Venkat Gummadi, My Bangalore Boss Vinod, Present boss Hardev Singh, My Present Reporting manager Arjun Sharma, Varun Patel all are very important members of Collabera whom I worked and working now are very supportive at my work. Arjun sir is a very good manager . he never let me down during my difficult times. his encouraging words always pushed me with an extra force to do my work. i have nothing to share Negative. But many who are not part of Collabera. who were not able to be successfully even after given chances to perform may speak Ill.

pros: The environment and culture is the best in Collabera. All are getting right to put forward their individual opinion.
cons: I can not think of anything that can be mentioned here as of now.
story: Along with the work we always have make sure to enjoy the games and even the festivals that are celebrated in the office.

pros: There is a lot to learn. A lot has to do with there not being a choice because of the lack of resources and lack of training/knowledge of the part of outside of the department. However, I do view the ability to learn more, regardless of how/why, to be a positive for my career and personal self.
cons: There continues to bolstering of 1 area of the company (sales) and lack of acknowledgment and bringing togetherness. I understand sales technically makes the money but I think there are a lot of pieces to that puzzle the need to come together to enable Collabera to be successful as it has been and will continue to be going forward.
story: I enjoy working with and for the people I do. However, it seems that everyone outside of sales is here to just serve sales. In a sense I get it but only cultivate this I don't think is good for the company and all employees as a whole. There is also the big problem of compensation. When it's not equivalent to the average of other companies with similar income and size but also a lack of incentive, it becomes 1 of the, if not the single biggest, issues. We talk about family and one-team at Collabera but at the end of the day, everyone is trying to make money to care for their family and the future. The company can be only so good to its employees but it the compensation is vastly unproportional, the other good aspects get lost.

pros: The work environment in Collabera is something which keeps me engaged here! :)
cons: You get less "me-time" and family time. Specifically, when you live alone and away from family, after working in night shift, we end up sleeping the entire day. Due to which I personally don't get much time to spend with my family. But while working from home, I am getting equal time for work and for my family as well, which I am enoying now :)
story: Work Hard, Play Hard culture of Collabera is something very amazing. The energy people show in cultural events is directly proportional to the energy people show while working, which is truly inspiring and motivating. But on the other hand, the night shift is something that bothers you every single day while working here.

Half the company thinks Delivery runs the show, the other half thinks it is sales. There are individuals managing senior sales individuals that have never done the actual sales role before.
story: Collabera preaches a culture, they have clearly defined core values. It's more talk then actual substance in my opinion.

cons: I have been in collabera since last 1 year and haven't feel any downside till now, every this is super fantastic here. :)
story: Collabera's culture is very good, all work as a family here. As internally in team everyone is too supportive. I like the way how festivals and occasions Collabera celebrates - Like a Family. Everyone gets an equal opportunity here. :)

pros: Our working culture is really sorted and well aligned. There are barely any confusions in regard to what work needs to be done by whom. This is one of the best reason as we tend to perform in a more efficient way when we exactly know what we need to be doing
cons: I feel that the middle management people and some people that are just starting their management career and taking it ahead kind of lack some support and enthusiasm from the upper management.
story:
A Recruitment Manager (Delivery Lead) joins the company in the middle of the year, supporting a really emerging and yet to grow region. When he comes, he is full of excitement to support a different region and territory and takes the region to a new ATH within 2 quarters of joining. He felt really happy and accomplished. Later the next year, as supposed the numbers were falling down and then suddenly Covid came into place. Now the pressure started building and things were turning South slowly and steadily. He was then offered to take up the lead and start some hands on work to bring the region back to action. He took this as a challenge and has been trying to bring the business up.

Now, the good thing and an area which really helped him make the ATH happen was that the work was really sorted and he was capable to do way more than ever because of the support that all the teams in the company provide. The immediate managers and upper management were really supporting in all the aspects. A little thing that might be better was that when the downfall came and things were going south, The Delivery Lead made sure that he connects with all the resources and tries to make sure that they still have the motivation and faith like they had before. However, there was not so much support and connects to happen with the Delivery Lead. We could take it as once getting into a management role, the person has to be self motivated. However, it is always better to have someone to count on and to talk to.

pros: Quality company, quality peers, amazing understanding, work hard/play hard mentality, focus on teamwork, ability to institute creativity & positive change. This is hands down my best career ever and I am excited and fortunate to be a part of Collabera.
cons: Sales is hard in general, but hitting a metrics & being on a draw is tough!
story: Attending group events with fun & creative awards as well as strong connections amongst peers. This is a great company with great culture and a “can do” attitude.

pros: There are infinite reasons to work with Collabera. The best one I found or witnessed is; The Vibrant Working Environment. I have never seen the amount of zeal within the organization in terms of work, responsibility, celebrations, involvement in various events and so on anywhere by far.
cons: I don't see any except the one which is "Absence of periodic Skip-Level meetings". Skip-Level meetings can, I believe, probably fill the gap between top/middle management and employee at bottom level. It creates more transparency between top/middle management and employee.
story: Collabera's culture isn't limited to any particular event/experience. In fact, it can be exemplified through many events or a set of events which cover its all cultural values in various aspects. I would term Collabera as "Employee-Centric" organization.

pros: We work hard to achieve our targets but party and enjoy harder together as a family. We celebrate all the festivals with joy and happiness. Also we have a very friendly environment and each and every person is there to help anyone in need. We are also appreciated and recognised for our work. The HR over here are friendly and interact with us all the time and helps us in whatever way possible. Even i this pandemic the organisation has taken well care of their employees and helped us with all he necessary requirements so that we can effectively work from home too.
cons: As we know every coin has two sides. Although there are just a few demerits of working at Collabera. The shift timings was a challenge in the beginning as I was not able to manage to talk to my family members and it also affected my health. There is a huge competition within the organisation. The long working hours get tiring sometimes.
story: I still remember the initial days when I joined Collabera, I was too nervous. Also me being an introvert I never asked questions even though I did not understand something. I then had an interaction with my HRBP and even though I did not tell her anything she found out I was introvert and feared from asking questions. Since then she had put a lot of effort towards helping me. She used to make me how to interact with people and ask me with how many I interacted in a daily basis. She used to be on the other side of call and made me practice how to call the candidates. How to fluently speak with confident. And till now she has been there for all the doubts and queries and has always motivated me to give my best.

pros:

He saw that I had potential that was not being realized/fulfilled, and made an incredible amount of investment to get me from where I was at to where I am now. He showed me how to lead by example and trust the process - I am very thankful for that.

pros: At Collabera, you feel valued and your voice is heard, no matter how large the company gets.  I love the flexibility, compensation, incentives, and opportunity that Collabera provides me as well.  I've worked for other major staffing firms in the past, and while Collabera certainly has it's pros and cons, it is by far my favorite place to work, and I don't see myself leaving.
cons: It's challenging to be impactful locally when majority of our delivery staff is offshore.  We also have quite a few broken technical systems that could use some serious integration and moderinzation.  Our training needs to be improved immensely and staffed with individuals who have actually been in sales in the past with continuous development and more consistency across the board when it comes to tranining, mentorship, etc. so we see success in all regional offices, not jusst some.  It's also frustrating to see lack of diversity on our executive level - we need more females and people of different ethnicities for a more well-rounded perspective.
story: Collabera has become family to me.  My husband and I were experiencing fertility issues after having our first daughter.  We lost two pregnancies in a row and it was a very depressing time for me personally.  My office all pitched in to get me a gift card for a tree farm to plant a memorial tree for our babies that went to heaven.  It was the most moving thing that has happened to me professionally, and I will absolutely never forget it.

pros: People Oriented organization. Keeps the Values first.

story: One of our values at Collabera is being disciplined in execution. The way we receive tasks(recs specifically in the Delivery Org) from our Managers, and the way we try to stay at the top of our game by understanding the position and the client's requirement, and answering it with matching profiles is a very good example of this value.

story:
My journey started from a "Beg, Borrow, Steal mode of recruiting a decade back! We have clearly come to ages in our approach but the killer attitude never dies! 
One story that really touches me was how we used to kill our competition. The MSP used to release requirement after 5-6 PM EST on a Friday! While this might mostly get ignored by our competition but for us, this was an OPPORTUNITY! We used to go all guns blazing to sweep the whole market!

Collabera's evolution! From a pure plug delivery engine, we transformed into a full package with more and more focus going into the Hiring, training and leadership development..

pros:
1) Culture: Culture followed and inculcated in you from the time you join Collabera is one of the best things which has kept me going.
2)Opportunities: I can bet that amount of career and growth opportunities you get, not many companies can match it.
3)Financial Stability: Little things like crediting salary on time, competitive pay packages. Goes long way. 
4)Client Exposure: The type of direct exposure that you get with leading fortune 500 clients is simply a different experience
5)Work Environment: Communication is very open, managers literally care for their employees.
cons:
1) Night shift: 5 days a week I don't get any time for the family and work life balance takes a serious hit; however, since the time I have started working from home those challenges do not exist.
2) Desktops and Systems: Though company has tried upgrading systems of all employees it still keeps me thinking that every major IT company provides laptops why we are still providing our employees with old desktops. 
3) Salary Structure: While you end up making good amount of package compared to other companies, 60% of your annual package is still dependent on incentives which is good for youngsters but as you age and get more responsibilities this uncertainty gives you anxiety.
story: When I joined for the first time I was not performing good enough for initial 6 months and I thought that I won't be able to continue with this organization for more than 6 months. But the way my mentor kept motivating me and never gave up on me made me work here for more than 7 years. I initially had applied for my field job before joining Collabera and post joining Collabera, I even got that job but culture at Collabera made me decline that opportunity.

I do not mind responding to valuable calls, texts or questions, however the perceived value of a deadline for the sake of just wanting it done is uninspiring.

story: I have been impressed through this pandemic that everyone has pulled together on Zoom, Teams and other collaboration tools, along with social media to keep a strong sense of team.

story: When I first started my father had to have emergency open heart surgery. My manager let me go and be with him no questions asked. He constantly checked in to see how we were doing and never once made me feel bad for missing work. For this I will always be loyal to him and this company.

pros: Work culture, and good environment. Lively and vibrant activities. few good leaders at top inspires.

Otherwise that gives wrong leaders who are themselves not tested and certified to justice the unusual 2-3 skip promotions they get. Nutshell - DONT JUMP THE PROMOTION LEVELS FOR FAVOURITE INTERNAL STAFF. LOOK AT THEIR ELIGIBILITY OVERALL.

pros: I feel positive and uplifted when I do my work on daily basis for Collabera. This can be only achieved if everybody's mindset same and hard work to make the company success. story: Every festival is celebrated in a different manner at collabera you will never feel that you missed on it. I m a big fan of Garba and this time I felt that i won't be able to attend the fest but to my surprise I found out that people here finish their work at 3am and then they do garba till 5am in the morning and then they celebrate it separately as well. Every company celebrates the festival for a day but what makes collabera different is their regular celebration of every small happiness. This made me feel amazed. When you travel from a different state all these small moments of happiness makes you feel comfortable in the new environment.

story:
the story is about me and the cultural value displayed was "Insanely Competitive"
Negative experience - I was given the task to farm, manage and grow a new Logo for Collabera. The expectations was to test the waters if the account was profitable. In the first 9 months i was able to provide some revenue however it was concluded that I was not competitive to manage the account. 
Positive - I was moved to another account in Feb-2018 and during the first 10 months, I made it to the Upcoming Talent Award for President's club. 
In 2019 - I won the President's clud Award with the Gross Profit that was never achieved in the history of the account in Collabera.
In 2020 - I made it to the PC club again managing some high GP terminations due to COVID-19.

pros: 1) Ample learning opportunities 2) Transparent work culture
cons: 1) Extended working shift (10 hrs) which may extend based on the project / biz need creating work life imbalance especially in night shift environment. As per Labor Laws in India it is 8 hrs working.
story: There are lot of positive experiences I have with Collabera and that's the reason for my association with Collabera. However here I will share a Negative experience working with cross functional teams. For few departments - Few roles are very fluid in nature (especially corporate function / GBS). Due to subjectivity associated there are individuals who are either over burned with extensive work load OR there are individuals who find easy excuse route to shrug work load on others. Lack of objective evaluation of each resource develops complacency in system. Organization allows descent learning time which is positive aspect however promoting mediocrity is not fair. e.g resource is allowed to work in specific department without core skills for that department / job. (Training are also provided to such individuals which is positive aspect but again application of trained aspects in job role are not evaluated objectively. Hence resource does not have pressure to apply training principles and there is barely any improvement).

story:
Well, it's almost 2:00 AM and I am almost about to call my day when a team member from one of the team pings and asks whether I am still at desk.

Almost instantly, I respond back saying I am calling him. She is a new team member and I knew the team lead had to go on a sudden emergency due to a family emergency and her manager was on a planned leave. She was following the standard escalation procedure and reaching out to me. Wasn't quite sure about the criticality but wanted to address whatever was brewing up as soon as possible.

As I login the bridge and she starts explaining the situation saying she tried to reach others, dropped them a message and then called me. She comes to the issue at hand and this is when I understand while the task at hand is not something that's handled by our team anymore, in the past we did handle that and as I was trying to look through my notes, I realized someone joining the bridge.

To my surprise, I see her manager joining the call and surprised I ask, how come she is joining and here comes the response - "I checked my messages and realized there's an issue at hand and know that lead had to leave all of a sudden", The next thing I hear is that I should leave since she (Manager) is in the call and she should be able to drive things and ping me if necessary.

As I send a smiley and about to exit, I hear another ping and this time it's the lead. This time both lead and manager kind or pass a surprised message at each other asking how come they joined when they were not supposed to be there.

At this time, I kind of burst out in laughter and say, practically I was the only one supposed to be there but with two powerful ladies around, I must drop off.

 - Well, I must say that if this is not a true reflection of "Responsive" and "Passionate" then what else better describes those objectives.

pros: The best reason for me use to be how well one gets paid at Collabera which in my case has changed in recent times as I have been moved to an account with no incentives because I requested to change the team I was previously working for 2 years and the reason of the switch was constant insult and humiliation in front of other team members.
cons: The lack of empathy of the management, the overbearing work pressure, when employees try to explain their side of the story it is often considered as a complaint that is coming out of the lack of capability of the employee himself.
story:
I told my superior in the hierarchy, that my brother was attacked by a few local boys and my family was going through a hard time at that night and I wasn't able to focus on work because my brother was scared and was having a hard time forgetting the incident and I was supposed to be there for him as his elder sister, I was asked to think of it as something that normally happens with teenage boys and I should stop crying, wash my face and start working, this is one of the many incidents that I have gone through in a tenure of two years the job is important as it brings bread and butter to the table for me and my family and I have nothing bad to say about my job as I love what I do, but there are a few things that can be dealt with differently at the management's front as well. I am glad I could pour down my thoughts in this survey. Thank you for keeping a check on your employees and supporting us in these difficult time of a widespread pandemic.
Yours Truly,
An employee of your prestigious organization.

pros: Culture created by Hemin; good work ethic and never do wrong.
cons: multiple layers; DD don't listen to delivery like Sham and Hemin used to listen, understand & solve their issues. DD's are ONLY interested in talking to SDM as they are their direct reports. No longer it is open door policy like it was earlier with Sham and Hemin. Very dirty politics. DD's are suppose to be backbone of delivery but during weekly/monthly calls in front of RD's they will always make delivery look bad instead of standing for them. DD's have ONLY pointed problems and never provided solutions. I dont think leaders only point problem but they also help solve them and lead by example which is happening right now which never happened with Sham and Hemin.
story: Collabera was very well run at least from where we looked at it when it was 100% managed by Sham and Hemin. I remembers, when anything would go wrong or would not work the way expected, Hemin would immediately jump in and give his ideas and help at the ground level. That in my opinion was the culture of Collabera that irrespective of your job title, do whatever it takes to bring your people, your team up and grow them along with the company. But now, with so many layers, accountability has diluted and pin pointing has increased.

pros: I think we're hard working and have our own identity. although sometimes I think we try to be too much like insight global

pros: Collabera's Environment, work etiquettes, Festives celebration and activities
cons: Downsides of Collabera would be the workload that is being given overall. The amount of avg. salary given is less.
story: Celebrations of different festivals like Diwali, Navratri. Being a native Gujarat person I was surprised and happy with the kind of celebrations happening in collabera. The preparations done for each festival was astounding. Also the POB's that are conducted and 2 yr + 5 yr completion celebration is awesome.

pros: Open Door Culture, Work Culture and Freedom to use own idea, communicate & Share without worrying someone will judge.
cons: Due to Transformation we have been going through every year one way or other atleast in last couple years, too much change management. I wont say as cons only but pros as well but love the transformation journey & happy to be part of it.
story:
My Family knows for me Collabera comes first family before my wife, daughter or my parents. Kind of professional I have become is only because of my self discipline & collabera culture which has made me what I am today.
I am proud of myself where I am & how I am contributing to Collabera day in day out.

pros: Global locations for large clients that set us apart & large delivery center
cons: Regional support of ESG accounts and the separation of goals
story: Working daily with my team to educate our clients on our vast offerings and how we add value as a partner

pros:
Like the work environment
Easy to reach out to people and collaborate
cons: Rushing through new initiatives sometimes doesn't give enough time to adjust with the changes
story: The way Collabera and its employees are always available in times of adversity, it will be tough to point out one story. However, one thing I was amazed was how quickly we went to virtual work environment without any heads up and everyone took like its normal

pros:
'- Commission Based Role
- The fact that everyone is there to help, regardless of position title
- Presidents Club trip
cons:
'- work/life balance can be really tough, especially during the pandemic. It has felt as though even though there is a pandemic, even more is being expected of us than normal
- at times, it feels as if even accomplishments are not good enough and while it is always great to keep striving for more, sometimes things need to be celebrated and I've witnessed firsthand that pushing recruiters/sales for more and more, too often, can drive people away.
story: I feel that a good example of Collabera's culture was when the pandemic began and was in the early stages, each office was sent home and told to work from home to protect employees and their families. I thought that was very important and a great representation of who Collabera is as a company.

pros: Good incentive plan. Good growth opportunities. Great culture and young employees. Recognition for good deeds. Understanding and support management.
cons: Too much work load and long work hours at times. Employees interests in each others personal life. No Indian holidays.
story: I cant think of one particular story but everytime I have done something good or have gone above and beyond I have always been recognized. Either in my team or on floor or in larger audience. Apart from that every festival that collabera celebrates like a family exemplifies great Collabera's culture.

pros: Supporting employee in each and every way possible through their ups and down.
cons: Sometimes the work environment or the work load can take a lot out of you. Still its a data driven industry so can't complain much
story: Collabera's culture is really amazing and competitive, If you want to grow and want to earn good bucks, this would be the place.

pros: I am proud to work at Collabera. I learnt many things which helped me personally and professionally.
cons: There is none from my end. If in future there is any, I will let my Lead/Manager know,
story: I find Collabera's work cultural very practical and enjoyable.

pros: Collabera is the best place to work, especially for those who likes competitive environment.

story: Doing a lot of in office pot lucks and happy hours/president's trip to cancun to kickstart camaraderie, but a lot of pressure to hit metrics and get hires. Everything seems so money driven.

pros: the overall ambience and culture is amazing. the fact that we celebrate even the smallest achievements is incredible.

story: Passion, Respond beyond imagination, work hard play hard  are the qualities displayed where we achieved ATH spread the client that we were struggling to grow in tough times like COVID-19

different competitions

easy work and reliable manager

Motivational management
Great team work

pros: Collabera is employee centric. It provides all its employees the deserved chance, appreciation and growth. All the leaders in the company are extremely supportive and lead by an example. One can learn by following them simply and talking to them will surely take the individual to next level of performance. Its opendoor policy surely is worth appreciation. Collabera makes one feel awesome from within which automatically brings out excellence in performances.
cons: I haven't had any in last 4.5 years. I havent personally felt any downsides.
story:
There is so much to mention here:We all live by our core values. Every one here exemplifies how beautiful it is to work in Collabera.
The leaders are Disciplined in execution and Responsive beyond imagination. So much to learn from them. It feels amazing to be greeted with consistent big smile and the approach "we are awesome" feels so full of energy. The energy that flows in the audience from the Blaze stage is unmatched. One of the best examples i could think of here is CPL- the passion and zeal with which each employee engagement activity is carried out is truely amazing. And when the leaders wholeheartedly participate and take the game spirit to the next level is surely worth watching. That's how we work at Collabera- we are energetic, passionate, disciplined and awesome people who together work to achieve the set targets.

pros: Very professionalism, Motivated and Best place to work for
cons: Not specific because I am working with my dream company from almost 7 years now.
story: Rewarding and providing continuous motivation to the employees and also incentive plans.

work environment is good and competitive

I would like to highlight "Work hard party harder".
In Collabera its more about celebration whether it is big or small, getting from an interview to a hire. we celebrate. We put our 100 percent in our work but even more than 100 percent when it comes to celebrating the success, which really drives me crazy.

story: Every employee always ensures that he/she meets the expectations of their client, their supervisors and their fellow employees too. Each one of Collabera employee always ensures that the grievances that come their way is never left unanswered. They would always guide people to the right direction even if they are not able to solve someone's problems.

story: When I was suffering in delivery team (not because of work but because of leadership team I was under), I was thinking of leaving the organization but Collabera provided me option to work in other department and after switch I am very happy and interested in working more.In new team I found myself enjoying more at work and all the leadership in current department are like family and they care for me is visible.

story: Before remote work, one of the thing that used to happen at the floor is recruiters hitting the gong after getting an offer and everyone clapping and blowing whistles which was so motivating not just for that particular recruiter but for others as well.

pros: In Collabera Work Environment is better then other companies.
cons: As far as I am concerned there is no cons in the company.

story:
It's all about working hard to achieve success, to get experience.
And to be hard working guy, we need to be happy and even keep our surrounding as well happy.
that's I follow always work hard play hard culture the most

pros:
I work at Collabera because I serve the top client - Amazon. 
I love the culture
Love how I have always seen the leadership heavily investing in learning and development of employees
I was given an opportunity to travel to the US in 2019, which I count in as a lifetime experience
Friendly and encouraging managers! I absolutely love my managers - Archana, Sheetal, and Saparsh.
cons: I can't think of much but a lot of times I feel if I had the same career preferably on the corporate side and I was onshore, that would have been great.
story:
I have been a part of Collabera for around 5 years now and I have been attending Blaze over all these years except for the last time. I made a move to Bangalore and I was not invited to Vadodara which was disappointing but understandable, 
That was the time I realized how important it is for me to be there to celebrate our achievements of the whole year, be there to be a part of my teammates who won Blaze and experience it all.
At that moment, I figured out that I have really grown a quality to work hard and play hard and that is exactly what was burning inside my stomach when I wasn't able to be a part of the MOST fun event of Collabera.

pros: The best work culture we can ever get at workplace. The co-ordination between different teams and team leaders. The bond and understanding of team leads with their team. These are some reasons I love to work At Collabera. We are always Awesome.
cons: The only downside I see at Collabera is Salary pay. I think Management need to think about Salary and incentive plans for GBS team which is not quite satisfactory.
story: Today itself, we received an email for client deadline from Sales team to bill invoices for 12 candidates. It was going to take some time as we were requiring 12 Perm Hire Workflows to complete this task. Considering cultural Value of "Passionate to serve Clients and Employees" we have raised invoices manually to meet client deadline.

pros: Collabera is a company that gives exposer and gives opportunity to fulfill your dreams. we have a culture and friendly environment that every person would love to work in. We also have a great management that helps to learn more and more from our failures. I can say Collabera is the best company to work with.
cons: I don't think any such downside of Collabera because this company has always give me the opportunity to think of my future and grow.
story: From the culture perspective Collabera always try to motivate new talent that happened with me as well initially things were not as per my expectation in terms of work my manager really helped me to learn from the failure and utilize it to bounce back strong also we celebrate each and every festival with so much grace and enjoyment that we hardly miss our family.

pros: The reason why I like to wok at Collabera because it is people centric. Very transparent. Always care about employee.
cons: There is nothing like downside. I am working in Collabera and I am happy that I am part of such organisation.
story: The best thing I like about Collabera is It's not about only work, Apart from work Collabera organised cricket tournament, Volleyball Tournament, Fun Activities and best thing Collabera celebrate each festival by its own style. It's never feel that we are away from our family.

cons: I don't see any downsides to working at Collabera.
story: The five core values of org. allow us to align our work with company goals and contribute into org. success. I think each day we have a story in each effort that highlights our work culture. One of the activities that define Collabera culture is Employee Appreciate Week.

We received many requests from client end to meet the deadline for invoicing and by following our values we responded in effective manner and within timeline to serve our clients.

story: Everyone is work oriented and specially my team mates were very helpful and supportive. Everyone wants to work better than before and grow. Apart from work, other activities are also held weekly, sometimes on festivals like Christmas which was nice to experience.

pros:
The best reasons would be:
Learning on a daily basis. Good work ethics and support
cons: Working hours and not equal opportunity (depending on clients and regions)
story: In Collabera is we celebrate all. Every Festival, Every achievement even if it's not the biggest achievement but people encourage always to do more and give your best. Not everyday can be same but the efforts we put can be. Every effort is being recognized here.

pros: Collabera is an amazing company to work for! The support and love that each and every manager and associate give you make you push harder to be a better employee! I have nothing bad to say about Collabera!
cons: I don’t have any cons of working for Collabera! As long as you work hard and have motivation then the job will reflect and you will be rewarded for the hard work for present!
story: I have felt nothing but positivity since I entered Collabera! I was very impressed by the amount of help and support that everyone in my office showed me when I started! I had one week in the office and then went fully remote. I was reached out to by each single member in my office to make sure I was set up for success!

pros: Good infrastructure, Reputed Company, Collabera's Culture
cons: Working Time, It happens many time i found myself in the office even after my shift ends. 11 to 12 hrs we spend in office. Considering night shift i think this is the only and an important downside to work with Collabera.
story: Collabera's Culture is one of the reason I like to stick with this company. From celebrating Ramzaan to cricket the company has done good job to develop a positive culture.

pros: I enjoy my job & getting to leads teams & programs. I enjoy the aspects of what my job should be.
cons: Cultural challenges; specially minorities lacking respect for female leaders. I am not enabled to do my job & constantly talked down to. It’s an exhausting trying to stay positive & move forward daily.
story: Collabera is great at celebrating wins & doing team events. Unfortunately due to COVID these haven’t been able to happen so the culture I’ve experiencing is mostly negative as referenced above. Hoping this all ends soon so I can balance out some of the negative with some positives!

pros: The work environment is great and its always good to see people who are so passionate to excel.
cons: Due attention not being given by lead/managers to people with less tenure.
story: During the lock down, it was good to know that Collabera didn't layoff anyone from India Team. However, at a time when people's lives were being impacted it could have made sense for the company to release a suitable amount of bonus would have gone a long way.

pros: Professionalism and work culture and atmosphere and rewards and recognition
cons: Long working  hours many time make us feel stress and executed also sometimes feel like work-life balance has to be maintained
story: so to share a bit from my experience working with Collabera . in the beginning for two months I was on no hire and i use to feel like leaving the job my team member always use to motivate me and help me to perform well

pros: Collabera is a work hard play hard work environment. The company culture is motivating and encouraging.
cons: Collabera could expand its hold on the market and continue to grow
story: When I started my job I instantly felt apart of the team and welcomed by my coworkers. My coworkers validate and congratulate me for my successes and work to help me if I need it.

pros: I would say the competitiveness and hunger to achieve more
cons: I would say the Traditional mindset of Managers and avoiding the conflicts before it can be taken care
story: Insanely Competitive - I would give my example only. I aimed to be a 1M recruiter in 2019 and its Collabera's culture which made me competitive, strive for more and accomplish which seems impossible.

story: I have learnt one thing here is responsive beyond imagination; like to survive in corporate word or social word this is really key to brighten your relationship.

pros: This is my first job and i really like a working environment. Managers are supportive

cons:
shift timings may sometimes becomes a Challenging
part.
story: When sometimes I am not able to perform then the positivity from team and specially from the lead and manager I get boost up my morale and confidence.

pros: My region has clients working in industries that are passions of mine, so I enjoy recruiting on those positions and consider this a benefit of working here
cons: My extra work is never acknowledged, I'm paid less that the industry average for someone of my experience level, and I find others in varying departments are less diligent and accurate in their work than I am which wastes my, and my candidates' time.
story: For all the hard work that most of us put into our jobs here, I do appreciate the times when our team can celebrate a win together, whether it be a milestone for the office or an individual team member - there is at least some of the work hard play hard mantra present here.

pros: The opportunity to meet new people that you wouldn't have had the opportunity to otherwise. Helping people find jobs and working through levels to reach great success.
cons: You can't predict what will happen with candidates or clients everyday. That's part of the fun, but also what makes staffing challenging.
story: Even though I just moved cities to work for Collabera, but haven't been able to meet anyone because of Covid, I still feel like I have people.

pros: Reasons are-Growth opportunities, Culture, training.Every moment is celebrated in Collabera.
cons: The only downsides of working with collabera is salary.
story:
We're disciplined in our daily work.
Responsive, and ready to find solutions to every question.Passionate about our work,teams, and goals.Insanely competitive- perform better, and create a lasting impact.Work hard and play hard.
