With that it has a lot of opportunities to build a good career
cons:
I feel the working hours are little long .
Computer systems  doesn't function properly
story: I really appreciate the work environment created by our mentors and leads in the team. I always feel happy to be around them and work with them.

pros: I enjoy parts of Collaberas culture and the encouragement of including all team members.
cons: Lots of pressure from management, not much transparency with what’s going on.
story: I can’t think of specifics but going with the team to celebrate after locking up a hire together.

pros: It gave me the opportunity to serve and give back to others while using my talents. As a recent college graduate and cancer survivor, I couldn't ask for a better opportunity to serve a community that I love and want to grow.
cons: The pay as an associate account manager is tough for someone trying to pay off college and affording moving expenses to a new location.
story: Right when I interviewed, Steve Guild met me on a Saturday, after hours, and made sure that I was not only a right fit for his team in Austin, but also the right fit for me as an individual. It's the attention to someones personal well being, the service to others, that makes Collabera stand out in the staffing industry.

pros: You're always engaged with something or the other . Here we have more than work life . Work environment and Collabera's image is really good in US that i experienced when i told my cousins that i work in Collabera and they were glad and happy.
cons: Only thing that i experience is way long working hours. it's almost 10 to 11 hrs of working after which we are unable to do what we want to do to refresh or any activity like daily sports or any other hobby is difficult to maintain the consistency.
story: It's very Competitive , thus gets us engaged , regarding any games or can take any competition that takes place are best way to be ahead

pros:
'- Chairman, President genuinely wants People to grow 
- Management listen to their people 
- A lot of passionate people around 
- A lot of motivation from stakeholders
- great vision
cons:
'- Lack of deep dive by management
- We need Managers who can lead by example. Managing alone will not help 
- We need more people who can execute the things and sustain the change 
- Inappropriate use of authority
story:
1. Work hard, play hard- I like the monthly shoutouts and recognition 

2. Responsive beyond imagination- I get the timely response form the Chairman and the President Anytime I reach out to them

pros: Collabera has the best work culture to with. It has always supported me in my good and bad times as well. Here decisions are not made on your current performance but each and everything is evaluated and steps are taken accordingly.
cons: Sometimes we need to stretch a lot as we don't meet our numbers or working on Saturdays compulsorily are sometime affecting our personal commitments.
story:
Before joining Collabera I was not at all self-confident, vocal and good at communicating with other but yes after working here I gained those things.
Collabera helped me in making myself more confident and strong.

pros: The working environment including the infrastructure is well maintained. This is one of the key aspects working here. The pay is descent with very attractive incentive structures.
cons: Pressure is a lot at times because of the amount of business at times which leads to health issues at times. There is a bit of partial behaviour towards local people of gujarat, so this is frustating at times.
story: Culture wise its descent and pretty good work culture in the office.

pros: Appreciations is given on a target achievement in a timely manner
cons: Working on some weekends(Saturdays) apart from it everything is good.
story: Team members are very helpful specially the outing that we do with them.

pros: I love the culture. The reason I took this job over others was because of the people here.
cons: The technology is very out of date. Would rather use personal computer/ mac OSx. Also there is grace because of COVID, but learning a new job from a distance was very difficult just so yall are aware.
story: Day or night, I have been able to call anyone for any advice/ question and they always are happy to help. Also, when I got hired i probably had 7-8 people from the Seattle office text me and tell me how excited they were to worl with me. That made me feel very welcomed.

pros: company culture, collaborative, exciting, challenging, rewarding.
cons: pressure, very fast paced, I can't think of anything else
story: My coworkers are so delightful to work with and everyone is so helpful and friendly. They got me doughnuts for my birthday and were so thoughtful.

pros: Great people and fun work environment. Lots of opportunity for money-motivated people like myself.
cons: Unpredictable industry which requires a lot of managing people who often let you down.
story: All of my teammates reached out to me within my first week here and made me feel part of a family.

pros:
Collabera is providing you platform to make your own identity, the Work culture is really good, for those who consider money is the motivation factor they can earn good, Events organised throughout the year will be the add on to the culture, you will see people from all across India. Small small contest and the grand event Blaze will give us motivation to work. 
We get to know about booming advance technologies of the market. And in the end we get relief when we place a candidate, you help people getting new role and candidates happy about it.
cons: The Major one is impacting our health because of the entire reverse routine, our social life if completely impacted with it. Many time you feel stressed because of the number oriented matrix, and this matrix will make you stressed and can impact your personal and professional nature of dealing things both the ways positive and negative. But it will change you for sure.
story:
The best part about the culture is always being competitive and everywhere, upgrading in terms of technologies, also competitive be it with the individual or be it a team or be it floors.
It really help an individual to grow personally and professionally, they become come aggressive towards their target in life and try to reach their goals and make new goals. They can be motivated with it. One more bad part is the recognition, on monthly and Yearly with Blaze, its energetic.

pros: Inclusiveness and the work culture is the best thing about the company, everyone is approachable, from a fellow colleague to the top level executives.
cons: Sometimes it might feel monotonous, but I believe that is only when one is not churning out results and if the results do not arise in time it can be a bit difficult, another thing would be missing out on local holidays.
story: I was struggling a bit in the previous team I was deployed in, but the people who trusted me helped me work through it and eventually deployed in another team where things seem better now. In this saga the good thing I found is that the company professionals know how to provide the right amount of personal and professional support to get things going. The company does care about the employees is what I found, which was refreshing.

pros: Good commission structure. I also really love what I do and feel that my leaderships knows that I am capable of getting the job done.
cons: Very competitive between recruiters for reqs to work on. Don't feel that my lead has my best interest.
story: There is a lot of turnover and has been in my office. There hasn't been a lot of consistency with orders and that negatively impacts the office. While I have had some successes most in my office have not and it presents a feast or famine culture.

pros: So far I've experienced a stellar company culture and have been nothing but satisfied with the amount of support I receive from my team. I love that my job is connecting with people.
cons: I do personally think that the metrics are stressed a bit too much in terms of candidates, I think that quality should hold more precedence over quality when it comes to submissions. There was also a pretty large bridge to gap between training and actually working as it seems like things vary so much office-to-office, which I think could be better avoided. However, I also have no experience running a business of any kind, let alone one with the footprint that Collabera has, so I understand that this input should be taken with a grain of salt.
story: I haven't been working for too terribly long at this point, so don't have anything really coming to mind. I have certainly seen the competitiveness as shown in our values which is generally fun and motivating.

pros: The best reason to work at Collabera is that we have a open communication system
cons: Working in a night shift for long periods of hours is a downside for me
story: The best example according to me that demonstrates Collabera's culture is the during the time of various contests run in the organization. People become insanely competitive and take part with atmost enthusiasm.

pros: We have the best work place and the work environment
cons: We should be provided with a solution for our mistakes rather than criticizing it
story: When I got my first hire, whole upper management were involved in it to ensure that the candidate is fit for the opportunity.

pros: good career guidance, best place to work and learn
cons: dont have anything coming on mind as of now, as we have the best work culture in office
story: think beyond imagination, is the thing i would like to highlight as the work and practices here exemplifies the way how we tackle a situation and make positive decision

pros:
1. Young, open-minded and a global crowd
2. Good Company Culture
3. Forward-thinking and IT savvy
cons: 1. Pay could be better keeping work experience in mind but I have high respect for the way Collabera has taken care of it's employees even during the Covid pandemic. So no complains at such times.
story: Progressive, all-embracing, IT savvy, empathetic, and fun while keeping the local culture and soul intact.

pros: First Reason is Collabera is Employee Friendly Company. The involment of every individual counts in this Company. Second reason to work here is I want to go to PC
cons: Well Team Alignment. Some people work with fast responding client some work with slow client and it continues. I believe everyone should get an opportunity to work every type of client. Suffling should be there after every year just make employee realize where we stand on Collabera as a whole.
story: I joined when EAW was going on. Initially I was bit confused why there is all sort of enjoyment and theme party was going on then my Mentor explained me about Collabera's Culture. I was very much impressed by hearing how Entire Collabera celebrates each and every individual success. How collabera family celebrates each and every festival. Coming to office won't feels to be boring because I know if I work hard i will get outcome from Collabera

pros:
Collabera has a healthy competitive work environment and culture. Each employee is praised and credited by his work and productivity. 
It takes care of it's employees and the work at the same time.
cons:
The shift timings seems to be a bit off sometimes.
It's a rare feeling but sometimes the work seems to be monotonous.
story:
It was my first hire and she was a really stubborn candidate who'd prefer talking to the upper management only, so my team (lead and manager) helped me getting her onboard and also taught me how to engage and deal with such candidates rather than blaming me for not having a great bond with your own candidate, which i learnt by time.

Also, in the beginning when i was newly deployed in the team, everyone were so friendly and helping and never backed down whenever i need help, even till now.

pros: Some of the best reason to work at Collabera is its Culture, Premises, engagement activities
cons: Some of the downsides of working at Collabera is its work timings, management control
story: On festivals provide salary on time or sometime before

pros: Collabera is one of the best company to work. Being a fresher in the market. I got my first job & I learned about many good things from my consultant & colleague working with me day in day out. Another good thing is about work environment is so good that I personally feel like my 2nd Home. I always want to be part of Collabera family if my future allows me.
cons: Only downside I see, Is working in night shift but it can be managed.
story: I am working with Collabera from last 2.4 years. I am a proactive recruiter, I am really enjoying my work but I don't see my future in proactive recruiting. I have many thing from recruiting but now I learning is less.

pros: The culture is so welcoming and everyone is always there to help.
cons: very high expectations, but makes me work harder to achieve them which I like
story: I started around the same time as a few other AAM's and having them to grow into Collabera has been so comforting. The more experienced employees have been so helpful and easy to talk to. I don't feel awkward around my co-workers.

pros: Collabera is a family not a company, I always feel like I'm surrounded by my family members. In my previous company, I was working but in Collabera I enjoy my work. We celebrate each functions, birthday's and small events. My team/dept is always ready to help if i am facing issue whether its personal or professional.
cons: Regarding downsides - Sometimes I feel there is a gap between management and people, we should have a quarterly or by-yearly a meeting or Coffee meeting between employee and top managements
story: Before joining Collabera I was working with company and going back to my home, however after joining Collabera I feel that I'm always with my Family. Collabera premises is like my second home. I experience that now I'm celebrating each and every functions.

pros: There are new challenges every day. Work culture is good. Team that I work with is amazing. Many competitions to participate in, helps in keeping the morale up. Workaholic environment. Appreciation give for the good work done. Nice infrastructure. Believe maintaining the relationship with the employees. team spirit is amazing. A good amount of incentives given .
cons: Doesn't have that many but to put some. Sometimes its hard to achieve the targets. Requires a tiring amount of handwork. Work is so indulging that sometimes its hard to think about your personal life. Pay can be better for the amount of working  hours that ones put in.
story: This one time it was hard to deliver one of my candidate because there was some issue with the documentation as the person was not having a system to do that. But the operations team as well as my team lead they both worked well in talking to the candidate and finally get that person delivered to the client. So kind of a good example to never give up and always believe in your team. I was having hard time in achieving my targets, but my lead keep pushing me and on the same side believing in me in that I will be able to do that in some time. And apparently I did that after all trust is all what we have. Another example of amazing people that I have around me.

pros: A very good competitive environment and they care for our success and eventually it helps us to be more successful in our life and like a trips, PC winners and Blaze
cons: Zoom meetings after office hours we really don't like while working from home
story: Passionate about our work: While I was working in Canada there was a security req with a niche skill set and everyone worked on that position except me and I thought no matter what I want to fill this position & I asked my manager that I will work on this req untill am not able to fill and my manager Hardev fully supported me and everyone in my team was saying you wont be able to find anyone on this we already worked on this and I not only submitted a candidate but we got an hire and we cracked that req and filled as well and we got an extension for his project and he worked for 2 years with that client that makes me feel so proud that my manager had trust on me and gives me a platform to respond beyond imagination and he saw how much am passionate about work.

pros: You are really really well appreciated for your achievements, which boots ups your morale and make you more work harder for the same.
cons: Some people are really thirsty for attention, like they want there name always to be there even if they played no role in his/her work or achievement
story: Its just 3 weeks i have joined the "FAMILY" but i already feel like home & really comfortable. One gets the acceptance really quick in here, people are warm, helpful to you.

pros: To work with leaders we dont need reason, Collabera is one of the best staffing company in world, I really feel proud working with collabera.
cons: There is no such downsides working with Collabera, but there is always scope of improvement & with strong management we always get direction.
story: Work Hard - Play Hard : Collabera make us work hard and on same ground pay us handsome amount to play hard, we have seen lot many trips, functions, on floor activities etc.

pros: Collabera provides multiple opportunities to make and grow your career.
cons: standardization of process/initiative is good but sometime it is not best fit for all department so we have to look at alternate solution rather then just imposing standardization. Also promoting right people is very important and we should not have many exception in this process.
story:
Insanely competitive - there have been many instance when we have killed our competitors in many ways. 
Work Hard Play hard - the way we celebrate our Annual Event both in USA and India which really motivate everyone to work and play even harder.

pros: Environment, encouragement, team, you help others, making world better
cons: Frustrating, sometimes all luck, sometimes you deal with difficult or rude people
story: Friendly, and always someone around to help you and encourage you to do better

pros: The people at Collabera are very welcoming and very helpful and they are always ready to solve all our doubts and confusions. Its a very energetic and entertaining environment to work in.
cons: The night shift can be a major reason of the negative points, but once we get used to it we enjoy this night shift. and also more working hours are a downside here.
story: When we were in college we were only taught the theoretical stuff and the faculties never focused on our personality development or the practical knowledge of the subject. But when I joined Collabera i found that it is very necessary to have more practical knowlwdge than the theoritical one as we have to apply that in the practical life. Also Collabera helped me in my personality develoopment and by working here I am able to look at a totally different person in me.

pros: I like the work culture and team environment and support which you get by managers and lead. You get appreciated even if it a small achievement. appreciated for your small small achievements as well.
cons: Sometimes there is a lot of pressure and that affects my performance sometimes.
story: You get a fair chance here to prove yourself. In my initial days I was deployed to a team and they thought I was not a good fit for their team. I felt very low. But then I got strong support from my trainer and my mentor from l&d team and after that I was deployed to the team and now I am getting support and proper guidance from my mentor and my manager which is helping me a lot to improve my performance.

pros: I have been working with Collabera for 5 years and I don't think I could have started my career this well with any other organization.
cons: Night shift is the only downside which I feel Collabera has, because of it we get very less time with family.
story: We celebrate all the festival at Collabera so the people who stay away from their family doesnt feel home sick and we enjoy together as family.

pros: Collabera is one of the top most MNC all over US and I think it's a challenging place to work and happening company as well
cons: I think it's time management, here there is no such time or specific time about work
story: Every Employee in Collabera are enthusiast when it comes to work and their performace

pros: Good Environment to work. I like the team work. Collabera pays on time
cons:
I do not like when some once break the ethics of Collabera, specially when it is at Management level. 
Management takes lot of time take decision
story: I do have both positive or negative positive stories. But i feel survey is not the right place. I will surely share with the Management in-person. i do not feel that surveys are taken seriously

pros:
Collabera had given me a great opportunity to learn many new things which help me in day in day out
Collabera provide several new competitions which helps in keep us engage and hard work for our work
There are many courses and certification which can enhance your qualification and knowledge
cons: There is no any specific downside from my end for Collabera apart from working hours
story:
So when i joined there were very good trainers who taught us about whole process and other things as well
At the time of deployment my trainers have 2 options for me but they choose the best one for me and after i deployed i got to learn lot many things new from my manager so that was very helpful for me 
Collabera people have very helpful and decent nature they will support with any kind of help doesn't matter if you are in a same or different team

pros: Owners & Leadership team always motivates to resources
cons: Have been with company more than 5 years & don't think i have any such reasons
story: First job with the company & i see myself growing in my field

pros: As Collabera (leading IT staffing firm), it has taught me every day to achieve more and more beyond your limitations. That is the best reason to work at Collabera.
cons: Not as of now. Till now the journey has been good. The one thing I really need right now is the working atmosphere at the office.
story: "Work Hard Play Hard"- the celebrations, the support, the discipline, the guidance all were needed to achieve your goal. And, this is what I see the positivity of it in our Collabera.

pros: open door policy, the people, respect in reputation
cons: internal competition, Disorganization of Corporate strategy, leadership lacking understanding of barriers with little resolution
story: the culture has shifted internally from a we to an I perspective. Leadership always wanting to stand out on own accord with little regard for the development of team. It didn't use to be like this. Too definition heavy and value oriented vs having a clear path and development for common good.

pros: My coworkers, the pay, fun role and freedom/flexibility
cons: 24/7 job, turnover in teammates and leadership, training
story: My Manager and I got together during covid to package food/items for people who needed help during the pandemic. We have also planned fun events/meals for essential groups we support.

pros: Collabera is very organized and we do celebrate all the indian festival as US ones as well.
cons: Collabera do not have any downside we always have positive mind set and manager and leads are keep us motivated towards our work.,
story: Collabera is very good organized company and all staff is very supportive and motivated at all times.

pros: Best place to work with positive and healthy work space.
cons: Due to the current situation on COVID - 19 that was only time faced challenges.
story: Working with collabera has boosted my energy and changed my mindset to next well that we can do something. #meinkhelega :)

pros: The people and Collabera’s morals, everyone’s work ethic, how everyone cheers everyone on, the work hard play hard mentality
cons: When it comes to work, you never know what you will get in terms of how many company’s are hiring/have needs. Sometimes there may be a dry spell with companies hiring and that means work can be slow.
story: When I was struggling in the beginning with achieving my metrics, I asked my regional manager to meet and discuss how I could improve. He told me that me approaching him about it said a lot about me and showed I am dedicated. That alone spoke volumes to me. Instead of focusing on the fact that I was frustrated, he complimented me on my ability to own up to it, acknowledge it and be transparent about it

pros: Working with Collabera has been an amazing experience.It has showed me what exactly a corporate firm looks like and it really has helped me learn a lot about the American work culture and understand the people out there.
cons: With Collabera it can exactly be called a downside but for beginners, this huge shift from sleeping at nights to working at nights can take a lot of time to adjust with and  change your entire schedule accordingly.
story: It is this one incident where we received appreciation from our IBM managers. We did receive an open position and with Delivery's help we were able to submit a perfect candidate the very same day and got a hire for him as well. The manager was so impressed by our understanding of the client needs and responsive behaviour that not only did he appraise us but know we have started receiving direct positions with him.

pros: Work culture is favorable. Working hours are comfortable so far
cons: Need more upskilling and challenging work. I need collabera to bring out the best in me. I feel its not taking out the best i have to serve. And salary scale to less
story:
Positive- The reporting managers are really understanding
Negative- There's a stigma amongst few people. And unhealthy politics- Not so great. Be competitive, thats good. But not in against of a person's image, or bad mouths.

pros: It aligns well with my interest of interacting with people and Collabera provides me a good scope to do so. The region I am working in right now provides me a chance to utilize my education for work as most clients are tech-focused
cons: I really sometimes feel a lack of work life balance because it appears that stretching out of work hour is more of a ritual and not a necessity, you have to do it even when it is not required.
story: I think I have a great team and I have worked with great people through out my time at Collabera. I do not have any such example or story to it. I just believe I am having the best clan to work with.

pros: There is ample importunity at this company, if I see a opportunity- I can take it, more importantly with the support of upper management. I have the freedom to pursue tasks that I see fit, and have a good management structure that I can rely on to enable me to be a productive employee. I have worked at Fortune 500 companies, I can confidently say that the opportunity to learn here is better.
cons: We are in a awkward stage between a small company and a medium to large, so some of our processes are changing to adapt to large volume, some are still rather manual and a work in progress. The benefits are mediocre (no 401k match, salary is not competitive, however the opportunity to learn could arguably be better than other Fortune 500 companies.
story: I sit in the Headquarters of the building which gives me the opportunity to converse with Executives on a daily basis- and also really get a feel for the culture based on the environment of our workspace. One experience that comes to mind is our Employee Appreciation Week, it truly brightens and brings to light that Collabera cares about its employees just as much as its clients. Instead of us helping the management, the executives will serve us ice cream and set up the lunch buffets, etc. While we have a client-centric focus year round, this time is where we get recognition for all of our hard work year round.

pros: The best reason to work at collabera is the environment the culture here is like a family. The bondings people have with there managers their team their floor and at last with collabera is awesome.
cons: The downsides of working with collabera is the timings we work in India is something everyone cannot adopt the night shifts. i don't see any other downsides of collabera.
story: The story of the woodcutter. Because we learn and grow, always so that we're continuously keeping ourselves sharp.

pros: It is a really good place to start a career, it will be a great provider for opportunities.
cons: It is not a place for everybody as the work pressure is a little high
story: One of the best time is when entire Collabera's family gathers for the diwali celebration, it is a really good feeling. It is really Work hard play hard culture

pros: Collabera is the one of the best company in the Staffing industry, they care about employees, I need not to worry about whether i would get salary on time or not
cons: 10 hrs work day is not good in Staffing as we are working in night shift, Here in Bangalore commute will take 2hrs of time at any given time of the day.
story: Whenever we need Collabera Always there to stand by employees, When the Pandemic happened Collabera allowed employees to work from home.

pros: Its keep growing year by year as we are keep adding new clients; finding innovative ways/ tools to do recruitment and financially strong company to work with.
story: Mid-level management is not following one of the core values of Collabera, i.e. "Responsive beyond imagination".

pros: Collabera is a great place to work. The environment is great and people around are amazing. Here there is good Employee Relations and Fair Treatment. There is Flexibility of Working Hours. They have good, Support and Training and Learning/Development.
cons: None at this point in time. All is going well currently.
story: None at this point in time. All is going well currently.

pros: Collabera just don't leave by its values but also give us the platform to showcase and enhance our skills. Such Friendly environment keep us in livelihood.
cons: While enhancing and expanding its network and people it might've missed the track of the dedication and efforts of tenured persons.
story:
"Having A Best Friend" 
Moral of story - Don’t value the things you have in your life. But value who you have in your life. "I do value my work and the ethics. With that I also expect the same from the company." It is the give and take policy which binds us all.

pros: Employee engagement activities, Good incentives and compensation
cons: I dont think there is any which I can say. I have worked with Collabera since past 5 years and I am very much happy with my organization.
story: I am not sure what to mention here but I think Collabera is that one organization who takes care of their employee needs.

pros: In staffing, you look at the relationships that a company has with its clients. One of the best reasons to work with Collabera is its Client first culture.
cons: Recruiting is sometime a gamble. We see only numbers at the end of the day, which I dont think is a fair parameter to judge a performance. Effort should be the main parameter.
story: Got awarded back to back for performers meet in recent Corona days. Our SDM Khushal Bakshi highlighted each and every story of the winners including me about the struggle we face daily with during this times but are still pushing for those higher. The best part is to keep every one motivated in this times to keep pushing and get settled in this new norm.

pros: Work environment is too good. There will be people around you to help you out, but make sure that you achieve the target hires. While talking to some of the candidates I got some of the good reviews from them that they trust collabera and their multiple friends are placed in different firms through collabera.
cons: Work environment is too good. There will be people around you to help you out, but make sure that you achieve the target hires. While talking to some of the candidates I got some of the good reviews from them them that they trust collabera and their multiple friends are placed in different firms through collabera.
story: Work environment is too good. There will be people around you to help you out, but make sure that you achieve the target hires. While talking to some of the candidates I got some of the good reviews from them them that they trust collabera and their multiple friends are placed in different firms through collabera.

pros: Team work and the work culture we practice here, Every small work we do is done with utmost sincerity,
cons: In Collabera we consider work as our top priory and irrespective of any circumstances we tend to do our best
story:
During the Christmas Eve we celebrate together the job and enthusiasm of this eve whereas each day we tend to do our best with the task assigned to us.
"Work Hard, Play Hard"

pros: Collabera provides an exceptional eco-system and best in class corporate environment, which makes you feel at home, even when you are at work. Collabera, as an organization has always believed in celebrating even the smallest of achievements. Collabera, has always invested well in the growth of the employees by conducting various training programs by the best in business Trainers.
cons: The only downside is compensation. As compared to industry trends, I believe Collabera offers relatively lesser base compensation than the competitors or other similar companies (This is my personal opinion & it is by keeping in mind the India Operations, especially Vadodara Operations)
story: I cannot think of anything else, but our annual Award Ceremony, BLAZE. I have been a BLAZE winner twice during my tenure with Collabera, and I must say, it has been an exceptionally excellent experience, year over year. 100s of people cheering and dancing on the same tone, is something I haven't seen anywhere ever. And this is the thing that talks high about the kind of energy we as Collaberites have, and it is all because of the culture that we have been preserving and following for over 2 Decades now.

pros: Trust of senior leadership in my abilities, freedom to work and take decisions on my own, clear objectives and goals, transparency of leadership in decision making, supportive during personal emergencies, liberal thought process
cons: Difficult to break into the inner circle of people, wrong tradition of "go along to get along", inability to channelize large goals into department initiatives, department heads working in silo, our thought process in many areas is still of a startup while we dream of a billion $ goal
story: i think the value of "excellence in execution" best exemplifies my experience in the last 4 years of tenure. The way i was trusted by my superiors to make decisions for the betterment of the team and was supported during the tough times shows the value system that's driven to the core.

pros: Best Environment, Gives us motivation to work more and earn money
cons: Shift Timings which i think should be taken care, apart from that i don't think anything else
story: Work Hard Play Hard--- we have received some bulk positions and we really worked on Saturday to fill those positions and after that we had a team outing just next week!!

pros: A quality culture of mutual support (team) made up of quality people
cons: There is some ambiguity within my current role and my department as a whole.
story: When a difficult situation arose, the leadership was supportive of growth for all members involved rather than looking for someone to blame or otherwise cut down.

pros: Opportunity, Clarity of thoughts and vision, Autonomy to perform job and Recognition.
cons:
At times not appreciative of thoughts and ideas that come from people within vs people coming from competition.
Not Evolving quickly with changing times and have traditional way of measuring people's performance.
story:
One story that touched my heart at Collabera so far has been when I was onsite at our HQ in NJ as a Recruiter in 2008. It was my first visit to US. Although we had a challenging year with Recession looming charge, I had a successful year and I was able to do 36 starts in 36 weeks being onsite. 
Sham decided to host a farewell lunch and invited all VPs, NAMs and DMs for that lunch. He gifted me iPod and $1000 gift check and Thank you Letter. It was not the gift or amount that mattered but this gesture really meant a lot to me and showed how much people care here.
This shows how passionate Collabera is towards its employees.

story: Story which comes to my mind is of a Rabbit and Tortoise Race. In that story Tortoise won because he didn't give up and gave his consistent efforts. Same if in Collabera you are giving consistent and competitive efforts nobody can stop you to win.

pros: I love being constantly busy, and I feel so accomplished when I get a sub, set a MORC, and get leads. I love the environment and culture of this business and Collabera itself.

story: The night before I first started I was very anxious because I moved to a new city because of my position at Collabera. I walked in and immediately the other AAMs, AMs, and managers wanted us to succeed. I still believe they do. We all help each other learn. I honestly feel like colleagues are like family in a way. I don’t feel nervous to ask questions when I am confused. I also love the competitiveness In the room. I get an adrenaline rush at work. I want to succeed and everyone else in my office and colleagues at other offices want to do well as well. Everyone is rooting for each other.

story: When I joined Collabera, someone told me in my induction (I think that was Sumeet Pankajakshan or Ayush Vyas) that all 19 folks in that batch should understand one thing that if you're here (Joining Collabera) then there are only two possibilities either Collabera is the best option you've got or you do not have any other option... For me the both of them were true and the best part is that Collabera (People) almost never let me feel either of it... I'd say this mattered most to me in my 8 years journey with Collabera and it is something that defines Collabera Culture at its BEST.

story: We had few niche requirements coming our way from our client. Most of the competitors gave up knowing the complexity of hiring process and also difficulty in finding niche resources. Partnership between me and sales together helped to crack the deal and opened the doors to directly interact with with Director of that specific LOB. We are the top and only vendor that comes to their mind when they have to fill such difficult requirements now and we finally built the entire team for them. Game changer for us was the quality of the resumes Sourced and shared that helped the sales to be confident enough  to present in front of the client and get the deal our way!! We displayed all our Collabera’s core values during the entire transactions thus leaving our marks at the client side

pros: Since Collabera intends to use technology to drive its growth, there would be good opportunities for developers.
cons: Since Collabera is not primarily a technology company, sometimes expectations by business people might be little unrealistic. Also, it might be a bit difficult to explain to business leaders why some development projects, change requests might take time. Its difficult for business people to understand that due to intangible nature of the technology work, estimation might not be accurate and there can be delays, and that delays are not uncommon. Technology processes are not in place, so there is ad hoc way of doing things which might speed things up a little. However its not desirable in the long run, if Collabera truly aims to be a company where technology is supposed to be driving factor, instead of just being enabler of business. Unrealistic deadlines put pressure on developers and there is always danger that quality will suffer.

story: I faced the first professional challenge for one of my hiring projects for a key customer account. The candidate that had the right skill set-aligned with the client requirement was unwilling to engage with Collabera due to some prior bad-experience. One of the key personal traits that helped me to resolve the issue was my empathetic behavior along with imbibing the Collabera's passion to serve its clients & employees. I decided to engage with the candidate with an approach of listening and understanding the root cause. Based on the discussion, it was clear that the reason of the unhappiness was the absence of feedback on the various applications that the candidate has engaged with our company. On one hand I apologized for the earlier experiences and on the other hand promised her to provide a timely feedback. This helped to secure the candidate for my client and consequently to win business for Collabera. This incidence taught me a great lesson of my life that human are the key resources that defines the success or the failure of an organization hence being passionate in your responsibilities helps you breakthrough the toughest challenges

pros:
Collabera has a very engaging environment, never have I ever felt isolated or separated in any task or activity.
The work environment has a very coherent structure, with clearly defined roles that  prevents any kind of misunderstanding.

story:
After working with an established team for 10 months, I was asked if I would like to make a move to one of the newer teams.
Initially, I was concerned, not only about the transition, but whether I would be able to show the same level of productivity in the new team.
I discussed with my lead, Manager and teammates and decided to make the JUMP. 
Suffice to say, the success I have experienced made me realize that I was given a chance not only to move out of my comfort zone, but also to maximize my potential by being a part of an emerging venture.
