story:
For one deadline, whole team use to stay in office and have fun while working and while having dinner at 12 midnight. That was fun.
Sometimes we dont have our priorities set and everything comes together so that spoils the work life balance.

pros: I love the passion and hard work that is displayed on a daily basis.
cons: I feel that there are too many individuals involved for simple tasks and I find myself having to speak with multiple individuals to get an issue resolved.
story: The one example that sticks out to me on a daily basis is that our delivery teams all work an overnight schedule and I so impressed that they are able to live that type of life while maintaining passion and strong work ethic.

pros: Collabera has given me a platform to show my talent and be whom I am. I have always been recognized for my achievements and in times when things are not great I have received all the support and guidance that has pushed me to overcome my failures and fears and do well. As a fresher, I got one of the best platform that a new joinee wishes to set her foot in the corporate world.
cons: Not always but sometimes I do feel socially detached due to difference in the timing that my friends and family lives in compared to mine.
story: One of the best thing or core value that Collabera always implies in their work ethics is Work hard and play hard. When it comes to work we as a whole team put all our efforts and always try to overachieve the set target. However when it comes to play I believe we always celebrate even the slightest of the success that we achieve. Right from team trips to various sports organized by Collabera we ensure that there is nothing missing in our life.

pros: I like the work environment of the company and another reason of working at collabera is recognitions and rewards. The R & Rs and Blaze awards truly motivate you to focus towards success.
cons: Some of the downsides of Collabera is the pay. The salaries as per the market rates are really less in Collabera.
story: Chances. From my past experience, I have seen that Collabera gives people a lot of chances to improvise and to work on their skills. One such opportunity was given to me in my initial days of working with Collabera where my talent was recognized by my managers and I was given an opportunity to work in that particular area where my forte lies

pros: Working at Collabera is always fun and feels like home.
cons: No such Cons or downsides I have faced in Collabera so far.
story: Working at Collabera is an honor and it really feels like work is our 2nd home. There is no stress and I personally enjoy my work.

pros: I am local to Vadodara and Collabera pays really well in this city, it has a lot of diverse opportunities within the company itself
cons: Night shift in the long run can take a toll on your health and we need to get more active in the day, lot of competition now pays more for similar kind of work
story: I had 2 good leaders in my tenure with Collabera, they really taught me well but are not with the company anymore, i feel in the sales side for the india office there are not many growth paths as envisioned initially when joining the company.

pros: Collabera is among the best staffing company in Baroda to work with. From Collabera I started my career and still with them :)
cons: The only cons I see are the work hours. From my personal experiences I have see that I have been working continuously more than 12 hrs without getting overtime.
story:
Work Hard, Play Hard!
I do not recall any such stories but have seen that this is best value we have adhere to.

pros: The Best reasons to work here in collabera is the work environment and the energy around me that motivates me every time.
cons: While working in the nightshift it is a bit difficult to manage the time schedule and got drained after some heavy tasks.
story: So the point that catches my mind here in collabera is Work Hard, Play hard. At the time of work, you doing with all the best and at time of relaxing, you are chilling. And here in collabera I am trying to push my limits which makes me better each and everyday.

pros: Great platform to grow your career to the next stage and learn business in the true sense as the company keeps growing and doing new things. Great people. Work hard play hard. Passion to grow business by providing best in class service to clients and employees.
cons: If one is not serious about growing business and hungry to grow, learn, and earn, they may find themselves in a wrong place.
story: Many stories over past 20 years. The common theme regarding all is to ensure that we provide our clients the best and most responsive service which are delivered with sales, recruiting, and management all coming together and doing what it takes to deliver to the client, meet/ surpass their expectations and continue to grow.

pros: My number reason i enjoy working at collabera is because of the positive culture.
cons: I havent experienced really any downsides to working here.
story: Office atmosphere, everyone works together and celebrates together were able to do this evey day durring red zone

pros: Work Culture at Collabera is very good. Feel proud to work with Collabera. People here are co-operative. Collabera gives opportunity to learn new things.
cons: Frequent change in roles. Sometimes feel demotivated.
story: Appreciating good work of employees in the form of rewards and recognition. Appreciating employees at annual function like Blaze.
Job Title: Associate Manager Market Research & Data Analyst

pros: Commission plans were much stronger than other firms, was able to be part of something new, reviews of the company we positive and the company is in growth mode
cons: I think we should look at other technologies or systems that could help us get more business or be more competitive, at times our technologies dont work when we need them. The time from when a client pays to the time our commission is paid out is a longer time span then other firms.
story: Collabera does a nice job recognizing its employee from mile stones to 1st placements, to hot leads and its recognized collectively as well as personally.

pros:
Collabera provides really good working environment.
Managers are tenured & knows really well about the business & handle things like piece of a cake.
cons:
I feel working at night makes it a bit difficult & Indian holidays are also not provided.
Pay is low compared to other staffing firms.
story:
Celebration of the festivals in Collabera is really fun.
Colleagues are also fun to work with.

pros: Well there are many reasons to work in Collabera, among them i like good working culture and friendly users.
cons: I don't find any downside of working in Collabera from my point of view.
story: I have refereed one of my friend and i am glad that he successfully passed all the interviewing steps and joined Collabera family. He was having some problems of his documents to be couriered to Vadodara. In such situations, Collabera understands the situation of new joinee and help and guide them by providing additional time and various resources and alternatives for the documents.This really proves that Collabera believes in "passionate to service clients and employees".

pros: People are very cooperative and helpful and there is no politics as of now in the environment.
cons: People are very demanding and pressure exerted is many a times emotionally draining.
story: Not any specific story as of now but will share in future if I experience it.

pros:
best work environment and everyone is friendly to help 
Nature is good there is no boss here everyone is a friend 
overall its very good
cons:
no downstides its very good i really like collabera and its a best company 
looking for achieving good goals
story: I was having a problem in finding resumes and a good candidate so I asked help and everyone was ready to help so I really loved this behavior everyone is friendly n helpfull

pros: the best reason to work at Collabera is the people, it's a young culture and a lot of my new friends I have met at work
cons: Staffing involves a lot of work and moving parts. You have to deal with the people-factor, which can mean you do everything right and something out of your control can derail a sale/hire/start. Also, a metrics driven company adds stresses to it's employees that aren't always necessary -- should be driving quality over quantity of meetings/calls.
story: If you have an issue in your personal life, I have observed that employees treat each other like family/friends. They understand that personal life is not separate from work life.

pros:
Work culture at Collabera. A good balance between work and leisure. Coordination among employees is appreciable. Everyone has sharing and caring attitude. Everyone is equally respected irrespective of whether he or she is fresher, experienced, senior or at a junior level. 
Collabera's core value describes everything about how we work and cater to our consultants as well as clients. On the whole I find it a best organization to work for.
cons: There are many positive aspects of working in Collabera. But there are some negative points also which I think should be taken care of. But it is my perception which may or may not be true. Work hours are long which I think should be reduced a bit. I do not find any other negative aspect of working at Collabera.
story:
My managers supported me right from my induction phase till date they are supporting me a lot. They cared me and motivated me in every aspect. They showed me right path to succceed. I was initially stucked after my induction phase was over and was very much disappointed that I will not be able to work any more here as I lacked enough intellect to become a successful recruiter.
But my trainer motivated me and she worked with me for around two weeks continuously due to which finally I came on track and now enjoying my work whole heartidly.

pros: I love working at Collabera because I get the freedom to work. People are approachable and humble and that makes our work environment better.
cons: In my case, Collabera's core work is totally different from what I am doing right now. Sometimes people don't understand the work process or the efforts i am putting in on daily basis.
story: I always look for the positive vibes around me. When it comes to Collabera, I think our core values are very strong. People are passionate towards their work. One of the best thing about Collaberas' culture is that people are always supportive.

pros: Working with Collabera is still a dream for some people, i am very glad to work here and I found very positive atmosphere.
cons: There is no such downside but I would like to say that management should look after employees incremental part and they should give more raise.
story: I don't have such story to share but would like to share my feelings while working in Collabera. When I joined this organisation I felt really happy and I am really proud working in Collabera. I can proudly say that I work in one of the best companies.

pros: The people, everyone is so nice - super energetic, very very hard working and HONEST. When you do well, you will know it and when you mess up, you will know it but it will always come with a learning lesson.
cons: Internal systems are slow, the offshore IT team is quick to say they can not do things or will argue with you that you did something incorrectly - and once you prove them wrong they do not apologize. We have to escalate things a lot but once you do it gets done.
story: I just love how everything is a celebration. Get a hire? Celebration? Get engaged - celebration, buy your first nice purse or dress shoe or watch - everyone celebrates. No matter how small or large (inside of work or an event outside of work) there is such a sense of community. This job is not easy. Its just not. There are days when I am like what the heck just happened, but you have people constantly supporting you and 'hyping' you up - even if you did make a mistake someone in your office will be there to try and make you feel better and do it differently next time.

pros: Everyday Is A New Day, New Learnings, and Ambiance. People are so Competitive, young and Boisterous. You can never get exhausted here and you shouldn't. You'll meet up with awesome people.
cons: Team Management I'd Say, Favouritism and Poor HR Management
story: One day I was in a state where I need to get 3 submission to win the competition since back then I was most junior in my team. After 3 PM I didn't get a single Sub and I was so depressed at that moment of time but all of the sudden all my team members came to me and they just left their work and pushed me hard to get three submissions. so that was my story of team spirit.

pros: Collabera is one of the best company when it comes to working culture. Great working atmosphere with helpful people. Never felt that people here are stranger to me. Everyone is treated equally and every good work which is done by any of us is appreciated by the management. Incentive plans are far better than other companies.
cons: Obviously the first thing which will come in our mind is night shift. Working in night is not everyone's cup of tea. Just need some time to adjust, not really a big Con i would say. Second is the working hours. Sometimes or say many times we work more than the actual working hours. Little increment in the base salary would make it perfect place to work.
story: When I had my first submission, just a submission my lead motivated me and congratulated me for that, and this appreciation really meant to me as I was new in the team and that was my first day on floor. When I got my first hire, I was appreciated by my whole team, I would say it was whole floor. My work was acknowledged by my team and it was awesome for me. Team gathering for lunch or breakfast and the trips we have is something that we all appreciate.

pros: Collabera it is my dream company. I always want to work with Collabera and of course, Collabera Culture, environment and Leads and Team always support you if its personal our professional
cons: Honestly, I don't have any reason. there is some ups and down but it is happen in your personal and professional life both.
story:
There is one thing I want to share, it is my dream to work with Collabera but there is one more thing, I am only personal in my family who is earning and after joining Collabera my family condition is very very better.
My mom always want me to grow in my career because some family issues I couldn't complete my study.Once when some relatives ask my mom where Urmi's working is she is working in Call center that moment my mom proudly says she is working in Collabera. That's is the best moment of my life.
I am really very very "Thankful" to Mr. Hiten Patel and Sham Patel and to all of those who give me this opportunity.
I have learn so many things here from my senior Ankur Patel about work, but I have learn one most important thing from him is " NEVER GIVE UP" no matter what try till end.

pros: Pros about working here is the environment I am in now is very upbeat and lively. People around me are very friendly and easy going.
cons: Con is that the IT team I am in is looked down upon. Feel like we are left in the back seat and looked over most times.
story: When I think of a story that best exemplifies Collabera culture I would pick this time right now. Quarantine is really making it tough for most to get out of bed. Which brings p the word discipline. We would have to stay discipline and know our job intels.

pros: Awesome as we are working together with one roof as a family & it matters the most for all of us.
cons: NA as of now as we look upto our management in any hard situation & that help[ us in overcoming any and every tough situation.
story: When I joined Collabera i got such a wonderful team & mentor that not only helped in my taks they also helped me in building my career goals.

pros: It gives   friendly, fun loving atmosphere, good  to be associated, good opportunities  to take care of , learnings
cons: Work hours should be 8 hours instead of 10, and nothing else, other things are good.
story: Employee Appreciation and fun to work activities . Brand promotion and instilling feeling of ownership.

pros: self satisfaction, there will be opportunities to work outside of my job description.
cons: Still trying to find myself, let complete your part and wait
story: This company culture will push me to work hard and perform well. There will likely be obstacles to my work that I’ll need to tackle head on. Problem solving isn’t an asset; it’s an expectation

pros:
Working at Collabera is an amazing experience. Being my first job, I have enjoyed every moment here at Collabera. The work culture at Collabera gives an experience of professionalism which is really important for someone who is beginning their professional journey. To sum it up in a few points, Collabera offer : 
-Excellent Work Culture
-Professionalism
-Continuous room for development
cons:
There are no downsides as such but yes there can be a few points where we can improve:
-More disciplined work schedule which can improve efficiency
-Employee Reward Structure
-Interaction between different departments
story:
The best story are the from the time when you struggle. So here is mine.
I had a rough patch in work where everything was going against me, the efforts were not giving the outcomes.
This was the time when I saw the support my managers and Collabera gave me. Their confidence in me gave a much needed support in not letting my moral down and eventually I was back on track in a short span of time.

pros: The team support is one of the key most important factor to work with Collabera.
cons: The pressure at some point of time from the managers is very high, this is the biggest downside I believe.
story: When a RFP project was about to come and for that we work even on Saturday to pipeline the candidate.

pros: Like the working environment. The energy and positive attitude is awesome in all while working
cons: some times feel that there is favoritism done among the team
story: Not sure of any as such experience that best exemplifies Collabera's culture

pros: Good work culture, There's a lot of optimistic folks to work with who help you in every possible way they can. It's more like a family when you're working in the ER team.
cons: Have to work in the night shifts which can be a task at times however that's the only con I think there could be. There's Collabera offices that offer day shifts in Global business which could be the best place to work tbh.
story: So when I initially joined Collabera, I guess I was in training and there were a few tenured folks out in the lobby discussing something and someone jumped across the lobby and they were told in a very nice sweet way by the tenured folks that we don't have any doctors in this facility. I was impressed to hear that since I appreciate people who can convey their stern messages in a smooth way.

pros:
Company's growth and success.
Company's culture & values.
Good Employee Relations and Fair Treatment.
Support and Training and Learning/Development.
Benefits and Incentives.
cons: According to me, I don't find any downside working at Collabera.
story:
According to me, I like all 5 culture values of Collabera. 
Which are : Work hard Play hard, Disciplined to achieve excellence in execution, Responsive beyond imagination, Passionate to serve client & employee, Insanely competitive.

pros:
Resources: we're one of the lucky companies to have the resources to send our employees to WFH fully equipped. 
Open door policy: everyone is always willing to help when a coworker is in need
The positive reinforcement: highlights, shoutouts, etc: definitely builds our confidence, motivation and the work hard play hard attitude
cons: Sometimes not everyone is on the same page, causing a domino effect on everyone else involved (AAMs-AM-Delivery). 80% of the time I feel there is more and more thrown at us/on our plates, making it a little overwhelming sometimes. Like priorities for HL's and metric expectations there, along with ref checks, along with inhouses, along with helping other ref checks, along with setting meetings etc etc. and Clique-iness/mutual respect when talking to coworkers, on and offshore
story: In the very beginning of my employment there was a candidate (Sr level) that was basically just a know-it-all and a little rude to me for not knowing the ins and outs of a certain database/platform. During phone screen with my AM, candidate had another comment and with no hesitation, my AM had my back professionally and reiterated to me that we would not move forward if I did not feel comfortable with this candidate. I think working in an environment where you know everyone has each others backs is so important!

pros: I like most Collabera's value and Work culture of Collabera.
cons: Collabera's work culture is very positive and energetic. I learnt many things here during my tenure.
story: I feel, That's the great place to work here and i like Collabera's values.

pros: Collabera offers some nice perks in the discount program and also has nice offices
cons: The management is not engaged with lower level employees, along with any approvals must go through many steps. Slows down work by days even weeks. Pay could be significantly better.
story: I like employee appreciation week and women's day when we get cool gifts and tshirts and we get to have a team building days.

pros: I enjoy the culture of the company. I enjoy all of my coworkers because they have become my friends outside of the office as well. Collabera is very understanding of my feelings towards working from home during COVID.
cons: Sometimes work has consumed too much of my life outside of typical work hours. This isn't required by my senior but I feel the need to bring work home after hours in order to keep up with my colleagues.
story: There was a time when my senior asked us to work on a Saturday to help fill some openings that were moving very quick (completely letting us decide if we wanted to). After that we all went out for a happy hour and celebrated the hard work.

pros: The first reason to work in collabera is the reputation of the company, the comes the job position on which I am working. The culture of collabera is suitable for the growth of youngsters like us and i like how constantly the company motivates all for the same
cons: The only down side of working in collabera for me at present is the night shift, and that is because it is something new for me and it will take time to adapt to it. so for now i will go with this reason
story: Story of Aman, who was our trainer. while in training we used to have a lot of doubts, every doubts were answered by him which explains his timely responsive and he was fun and made us do fun activities, which shows work hard play hard.

pros: Collabera is known for identifying the top talent and help them achieve their goals by providing them necessary learning
cons: Employees at low level gets less visibility of what's happening within the organisation and how Collabera doing in the market place. We have to give them the proud feel every now and then for working with Collabera.
story: This from my personal experience, I was hired to manage HRBP function for recruitment delivery division. However, my passion and experience was into managing the IT division. My manager has given me the opportunity to manage a small unit of IT, and after looking at the results, I was appointed to manage the complete IT unit for a location. I feel job rotation is the key motivational factors for few employees to broaden their skill sets and, most important, hold onto them. "It helps employees spread their wings and extend their boundaries"

pros: I have gained a lot of close friendships within my department.
cons: Unfortunately, I think there is some unequal treatment and definitely unfair pay (at least in my department).  It is hard to want to work every day when I know I have so much more potential than what I feel like I have here.  I also feel like I am not fully trusted, which also makes it harder to work.
story: It is hard to highlight some of the cultural values in my department because I am not sales.  While I think it is important to be very responsive and passionate to serve others in my role, the company as a whole is more focused on the sales aspect and often looks over how important other roles in the company actually are.

pros: The work culture is Fantastic, the people are amazing. The way Collabera is structured is just marvellous considering all departments have specific set of tasks assigned. When it comes to learning about staffing industry, undoubtedly Collabera is the best firm to start off with!
cons: Lesser opportunities and lack of proper utilization of resources based on their area of interests and expertise and most importantly lower pay grade aa compared to the competition.
story: The work culture and the people are amazing which encourages people to work with Collabera for a longer period. However, what I feel is that people should be aligned in the organization as per their interests and skills expertise which lacks in Collabera. If given an opportunity to work as per the areas of interests, I feel that people would want to stay for a longer period. Again, the pay grade is really less, people tend to leave after gaining expertise from Collabera. Instead if they’re paid enough they can take Collabera to the next level but because of lower pay grade, they’ll learn from Collabera and utilize and implement their expertise somewhere else.

pros:
'- From GCI to Collabera, for me it has always been first wife. Lot of arguments, logical/illogical but Mehul always forgave me. Rahul always there to guide me. Himanshu does understands my strength/weakness and knows how to get work done from me. CP is my Nemesis. Kapil one of the smart guy, who is my role model. Title does not motivate me but people does and these are few people who make a strong reason to work with Collabera.
- Collabera was there when I met with almost fatal road accident.
- People are treated as people by Collabera.
- Ample opportunity is given to new joiners to perform. 
- This is second recession that I am seeing with Collabera and we did not lay people off, at least in Baroda.
- It’s been 14 years, still feels like day one, however miss big time working with Mehul, Rahul and CP. 
- Sham, Hemin, HireMe...the down to earth people, for whom would do anything.
- I can go on, Collabera is the best place to work with.
cons:
'- If someone wants to resign, we make it too difficult for that person, not saying we should not try to save, but it gets too much.
-Feel a lot that,I am a slave to U.S. counter parts especially NAMs. They don't understand people challenges here in Baroda, have to obey them. Was thrown out of client coz of chemistry mismatch.
- I have clients who are a big time challenge to cater, but that is not taken into consideration during ratings and/or money. 
- I have overshot stretch target, but was paid for stretch money, when target missed was very less or nothing.
- We are or entering or entered in saturation phase, opportunities are drying up.
story:
'- Responsive beyond Imagination - CP even managing the day, he responds to my email even at middle of night(India). Rahul always responds to me in few hours.
- Play hard Work hard - CPL, CVPL, Navratri, Diwali, Christmas...biggest of all Blaze are true example of how we play hard. Got a bulk deal on Friday and people were there to work on Saturday to support it.

pros: I like the cultural environment and closeness we all have. We all motivate each other and are competitive.
cons: can be very stressful. sometimes it is hard to have a work - life balance.
story: Going through ups and downs as an office - we've been through a lot with each other and we truly are like family

pros: The people you work with and the potential money you can make if you're put in the right situation
cons: The "selling culture" is not aligned with my values (being forced go to happy hours with older men) and if you're not given the right resources/in the best situation it is hard to excel
story: I love Collabera's culture from my office and I think all of us exemplify the mentality Collabrea tries to portray professionally. There are other offices (through stories I've heard) and people that have come in town from other offices that do not portray it correctly or professionally. For example, once we had somebody in town visiting from another office and we went to happy hour with said person. At the happy hour when I was moving into the sales roles she said "you need to make sure that you're portraying the idea of these managers potentially getting what they want from you, but never actually letting them. I once had a manager say he was going to leave his wife for me, now that was too far."

pros: The work culture, the work life balance is good, overall environment is very encouraging, company thinks about takes care about their employees,
cons: working hours are too long, company should consider indian holidays, we feel like alien in our own country, no of paid holidays should be increased,
story: I remember how we celebrated employee's appreciation week. Also the team trips are also something that boosts the moral of the team and the individuals

pros: Working with Collabera is like the best thing happened in my life. I am doing exactly what i love to do. Collabera has always encourages their employers not only professionally but personally as well.
cons: Sometime there are lot of pressure comes which is slightly not good for mental health.
story: I love Collabera because they celebrate each and every festivals, specials day, they do have fun Friday as well.

pros: Collabera is a brand and I have never been in staffing industry hence this is a new experience to me
cons: No transport, 10 hours working where other companies offer 9.30 working hours.
story: I recently joined hence I don't have much to say but definitely excited to the upcoming events.

pros: Collabera is a big name in the market and I feel proud be a part of this association. Also I never disappointed when it comes to hearing my opinion.
cons: I feel sometime the work pressure is more and to override it we have to put long hours. Though the incentive and the bonus plans are lucrative but when it comes to salary i still feel we are little under paid as compared to the market outside.
story: Work Hard , Play Hard- I already mentioned that sometimes we have to put extra hours due to the continuous target pressure however our organisations ensures at every step that while we work hard we also get to play hard. Employee Appreciation Week is one such example while our organisations makes all of us feels real special.

pros: The people and the environment! I am always excited to come into the office
cons: As of right now, I have not experienced any reason why I would not like working for Collabera
story: When my mother was very sick with COVID19 and my family was unsure of her recovery Collabera was very supportive

pros: Has given a platform where, my team is considered the engine of the train, and it gives immense pleasure to be the first poc for any new business coming to Collabera. The opportunities, the care, the growth prospects, the culture, the environment are just some of the many highlights of working at Collabera, which makes it an awesome company to work for.
Collabera's management approach ensures success and pushes me to my best capability
cons: More Number driven to achieve objective and sometimes people factor is left behind
story: Responsiveness - Majority of collabera people have the mindset of responsiveness which actually increases enagagement and helps more success.

pros: Strong family culture, people who understand you because many of them have been where you were before
cons: Strong pressure to physically be in office where other sales positions are not like that
story: Employee appreciation week every year. Shows the reward we get for working hard.

pros: work life balance, my manager, my team, when we win it feels good
cons: disorganized, not efficient processes, embarrassing upper management
story: unfortunately this story highlights a negative, but it jumps out as me as a perfect way to highlight "negative culture". I was trying to call on an account here in my city, I reached out to SAT and Atlanta office because that is the HQ to see if we had a MSA. we did not. I continued to call and try to set meetings in my area, and after like 2 years someone else in my office reached out again to SAT and ATL to check in, and we were approved now. And no one shared that info with us. We had no idea, total lack of communication. it's sloppy.

pros: The environment we get to work is great. The fun Friday mode aswell. We really appreciate that.
cons: work stress we get and working hours. working hours should be lessened and the work stress we get. It really puts a pressure.
story: The fun Friday mode. The best environment we get. The festival and get together which collabera celebrates totally like a family.

pros: For me Collabera is not just a workplace, I feel more than that with this organization, I proudly can say that this is a kind of learning institution for me that always motivates & directs me to keep the learning attitude up!
cons: As I found most of the people are very competitive & multi tasking here, this is something often makes me feel down, as sometimes I lack in few things but on a positive aspect it encourages me as well to improve more better!
story: Music is one my favorite hobbies and I played guitar multiple times at my work place & It was not me who himself did that because my own director & work mates willingly demanded to do so, that I found really nice in terms of Collabera culture, where people do also care about your own interests & hobbies & show their interest to become a good audience or listener for you!

pros: Collabera is a best place to work on and we have nice management. People are working as a team and they feel like family. Celebrating functions together, enjoying their success  together, leads are helping their resources.
cons: Employee satisfaction is very less what i feel. Work load is too high,  people have some success factor but it takes time.
story: When I joined collabera i was very upset but when i met my Lead he is so confident and he has great knowledge in recruiting as well. He knows how to talk a new recruiter and how to manage with them. If someone will join this company i would recommend, make sure  Bhavdip patel will be your lead, he is so nice.

pros: Young culture (i.e. everyone is a similar age and can relate to a lot of shared life experiences), culture of growth depending on department, work perks such as PC, Top 30, Employee Appreciation Week, happy hours, spread milestones, etc
cons: sales is the only department that gets consistent public praise, while departments that are non "producers" do a TON of work without any recognition (i.e. L&D, CR, CRE, Ops, etc.); another con is the somewhat archaic culture of in-office work with little work-from-home flexibility, the fact that you must wear a suit to the office even if the city's client culture is more relaxed
story: The Top 30 trip - the best part was the recognition for our hard work and getting to truly "play hard" in Dubai and during Blaze. However, the con of the Top 30 trip was working in India. Why "treat" your Top 30 employees to a *full* week of working the night shift? It was a pleasure to meet my teammates overseas but it did not feel special or honorary that I had to work as a reward for my work. We were unable to do ANY sight-seeing or exploratory trips in India for that reason, which was a big bummer. I apologize if this makes me sound lazy, but I hope you can understand where I'm coming from. I would have loved the Top 30 trip to mirror PC - go to a gorgeous location, have an award ceremony, and relax the whole time.

pros:
I feel that the higher authorities are always helpful in case of difficulties in work
They keep the environment positive and happy and always understand there respective resources
cons: I don't feel any downside of working at Collabera because I am satisfied with my work and authority and doing what I love to do
story: The culture of Collabera is very amazing. when I was doing recruiting my health is getting worst due to pressure so I connected with my Manager and my HR and Immediately they took action and switch me into different department other than recruiting and now I love my work and doing 100% of my capabilities. Thank You

pros: The best thing about working at Collabera has been making some lifelong friends in my department!
cons: Watching others get promotions and raises and even processing those salary revisions was difficult this year. Knowing that you and your department have worked extremely hard to keep the company afloat during a pandemic and not being told there is no room for you to get a raise is extremely discouraging.
story: Watching our IT crew working so hard day in and day out during the pandemic to ensure all of us are able to work efficiently from home!

pros:
1. Feel like I belong here... like a family
2. My opinions are valued 
3. My contributions make direct impact to the business
cons:
1. Wish I had better recognition for the contributions, commitments and sacrifices that I make towards the business. 
2. Better IUP/Stock options
story:
Youthful vibrant Environment
Forward-looking thought-leadership
Technology focused

pros: GOOD LEADERSHIP, BEST SET PROCESSES, INNOVATION WELCOMED, OPPORTUNITIES GIVEN TO EXPLORE AREAS OUT OF SCOPE TO LEARN AND GROOM FOR BETTER CHALLENGES
cons: EXPERIENCE WITH IT INFRASTRUCTURE PROVIDED IS NOT SATISFACTORY, I FEEL THE IT TEAM IS OVERLOADED AND NOT ALL PROBLEMS CAN BE ADDRESSED WITH PROPER SOLUTION OR RESOURCES
story: I noticed that straight from my induction(on-boarding journey) to handing me to my team, the entire training experience where i got glimpse of the organisation work culture and work ethics.. I was amazed to see the energy level of the trainers

pros: You have the opportunity to meet people from all over the country as well as out side of US
cons: Working on the GBS side you do not get the same perk/benefits as sales. Not even the same recognition even those GBS is needed for sales to get commission and other perk they receive.
story: No matter what, since I have been apart of Collabera the traditions/holidays are celebrated in a significant way and the company always sends things such as food, trinkets to employees to try and show employee appreciation. Most employers don't entertain such things

pros:

cons:

2) I think that there is no equity in incentive plans. People working on SOW projects and people working for Mark-up clients, there is huge difference in both which is obviously because of the GP, GPM difference. I think they should do something for people working for Mark-up clients.
story:
I like Collabera's culture. They celebrate all festivals, there is good teamwork, good team activities that take place which is important to raise morale of the employees.
It provides a positive workplace environment.

pros: Nice environment and employee trust by management is big positive point.
cons: I think employee carrier growth is issue so more focus req.
story:
Client/employee  centric and friendly mix environment.
Collabera does not only focus on client and employee but take care of core employees. Also work hard and play hard environment is best in industry.

pros: fun family like collaborative place to work. always celebrating successes and great managers who want you to succeed. they dont use scare tactics
cons: sometimes work over hours on a daily basis to get all tasks completed
story: fun family like collaborative place to work. always celebrating successes and great managers who want you to succeed. we have quarterly team building events that i really look forward to

pros: Environment is competitive but most of the managers, colleagues are very supportive and helpful
cons: I cannot think at the moment any downside working with Collabera.
story: I''ll say it's Insanely Competitive. Like I got a rec one fine day. One other Colleague was also working with me. I submitted the resume the same day and got an interview request as well.  So working in competitive environment can be useful.

pros:
Collabera has unique work culture that amalgamates onshore and offshore offices. There is a clear communication of vision of Collabera, that helps individuals run towards it and help achieve it as well. 
Leaders at Collabera are easily approachable and always available when needed, which happens to be biggest reasons of working with Collabera.
cons: I don't think of any downsides of working at Collabera except Salary structure, which is little less as compared to the competitors.
story: The culture at Collabera never differentiates employees from across the globe, no matter what country, what office they work at or support. I happen to work with employees sitting across US and everybody is helpful, immensely responsive and very passionate to work with clients as well as employees.

pros:
1. Culture: The high energy, result oriented yet very humane culture is a big part of why I love working at Collabera.
2. People: The kind of colleagues we have are the kind of friends I would love to have for life and hence it is amazing. 
3. Business Strategy: The constant evolution to make the company better and be a leader in market-place is highly encouraging.
cons:
1. The pace of change can sometimes get too much. 
2. The culture can really consume a huge part of your life and might end up making one completely immersed in thinking "Collabera Way"
story:
1. Most of my closest friends in life are people I know from joining this company 12+ years ago.
2. Over the last 12 years, I have never once even felt the need to look for an alternate career option outside of Collabera, primary reason being the fact we are  constantly evolving and there is always a positive challenge that I am getting on a professional front.

pros:
1.) I learn more about the IT sector as a whole. 
2.)Nice working environment and a good opportunity to interact with a wide range of people.
3.)Stability & job security
cons:
Ten hours of working is a little bit more.
I have not received my incentive plans even after 8 months.
story: Working with Collabera has been an amazing journey for me. I feel the positive vibe from people working with me. I interact with highly motivated people who behave very Professionally.

pros: The culture at Collaera is amazing! The support we provide when someone is down is great.
cons: The growth path, guidelines are not so clear here. A little more transperancy on the short term and long term goals will help.
story: I was sick last year and was out for almost 3 times and also had a family situation (mom's health) and I was OOO for almost a month or so. The kind of help and support I got from the management is just AMAZING! The motivation that we get here is great!!

pros: good team, work environment in office. positive vibe in office, supportive lead.
cons: some times doing the same work everyday feels bored. mostly the work from home .
story: working with collabera is a great experience for me, my lead Puneet stood with me in good and bad phase, I have learnt how a leader works from him, and that gives a different positive vibe.

pros: The opportunity for success, money, growth and advancement. I love the people, culture, mentorship and relationships. The incentives, benefits and recognition for performance. The challenges, obstacles and resolutions!
cons: The stress and anxiety of expectations to be met. Not being able to predict the future of sales. Diversity and inclusion.
story: Employee Appreciation Week & President's Club! Both of these engagements acknowledge the true appreciation that this company values in its employees and their successes. We love gathering around food, playing games/activities, celebrating/partying, and just being one community/family!

pros: As Collabera is multinational firm all employees get bright and stable carrier. They are awarded monthly performer with various awards. Culture wise as well very delightful and friendly atmosphere on floor.
cons: There is downsides to work with Collabera on current situation but only one i can say is to work on night shift or else everything is excellent.
story: The way Collabera appreciate their talented employees every month, such experience i had when attended first R&R 2 years back when I joined Collabera. Which gave us good positives vibes.

pros:
'- I am very money motivated and like having the opportunity to earn bonuses for the hard work I put in. 

- I love most of the people I work with. 

- Opportunity for advancement.
cons:
'- Capped bonuses. 

- Level of professionalism going down. 

- Issues with open door policy and role outlines - escalation processes aren't clearly defined and job descriptions change often so there is always a ton of crossover and inconsistent direction from management.
story: Over the past few years I feel that our level of professionalism has significantly decreased making it easy for many of us to feel that we have aged out of the company. The AAM program feels more like a sorority than a professional development program and I think that much of this is our doing and not the AAMs fault. These recent grads take our lead and while I think it is so important to create a fairly fun, comfortable atmosphere where they feel inspired to grow, that line, in my opinion, has been crossed into an area where people really only come to work for the fun and friends. I saw an email just the other day where the interviewer said they "couldn't stop staring at [AAM candidate] during the interview because [she] is drop dead gorgeous." This email went out to the entire region announcing this person's hiring and welcoming her to the team. I love that we can have fun at work and truly do value that but I do also feel that it is important to remember that we are still in a professional environment.

pros: the people I work with, the events that make us feel connected and more like a team.
cons: I don't much room for growth in my department both in pay and position
story: Everyday I get calls form people who need immediate help. I feel like my job exemplifies responsiveness.

pros: Work environment, work culture, work diversity, well defined processes and growth opportunities
cons: We can do better with Technology advancement/development
story: I was looking for additional project and was given completely in different domain to excel my skills and gain more experience

pros: Collabera provides the best environment for ones professional growth. The people working in Collabera are always ready to help.
cons: There is no such cons which I have encoutered yet till date.
story: During this pandemic situation the company took a very good initiative to give pre joining training to the confirmed candidates those who were waiting for there joining letter. It helped us to understand the company better and at the same time gave the example of their commitment and taking responsibilities seriously. Even after the organisation I can see the hard work and dedication they are putting for shaping the new buds.

pros: I feel as though my region greatly affects the overall success of Collabera & we are contributing to something.
cons: I do not always feel I fit in with the culture but it is not a bad culture.
story: The culture is definitely a work hard play hard environment & we are expected to be high achievers. Our leadership pushes us & that is a good thing.

pros: Young environment, large income potentials, potential growth internally
cons: not a lot of autonomy starting out, high tern over, lack of communication on internal initiatives, low 'soft benefits'
story: Few attempts at boosting/rewarding office moral but the team also compares what they see other offices doing to celebrate vs what is 'allowed' or 'approved' for the larger offices and it lowers moral.

pros: Management very good, any one can reach top management, any one can reach top management
cons: No downsides, No downsides, No downsides, No downsides, No downsides, No downsides, No downsides
story: blaze awards, blaze awards, blaze awards, blaze awards

pros: CULTURE. The competitiveness but also the collaborative and supporting nature.
cons: I honestly can't think of any cons. It's a great company to work for with plenty of room to grow.
story: With COVID-19, being extremely passionate about supporting and maintaining the relationships with my clients has been huge. Many of them were hit hard and I am doing everything in my power to be there for them as well as find new opportunities for the amazing people that were sadly let go. Being very quick/responsive and passionate pays off in the long run.

pros: They environment of people I am surrounded by and opportunity for income
cons: Disconnect between regional teams and offshore teams and minimal support for mental health (many peaks and valleys - counseling option would be beneficial)
story: feedback I have gotten from managers thanking me for my responsiveness.

pros: I have met many irreplaceable friends through my job. I would not change my choice at all to work for this company because it gave me a fun and motivating place to start my career path.
cons: I feel that our business processes are very poor. Sometimes we do not put the consultant first. Our internal systems are faulty and half the time do not work.
story: We try to push JUMP so hard but if you have looked at the reviews from consultants in the program, they are terrible. We treat them as an objects for the client. On the positive side, we do like to have fun together as an office.

pros: Collabera is a great place to work at. Good experience with team. Everyone is helpful & all questions & suggestion are considered properly.
cons: At times, the workload is too much which exhausts us.
story: The Annual event - Blaze - is the best place to understand the Collabera's culture. Everyone is encouraged, acknowledged for the best they do. It also motivates to give our best to the team & organization.

pros: Culture, creativity, freedom, opportunity to grow within the company
cons: Corporate is slow, unwilling to make decisions based on what we need. We are just a number to upper management
story: One thing that I try to do is make is special for every new AAM that starts, making signs and personalizing their desks for them

pros: Starting a new role during a pandemic was a much bigger adjustment than I could have ever imagined but the group of people I work with have provided a great amount of support and working in such a positive environment makes me excited to be at work every day.
cons: The only problem I am having at this time is learning everything I need to know for my position as an AAM. I just need to get the hang of things and continue to learn.
story: I think the experience that stands out the most is the competitive culture that has pushed me to work hard every single day I work. With a lot of us starting at the same time, having that friendly competition with the other AAMs to get hires and have high activity, but also having them cheering me on along the way has really motivated me.

pros: People, Team, Office Environment, Overall Culture - This company really wants to create a high morale and energy for the staff
cons: Lack of Communication, Not sure all leadership understands the tactical piece of our day
story: Employee Appreciation Week - Fun Work Hard, Play Hard Culture.  We created contests, had fun and bonded with one another.

story: In my interview with Collabera, David told me the team is really close. So one of my favorite aspects about working for Collabera is when we do team activities. We try to plan something once a month and I think it is a great way to bond as a team outside of the office.

pros: Collabera is a growing company in Baroda as well as in world. It is diversifying its business. It has good infrastructure. Motivates to work with 5 values of Collabera. HR department is very efficient and is people centric. Open door policy helps in resolving issues.
cons: Lengthy works hours. No Indian holidays. No regular cab facility. No rest room, if an employee gets sick.
story: Although Indian holidays are not available but Women's day, Employee Appreciation week, Diwali, Navratri, Ganesh Chaturthi are celebrated in a grand way in Collabera.

pros: Highly professional work environment, with great support from all departments.  Management is experienced and responsive.
cons: My department can feel somewhat separated from the main functioning of the company
story: Before the pandemic, I traveled to Collabera offices in Texas, Raleigh, Seattle and Chicago.  Every single office had a welcoming atmosphere, and a friendly, yet competitive edge.  Nationwide, Collabera cultivates a consistent, professional environment.

pros:
Brand and market value
Opportunity given within ESG group - only see myself working for Enterprise clients
I fit in all five cultural values of Collabera.
cons: No promotion for last 4 years, even though consistently performing and delivering growth every year. Two times winner of Top 30 employees of the company.
story: Passion. This is what i love about Collabera, every one is so passionate about their work from top to bottom.

pros: The people are great. They push you to be the best version of yourself at work. It's friendly competition.
cons: It can be discouraging. Some days it can be a hit or miss, when being productive and hitting numbers.
story: During training, everyone was so helpful. Even working remote, I feel like everyone was responsive and trying to get information to me.

pros: The culture of our team is amazing. People are passionate.
cons: Technology and reporting is horrible. Not enough operational support. Not competitive salaries to attract good talent. Too much turnover with hiring new grads. You also never know who to contact for issues and then when you reach out, people don't get back to you.
story: We had a client that were recruiting for and they had a slow and terrible interview process. The AM told the client about the bad reputation they were getting from their candidates. Client appreciated our consultative approach and changed to working exclusively with us.

pros: fulfilling, energetic, enables both professional and personal growth, monetary opportunity, social, passion
cons: stress, lack of work life balance, sometimes unrealistic expectations
story: There are many people on my team that truly lift their teammates up. Seeing the team being happy for each other success is inspiring.

pros: It is my 1st job with Collabera, I am happy with what I am doing now, will continue on the same.
cons: The ups and down sometimes demotivates me, but everything goes well with the time.
story: responsiveness beyond imagination - I could never image myself being so responsive with my duties before I was in collabera. It give me a lot of lessons to be out of the box and work in an environment which is friendly personally and professionally.

pros:
WORK CULTURE!
- because that's one rare thing to find nowadays. There can be days when you feel low, but you will have someone to cheer you up and motivate you to keep pumping.
cons:
Work pressure SOMETIMES!
I have had my share of experiences where I have had the worst of times and as my personality is not of someone who would easily speak and share about things with anyone else(I have heard that helps), it has sometimes effected me for a short span of time. But my strong believer self has helped me tackle that smoothly.
story:
Nothing sort of stories that strikes off my mind right away but one thing for sure that our company practices what it preach, i.e the five cultural values!
One can easily experience those happening in real life during day to day office routines.

cons:

Work hard & play hard!

pros: The thing i enjoy at Collabera are the team and collaboration. The leadership seems to really care about the people. The way they handled the pandemic shows how much they care. I like how we always celebrate the success of the entire team even the small stuff.
cons: With the transition to an all remote work force the technical issues that have come along seem to be harder to resolve than i am used to. No easy fix or number to call and easily correct issues.
story: I don't have a specific story however i think the fact that as soon as we all went to a 100% remote work force we had a company wide yoga session reoccurring was great. I know we had a number of people in our office take part in the sessions and had great benefit from it.

pros: '- Leadership, People and the environment I work in - Focus towards regional and digital hiring strategies.

story: Insanely competitive approach getting 4/4 UX offers from the Wells Fargo client recently.

pros:

cons: Extended working hours due to some or the other reasons, Incentive plan of recruiter for markup client and non markup client is same. Need improvement in incentive plan. Growth wise i believe it is bit slow in Collabera as it is a huge firm so lot of employees.

story: Collabera culture is its personality. I would be like to work with friendly and challeging people. I really feel very positive because now i am simultaneously work with motivated and collaborative colleagues.

pros: Great entry to mid level sales experience as well as relationship builder externally and internally - great networking in general. Another plus would be learning about IT and how its used within various industries. Overall it's instills motivation and friendly competitiveness.
cons: Not all but majority of the shout-outs can be overbearing and seem unnecessary. For the most part my colleagues are helpful/want to see me succeed however a lot of the females can be clicky, hostile, uncomfortable to be around at time.
story: Collabera's culture is upbeat and vibrant, an experience where I believe this is often highlighted is when you come back into your local office with an important meeting off/set, a Req, a follow up meeting or even a hire then your co-workers then match your excitement/energy - I think this best describes Collabera's culture in the sense that we all like to hype each other up for the smallest task that eventually strategically turn into $$. We love seeing people in green!!

pros: My immediate team who report into me and the friends i have throughout the company.
cons: I feel there is a constant pull and struggle among leadership and as a company we are all not on the same page which negatively affects day to day operations.
story: I feel i have experienced more of a negative downside rather than a positive upside.

pros: Encourages young talent, collabera is very passionate about the work we do, very people centric and ethical, great leadership, always think good about people.. ok to spend more money but not run anyone in wrong way. keep on innovating and thinking whats next. Invest in people and genuinely want people to grow and get rich.
cons: Sometimes, too many changes in less time.. Most people are home grown so external knowledge is missing but in recent times, we have hire people for fixing that gap.
story: Blaze!!! I have seen people crying for getting an award and crying for not getting an award. Seen people being so passionate about the work we do.

pros: Team Environment and culture we have created are the 2 best reasons to work for Collabera.
cons: I cannot think of any downsides of working for Collabera.
story: We are in the middle of a Pandemic but still i have seen most of the people go above and beyond to serve our clients and candidates and this is a really good example of being Passionate for service clients and employees.

pros: Great working enviroment. i have met the best people here and made some really good friends here. 3 CHEERS to the awesome youthful enviroment
cons: work life balance becomes difficult at times, apart from that everything is perfect in here

pros: good opportunity for income, access to large clients
cons: policies continuously change, management shifts yearly
story: I can't really think of a particular story to share in this case

pros: Collabera Culture, Values, Belief, Work environment, best in industry commission, keeps you engaged are some of the reason to work at Collabera
cons: The higher you go in your path in Collabera, the more the toxic environment it becomes, favouritism in upper management and willingness to work with favourites degrades / negatives to work.
story: Excellent work place when it comes to culture, celebrating festivals, encouraging recruiters or be it every level of employee is a good practice that Collabera has been performing and it's a great practice.

pros: I made really good friends here at Collabera and it was nice to meet them.
cons: I have been striving to excel however working with certain teams is difficult and draining and It is difficult to stay positive.
story: I am not really sure how to answer the above question.

pros: There are good amount of growth opportunity, friendly environment and a lot of things to learn and become stable in life
cons: The salary and comp plan are not good for some of the areas which is really disappointing.
story: This is not a story but an example. A top performer with most number of starts in functional area is making very less incentive due to the structure compared to a avg performer in regional or ESG. This seems like not equal opportunity which does not reflects the right culture

pros: Collabera is a great place to work because of the culture embedded in each office that allow us to work together as a unit. After attending multiple training sessions and Governance calls, to me, one thing remains consistent - our passion to place candidates within our clients and our competitive nature. This allows us as individuals to grow as professionals and as people in general.
cons: Unfortunately, the turnover in my office in particular is a negative aspect of this job that I have experienced. It ties into my point about culture - we have to make sure that internally we are employing the right people to avoid constant attrition and knowledge transfer.
story: Rachel Gallo, and Account Manager in St. Louis with me, once worked on a position with a manager at Wells Fargo for over 6 months before filling it. This was due to not identifying quality talent, getting offers rejected by candidates, working within a tight budget and much more. Throughout those 6 months, Rachel did not give up and worked tirelessly to match the perfect candidate with a rather picky manager. This to me is a reflection of our values to be passionate to serve and disciplined to achieve excellence in execution

pros: Collabera has the best work culture and has the best environment so far
cons: Not giving equal importance to the team members
story:
Work Hard, Play Hard
Discipline in execution
Responsive beyond imaginAation

pros: The way they have handled WFH is truly recommendable. The open door policy is really great in Collabera and the large scope of opportunities.
cons: My health is getting affected I believe. I can't be normal in sunlight as I used to be when I was not in Collabera. I only get Sunday to do my regular stuff.
story:
I like the way festivals are celebrated here.Honestly, US culture was not something I knew earlier,now I at atleast know it.
I also like the way onshore team celebrates our festivals too.This truly amazes me every single time.

pros: collabera's  culture, vision, ethics, opportunity with multinational client across the globe

story: slowly and study win the race, I am total agree with this statement.

story: EAW celebration to encourage high moral. No specific story but happy to see employees are cared but need some balance between all depts

pros: Culture and People make Collabera a really fantastic place to work. It is a supportive, collaborative environment that really does value the work of its employees. On top of that, our regional leadership is fantastic.
cons: At the moment, I can't think of many downsides to working at Collabera. I think especially coming out of College, COllabera is a great place to work because it provides a really structured program and also clearly outlines path to success, which for a fresh grad in the workforce, is really important.
story: Employee Appreciation Week - Embracing the people that make up the company and addressing our values

pros: Exposure is the best, learnings& grooming opportunities, best experience

pros: Really great people, nice, and easy to form relationships.

story: Difficult to come up with a story on the spot.  Any interactions with colleagues from other offices have been very pleasant - everyone is always friendly and happy - high energy, seem satisfied with what they do.

pros: I have always been like a Collabera Brand Ambassador which makes me motivated to work everyday and perform the best. Collabera provides the best set of tools and trainings to make sure that we are able to do our jobs and compete recklessly with the competitors in the market. Collabera has not just given me great mentors and colleagues, but I am blessed to have a great management team and people who I can call my Family. I feel very challanged at Collabera where I am can say I never had a Comfort Zone when it comes to work. Even during the pandemic, where the big names and brands did huge lay offs and shut stores, Collabera has always supported me and hold their employees tight during tough times. I feel Collabera is the best place to work and I would always recommend it to my friends or family looking for opportunities!
cons: Apart from Slow promotion process, I would say None!
story: Well, it has been great, to be honest, I do brand collabera culture to my friends and family most times. I have been part of many initiatives and projects, which always talk about the well being of employees and work hard play hard culture.

pros: Offshore team is great to work with. Opportunity to be very successful. There are times when you're rewarded with hard work commission check that you deserve. There's an opportunity to make a lot of money.
cons: Can be a negative environment at times. No accountability but then accountability when there's upper management involved. A lot of telling what to do rather than actually showing. Can feel like just a number at times.
story: Employee appreciation week was a very fun time to get to know the new people before they left. One story would be the offshore team, always so exciting when you see them succeed. They work so hard so it's awesome to see the teamwork involved.

pros: Best platfrom to showcase your skills. The culture in collabera consists of the values, beliefs, attitudes, and behaviors that employees share and use on a daily basis in their work.
cons: If we have any problem related to recruiting it take almost more than 2 month to solve that particular problem
story: Employees are engage with one another in a positive way throughout the workday.

pros: Great work atmosphere. Great culture, leaders, celebrations, togetherness.

story: Blaze celebrations are always amazing. Its shows great togetherness of all collabriates @ one stage enjoying and winning trophies together. its gala event like a big award function. i love it.

pros: Manager's Support, Cross department working, and festival/Celebration

story: I was not able to go home in festival last year, but the people here are celebrating festivals on next level. I did not miss home.

pros: Great team with great attitudes that encourage me daily

story: We come together as a team always. We are the fastest growing office and celebrate our successes. We always have each others back, whether that's in the corporate world or in the real world

pros: culture, coworkers, clients, team building, mentor and mentee program

cons: Honestly haven't come across any downsides as such,.
story: Collaberation, passion and competitiveness are the values I see on a day to day basis, I have seen a lot of passion & collaboration among various departments to get day to day tasks done as well as take on any challenging situation

pros: many tenured people within what is traditionally seen as a high turn over environment. A diverse culture which allows you to think more creatively and see other sides to business and communication

It's been very hard to see my office turn over multiple times within my time here but again recently due to covid and performance.
story: I love our offshore team, they're always willing to help, collaborate, and illustrate hard work. When working on a role we knew was going to be hard to fill they were determined and hungry for success which lead to a hire and happy client!

pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Collabera is the culture in the office. Everyone is very supportive and positive.
cons: Some of the downsides of working at Collabera for me was the long commute to my office.
story: One of the best stories that I have experienced at Collabera was getting promoted to an account manager. My office and team were extremely supportive and it was very memorable!

pros: Few reasons to work at collabera would be its culture and values, its general reputation & its growth and Success
cons: I don't see any downside working with collabera as of now

pros: Work culture and incentice structure
cons: Nothing I can think of.
