story:
From Monday to Thursday i make sure that I work hard and achieve my target and on Friday, i give myself a break and enjoy the other activities organised in Collabera campus. 
The R & R awards motivates me to give more than 100% and luckily this time i got an ward for my performance.
all the festivals are organised on the campus which does not make us feel left out.

pros:
Since I have joined Collabera I never get tired of work because every day I gain new experience and learning. Manager and team mates are really supportive and the culture we follows and live in its really rare to find in other company.

The way we upgrade our employees by providing training/certification, helping them beat market and stand out as in a leader in industry.
cons: Its really good that we try our people or give them an opportunity to choose  different area or different client to prove their potentials.
story:
MOTIVATION

The way Company keep employee motivated and recognize the performance of each individual, celebrate it at fullest which amplifies our Work hard play hard culture.

The recognition not only motivate one individual but whole team and all of us.

pros: Ample amount of opportunities given to perform and prove ourself
cons: There is no downside working at Collabera. I always feel valued while working at Collabera.
story: Work hard play hard is in blood of Collabera , even during this pandemic Collabera never fails to celebrate and keep employees engaged e.g. Performance meet, fun fridays etc.

pros: I worked for Collabera for 5 years, feels like home. My management takes care of me, so I want to do the same back.
cons: The industry itself is exhausting but that is not Collabera fault, its just the nature of it but I still love it
story: My Management supported me and gave me the flexibility to deal with a family issues and because I felt support I felt encouraged to keep working hard while going through a difficult time in my life. Again- speaks to "if you take care of your employees, they will take care of you back"

pros: Supportive Community, Also, the 5 pillars we stand by I think are all great reasons to work for Collabera
cons: Disconnect between onshore and offshore sometimes causes issues with candidates and understanding all the aspects around the position. Also, we tend to create problems for ourselves that otherwise do not need to occur,
story: Going above and beyond what is expected of us from our clients

pros: Great commission structure, opportunity is great. Job stability. Good coworkers
cons: Low base salary, not a lot of women in leadership. Not very good perks other than commission. NO 401K MATCH is horrible!
story: One negative experience I can remember is when a coworker had a brother pass away. When she had to immediately leave to go be with her family, she was told she needed to enter the time in the system and use her vacation time for a family death. That really rubbed a lot of people in the office the wrong way because there was no concern for her feelings.

pros: Amazing work environment and everyone gets along like they are family.
cons: There are no downsides of working at Collabera in my opinion.
story: I started working for Collabera in 1999 when the office was in a basement. Since then, the company has grown so much and despite all that change, the company still stands by its original core values and cares for its employees like family.

pros: Personally, I have got the best team to work with and it feels like a family. Apart from work relationship, we share personal connections as well and these people do not feel less than a family. I am so amazed and blessed to have this kind of family in my life. Thank you Collabera for giving me this opportunity to be here.
cons: Initially, the work pressure seemed high because I just got in from college. It really made me think if this is a place for me or if I can survive this pressure. The targets would sometimes make me go crazy.
story: Initially, it was very difficult for me to cope up with the pressure. But then I was aligned under Anshuman Singh and he is such an awesome person to work with. The healthy team environment that he created has me speechless. As a company the first thing should be a healthy work life environment and to help figure out the difficulties one is facing. The constant support that I receive from my manager and the team has really proved that Collabera is isn't just a name but also an example of how one can collaborate with each other and help each other grow. It's the best place to start a career if someone chooses to be in staffing.

pros: Being a part of a work in progress will one day be nice - when we see progress happening.
cons: Commission issues constantly, confusing systems that rarely work, treated like a number by upper level Management. Heavy male leadership. Upper level managements goals are the only ones that matter - not considering the health and safety of their employees. When our leading competition is letting their Employees work from home and have completely revolutionized the way they treat their employees it's embarrassing to see how little progress we have made.
story: When people say they love the culture of Collabera it's because they love their offices. The overall company culture is not unified at all. The cultures of offshore and onshore and vastly different and it's frustrating for both sides. We need to find a way to bridge the gap between our on and off shore teams. We need to consolidate back office teams so employees understand where to go for things and what people do. There are too many pockets of people that pop into situations that I have no idea who they are.  I know people are excited about the bigger picture and the larger goal - but we need to fix what's broken right now.

pros: Every employee is treated as a family. Gives amazing growth opportunities and keeps one motivated throughout the year.
cons: I Don't think of any at all except the night shift.
story: BLAZE and monthly recognitions. It truly has made me go that one extra step everytime.

pros: At Collabera, Employees always stay motivated, excited and engaged in their work. Every Month, Best Performing Employees get rewarded. Energetic Sports events, Festival Events, Zumba events are organized with the best possible facilities to enjoy together. Collabera offers lucrative incentives, Trips to different countries which always attracts employees to perform at their best potential. Collabera offers some of the most advanced training that no other firm in the country is able to - for eg. Digital Recruitment Training, PACER, CCL Platform that offers wide range of content to learn.
cons: Process Driven Environment which sometimes becomes too frustrating for some new joinees to adopt. No Cab Service. Less Pay Scale.
story: At Collabera, I have seen many individuals grow leaps and bounds. Recruiters gaining experience offshore and getting transferred to onshore office which is a life changing event for them. The Visionary Leaders at Collabera have been successful in developing multiple regional offices in the United States, Canada, Malaysia, Poland, Australia and have create tremendous growth opportunities for many. I am very amazed to see how Client Service given highest priority which is very much valued by the Top executives of the clients.

pros: To have a great environment to work, very professional behaviour when it's about work and to have a great culture i.e. to say that to enjoy every culture possible
cons: Having diplomatic answers from the head is always let my morale down. Also, how they interpret the work load is one you need to be aware of.
story: As a Timesheet Titans, any escalation that may happens, whole team including leads get on top of the situation and with the help of other departments gets resolved at the earliest. meaning Collaberation, Satisfaction

pros: There are pros to working at Collabera - management is supportive and flexible, commission plan is good, we have great clients.
cons: Cons - every office runs differently so it's hard to relate to colleagues in other regions; lack of training/learning opportunities; little to no visibility on how other accounts are doing
story: Work hard, play hard - we have our President's club trip every year which really exemplifies our cultural value. We all work hard during the year to qualify for this trip so we can celebrate with each other.

pros: competition , recognition, personal satisfaction that you help applicants and clients
cons: too many processes and approvals before you can get resolution from an internal team, it often feels like they are putting sticks in your wheels
story: employee appreciation events, presidents club and top30 - collabera knows how to pumper and recognize

pros: Being my first Job I have learned so many things that made me better individual, I give this credit to the leaders I am working with and Collabera gave it all to me.
cons: You have to prove yourself in regular intervals to keep up in the race and I love challenges.
story:
There was this month where my performance wasn't at peak and I felt really bad about it because even after giving my best , my "numbers" were not reflecting my potential. Here comes my Manager "Nisha Gor" , who made sure I smile again,  feel good about my work by sharing different experience of her journey in company and how never giving up can lead to everything we want to achieve. She has been my strength in Collabera and I would love to work with her whenever I get a chance.
And this is one of biggest value in Collabera people around you are really supportive, they celebrate your success, you are recognized for everything (small or big) which keeps you motivated along the way.

pros: Collabera (CSPL) has been an icon of an organization that is strong in bond with the people that partner with it
cons: Lack of Transparency, Trust, Relying on words of few people rather than allowing resource to express him/herself, Favorable/biased approach at times,
story:
Positive : The way Collabera (CSPL) takes care of its resources and has strong roots with growing leaders as  in-house talent
Negative : We have open door policy, but we are not very much in agreement with relying on words and perception of few senior leaders

pros: the people/culture & opportunities for advancement
cons: gap between upper level management and lower level positions
story: celebrating promotions/each others successes regularly

pros: Helping nature of coworker
cons: I don't any downside while working at collabera.
story: i have nothing share for now.

pros:
Strong Cultural Values.

People are not given right opportunities.

story: I have had great time in NJ office while managing one of the big Financial clients.Hard work was recognized and I grew personally and professionally.

pros: It allows us to share our thoughts and if they are good enough for the company growth, they are ready to implement it too.
cons: There are no major cons or downsides, but then few things like system (desktops and laptops) that we use don't allow us to be very fast on our tasks.
story: I have been a part of Collabera since 2010. I was hired as a Sr. Exec. and then moved to Manager in 2012, since then I was never promoted until 2019 start when I was moved to Sr. Manager. Since, 2011 when I got my 1st award for Most Hard Working Employee and since then till 2020 I have been eyeing on the most important award and which I got in this year as the Most Valuable Employee of Collabera. What I have learned is to stay persistent in your work without complaining, at time, things come late and at times they come before time. Collabera has always loved its employees and have taken care of them to.

pros: Transparent Culture, Great learning opportunities, Great people and ofcourse good incentive plans
cons: Long and exhausting work hours, work life balance, sometimes seems over-processed company
story: Being Passionate about work resonates with me personally more often. In one such instance, it was because my passion toward's work, i was able to deliver a Candidate to one of the clients going through many challenges regarding the Candidates background checks. In this I had to be very RESPONSIVE to tackle every question, DISCIPLINED to connect with each and every stakeholder in scheduled times to make sure there is progress

pros:
Freedom of Thoughts & to implement ideas.

cons:

Extra pressure sometimes on submissions & hires.
story:

I started few initiatives in past like Floor Huddle, also handling 4fsquad with our team with help of Sanyam and got great support which made these initiatives a suceess.

pros: It's been a great experience working with Collabera, with a great cultural and positive work environment, very fun loving, work hard and play hard environment.
cons: Sometime working in a night shift is very exhausting and salary package with Collabera is very less than the local market in a similar industry.
story: Its very great experience working with Collabera. I've learned a lot in my journey

pros: We have a great core team of managers that continue to push make things better for all our employees.  We also have a very unique opportunity in our department to build something big.
cons: Overall company goals and strategy don't always align with what is needed in our division.  We are a very small piece of the puzzle and often times it seems like our voices are not heard.
story: We have created a culture that encourages teams to work together.  I had a team member give very valuable client interview prep material to another recruiter on our team which put his personal commission at risk because they were competing for the same position, but did so anyway for the betterment of the team.

pros: It's been 5 years with Collabera and I never thought I will stay with a company for 5 years. But the culture and values Collabera follows brings has kept me going. Collabera always have something new to offer you everyday.
cons: The biggest downsize I believe is competition that have raised the bar and standard of quality work life balance. At Collabera, everyone is working overtime and work-life is not balanced. Additionally, Collabera can work on revising better incentive and compensation plans as money is a big motivation in such shifts.
story: Collabera organize Blaze(Yearly Event)which is the best example of Collabera's culture.

pros: foreign work exposure. It's a best platform for early career.
cons: The experience is average - felt strong racism in the company. While interacting with on-site individuals, I have felt a strong dislike toward me and my team.
story:
Ugly Corporate Environment - within offshore.
Favouritism - The reporting manager and department head's visible favouritism. Latest experience during Over zoom call - it is so clear that they literally ignore few individual presences, and solely pay attention to their favourite team members. 
Controlling Behaviour - Mentors have misinterpreted the role here, rather making the juniors learn about the business process, they have misused powers and assaulted juniors. They have created negative images of juniors in the team and in front of top management to win over them. This whole process was very emotionally draining. I literally resigned ones because of this issue.

pros: Collabera helps to keep myself stay with me as well as helps motivate me to do better and better day after day, not letting me feel down.
cons: Personally i don't recall any downsides, however would like to share my personal opinion regarding upliftment of employee from their job seniority in terms of position at least if not for compensation point. i have been working since 9 years and still waiting to get lift up in position.
story: i would like to mention about Exellence in Execution and Responsiveness beyond imagination we implement in our day to day work environment.

pros: A branded company to work with, good working culture and atmosphere
cons: I find working hours to be more but now fine with it. Salaries can be improved for TRs.
story: I find Collabera culture to be one of the main reason working in Collabera. All the leads and Manager creates the friendly environment around us so that we can work without any fear.

pros: work environment, easy to approach anyone in the team. activities organised in the company, especially the BLAZE. The team structure aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.
cons: bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb
story: NAnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn

pros: The potential of growing a DHR team within Collabera is very appealing.
cons: Collabera doesnt push any process onto offices that have both a regional and dhr presence. It's 100% up to the sales managers in each office to work that out with nothing coming from above to make that transition of doing business together smooth.
story: Collabera welcomes team building activities to get out and enjoy each other outside of work. I think that opens the door for teams to build a culture of work hard/play hard. On the other side of the spectrum, Collabera seems to look the other way when individuals don't follow core morals and ethics and leave these people in positions that make others feel awkward and distant.

pros: Culture
cons:
Management thinks Leads / Managers and other supporting staffs (Operations, Contracts Admin etc) are liabilities and Recruiters are only Asset for the company. 
It doesn't matter whether it's good time for company or worst time, they always keep PC club trip for Recruiter and Sales however this year there is no Top 10 leads from the company. There is no cap in Recruiter's  incentive however for Leads it doesn't matter how well his region or team perform there is cap. Management should think these supports staff and leaders are like grease or oil for the machine , without oil machine won't work smoothly.
story:
There are loads of positive incidents speaks about collabera's culture. It's not possible to give one or 2 examples.

Thank you!

pros: ability to make money. helping people find employment, fun culture. ability for growth
cons: Long hours, hard work. not always rewarded. but ultimately worth it
story: Wokring with people who are willing to put in the hours, whether night or weekends to fulfill client reqs (Promises)

pros: Feels organized , supported and work friendly . The culture here helps people get comforted to adjust work life balance
cons: Just a bit more of interaction between leaders and staff apart from work related tends to bring cohesion
story: The Diwali celebration , celeberating each others birthday achievement and group outings tends to bring people more closer and trust is developed among everyone .

pros: I love how everyone works hard yet enjoys having a good time at the end of the workday.
cons: It seems that even when I am working the hardest and I am the top performer, there is favoritism rewarding those who take shortcuts.
story: It took me quite some time to get my first hire as an AAM. When I finally was about to get one, it was a large GP hire and the entire office was cheering me on throughout the process. Moments like that really make me feel apart of a family but, there are times I feel I am being held to a different standard than some of the girls in the office.

pros: Lots of young people, not a super stressful job, get lots of experience in different aspects of sales industry and other industries (example: learning more about the clients we work with)
cons: The culture sucks. People talk about each other all the time and I’ve heard management say they didn’t hire someone because she was fat. Very unorganized. When I was an AAM there was no clear goal to hit. You’re lied to in your interview saying in designee you’re calling on your OWN leads but in all reality you’re actually setting meetings for other account managers. The turn over rate is so high.
story: Well, as I mentioned before, I heard someone in management say that they didn’t hire someone because she was fat. I think this is absolutely disgusting because if you can hire someone with a horrible personality who was hired for their looks, then you can hire someone who was nice and would be good in sales. Also, when someone leaves Collabera, they’re basically shunned and everyone is really mean about it and unsupportive. A good part of the culture, though, is you get shouted out and recognized for any accomplishment you make - big or small.

pros: One of the best reasons to work for Collabera is it's Cultural values.
cons: I don't see any downsides at working at Collabera.
story: Everyone's behavior at Collabera exemplifies Collabera's cultural values in a positive manner.

pros: Great culture, awesome team and teamwork, feeling of accomplishment, achievement shout-outs
cons: I do not have any downsides to share at this time.
story: In general, my team exemplifies Collabera's culture. Everyone looks out for one another, cheers each other on, and lifts one another up.

pros: Collabera is one of the best companies when it comes to working culture. It gives an opportunity for a fresher to grow up in their career very fast with a ton of learning potential. ... Good place to work.
cons:
Work Pressure and Collabera does not given good support regarding any question at HRBerry Portal.

Advice to Management

Management should call to employee and resolve the issue of employee regarding issues.
story:
Overall company is good when it comes to professionalism. Though in some teams, default politics is there due to accidental managers! But there are some professional / true managers too.

Culture is good. Salary, benefits, increments and incentives are way too low. Most of too good people leave them only because of salary and rest who are still below average need security, so they are unable to leave!
Was this review helpful?

pros: As a fresher it provides a great work environment, and opens ones gates to a corporare world its the incentive scheme once you score a hire.
cons: There are not downsides, but the presuure to perform consistently or the pressure for submission
story: When we are far from our family, we celebrate the festivals and culture.

pros: Flexibility, travel, good bonus opportunities, interactions with clients and coworkers, ability to work from home, challenging, work hard play hard mentality.
cons: It's very difficult to get promoted or get a raise, no yearly performance reviews or cost of living salary adjustments. Culture can be toxic at times. Leadership tends to look at numbers only and does not always take into consideration the people as individuals.
story: There are a lot of good and bad things I've experienced while working at Collabera. Overall I think the company is working to make this a positive place to work.

pros: the environment is great because all of the people i work with are similar in age. we all get along very well
cons: sometimes the work can be a boring and redundant. not too hard though
story: on my first day we all went out to lunch together and it felt like i had known them for weeks or motnhs

pros: Work culture and ethics... Collabera seems more like a family now and the best thing is the open door policy that Collabera follows
cons: Promotions Criteria and the roles and responsibilities that come along with each promotion should be well defined

pros: my teammates are awesome and are always trying to help. They are willing to go the extra mile to make sure we all understand a task
cons: My manager has favorites and only seems to want to help them succeed. He never checks in on me and it makes me feel like my work is not as important especially when I am doing just as well as everyone else.
story: I can not think of a story yet, just because I have only been working at Collabera for roughly 3 months.

pros: Transparent work culture with your supervisor available to guide you; Career Growth Path; Stability
cons: Only thing I can share since it is a feedback shared by multiple resources - Salary slabs (base) is lower than what other Staffing companies offer
story: Regional Model implementation back in 2015 which was a true identification of Collabera moving forward in the right direction with a more unconventional approach from what other Staffing Companies were doing. It changed the whole behavior of how things were dong for the initial 15 years and what different could be done. It has been a real game changer in terms of Collabera growing year over year in double digits.

pros: Being a part of a team at Collabera is great. The culture is fun, engaging, and supportive. I love my team and I know that everyone is there to support me and help me succeed. Leadership is there to support you and their door is always open.
cons: A lot of the work you do can be repetitive and draining when business is slow. There are definitely parts of the job that can be exhausting. There are also some aspects of metrics required that seem pretty micro-manage-y which can be frustrating at times.
story: Collabera's culture encourages you to work hard and you will b rewarded. You can have fun with your co-workers and at the end of the day you know that when you hit milestones and big accomplishments it does not go unnoticed. When my team hit 100K in spread we got to take a half day of work that day and take a bus to a quarry where we spent the day swimming and having fun bonding with our teammates in celebration of our huge accomplishment.

pros:
'- Exposure at the global scale.
- Experience to work in diverse cross-functional groups.
cons: '- Since, we are working for the US people, we need to think on our working hours and reduce them from 10 to at least 9. Because in the US, the standard working hours are 40 hrs/week but sometimes, I have to pull 60 hrs/week which hampers my sleep schedule and other activities.
story: '- Even though, I have recently joined the organisation, I must say the people here are quite cooperative and friendly. They are always available to help me out in times of need and to guide me properly whenever I face certain obstacle.

pros: Culture is always great, always a great environment to be apart of and everyone is extremely inclusive of one another.
cons: Don't always get in what you put in, there is a certain amount of luck based in recruiting.
story: We had great going away event for one of the individuals in our office who was moving. Was super fun experience, and showed that collabera cares about its employees

pros: Working with great team with whom I can share the challenges and they help with solutions
cons: Have been working here for almost 5 years, only downside I see lately is that I dont have anything new to learn or grow. We have digital training going on, but the DMs select people for that. I would have appreciated if everyone can be trained on that or any new training so EVERYONE can grow and not few

pros: Remote work is nice, other than that I don't have any
cons: sexual harassment, lack of female leadership in executive roles, no chance for promotion, no raises.
story: The new sales manager was hired and told all of the females in the office to wear shorter skirts like they do at IG in order to get promoted and earn better clients. The regional director laughed in my face when I asked for a raise and told me since I was so ungrateful he would take away my assigned clients (which he did). And the new sales manager slams his door so hard when he doesn't get what he wants that the whole office shakes.

pros:
The best reason to work her is my team and team culture.
Always money motivated
The another reason is the leaders of company, 
The way we work, the big brand name of Collabera
cons: I have been working with Collabera from last two years and hike that i got in two years is just 4K INR
story:
We are always running for excellence every time. I am not able to re call a single day when we are demotivated by the work, the leaders are always having our back.
I love the way how each and every resource is treated by the leaders.

pros: Collabera is one of the best staffing companies to work for. They always come up with something new that attracts their employees and drives them to grow themselves as well as the company.
cons:
Night shift is quite challenging as it distorts your social life. They have pretty good incentive structure but the growth from the prospect of appraisals is not at all good. I personally believe that you can't always be dependent on Incentives, appraisals are a must need and that too should not be just to a small extent. Recently made changes in the incentives structure, where recruiters are getting deduction in their incentives if they do not have hires for 2 consecutive months, is something which seems unfair as nobody is at the loss on this except for the recruiters who actually got those hires and deserve the benefit out of that. 
Also, in this Covid-19 phase, we are observing so much pressure from upper management. We have been assigned with multiple tasks that we can't dedicate our complete focus only on the recruiting part as these other tasks have been added in the KRA. It takes so much of our time that we have to extend our shifts by 1-2 hrs daily and due to this our social life is also getting distorted.
story: Collabera has always been one of the best companies known for arranging and organizing some of the best cultural activities which adds a flavor of happiness and healthy competitiveness among their employees. One such example is the MMW where employees give their 120% to achieve their targets in order to get their names on the list of tempting awards on each day of the MMW. At the same time, company believe in the physical & mental fitness of the employees and organizes sport events such as Volleyball and Cricket.

pros: Best reason to work at collabera is like the people treats like a family which loved most each and every persons helps in every aspects.
cons: As per my tenure i dont find any downside of working in collabera.
story: The collabera's culture is one i loved the most as if there is any situation where you finds a problem, we get the help and as in team there is lot more positivity towards work

pros: The people are what stand out to me the most. Everyone is so willing to help and answer any questions that I may have.
cons: Recruiting is not the most easy thing to do. Some of the days can be very long but I know it will pay off in the long run.
story: My first day at Collabera was one to remember. Everyone was so welcoming and everyone in my office introduced themselves to me. They assured me that anything I need, I should not hesitate to reach out to them!

pros: Entry level jobs, some sales experience, fun people to work with, company outings
cons: Employee turnover, misleading job descriptions, you are your numbers in the eyes of management. you must fit a certain mold, no room for creativity in meetings, approach, etc.
story: Collabera's culture is best exemplified by the AAM position. When you are interviewing, reading jobs descriptions, the brochures they hand out at career fairs, etc they never or very misleadingly mention the word recruiter. Many people i have worked with including myself had very little idea that recruiting would take up 90% of our days when we imagined the majority of it would be business development. i believe this is on purpose in order to get top talent that want to be in sales and rope them into doing the recruiting because people rarely want to be recruiters.

pros: Opportunity for growth, leadership is expected, management is quality
cons: There is a lack of structured training/on boarding,
story: I honestly do not have one as of now. I am content with the company in my first 5 months.

pros: I love the culture, the independence, and the people.
cons: Sometimes I find it hard to balance all the tasks I need to complete in 1 day and I do not want to upset anyone or not be good enough.
story: Everyday we build each other up throughout our calls and small successes we support each other while having fun!

pros: Work Environment, Culture, Motivation, Family environment
cons: As such there are no downsides working with Collabera, almost 5 years and enjoying each and every moment working with this organisation
story: Every employee in Collabera follows company's culture in one way or another. I personally is very passionate to serve my clients in each and every possible manner. Another is we work hard and then play hard by celebrating each and every festival

pros: OVerall great with good people who know the business.
cons: Too many processes and people involved with every transaction. There is 10 teams that get involved whenever anything happens.
story: Celebrating every ones success no matter how big or small is great to see.

pros: Work culture and work policy at collabera helps to create a environment where to work is easy
cons: i never find any situation as of now which stops me to complete my task, so i dont think i can answer this as of now.
story: The way i got familiar with collabera family and started work with my full dedication that indicates collabera accepts any new member to its family with full support.

pros: Collabera as given me opportunities to excel in what i do. thats one of the reason i m with Collabera for more than 10 years now
cons: I have not been able to find any cons so far...............................
story: I have got the best reporting managers so far in Collabera. They have always supported me in my journey.

pros: Having the ability to make positive impacts in people's careers and lives.
cons: Cross department support can be cliquish and thus difficult at times.
story: Collabera services and Cognixia training programs have opened up doors to many talented software developers that were previously inaccessible in their personal lives and careers.  It's rewarding to help them and see their talent be further developed and recognized when they are eventually employed.

pros: Work from home, team I work with, travel perks, and some other occasional pros
cons: Offshore teams and communication barrier, policies and procedures in place, hesitant to change
story: On multiple occasions I have had to work late on Friday's or push on weekends in order to get a consultant started.

pros: The best reason to work at Collabera is the personal relationships with co-workers and being able to work through things together. I also think the chance at commission is there and that helps
cons: It can be very demanding. The weekly numbers goals on the recruiting and sales side can really give that feeling of stress. I also feel like there is pressure put on managers from above them to reach certain numbers and that pressure can be passed down. Sometimes it feels like it is all about results even if the process to get there is more important.
story: I think when we went out for a team outing we saw a musician and had dinner and it legitimately felt like I was around friends. That was a good feeling to be given the freedom to associate with co workers outside of work and feel like we could all decompress together.

pros: The main reason is the work culture and ethics they follow as I haven't been in a better work environment before. Working in Night shift demands strong will power, dedication and mental support from the team and the management, and Collabera is up to the mark.
cons: The long working hours becomes hectic and sometimes overtime is also required. This is the only drawback that I feel and needs to be taken care of.
story:
All the cultural activities and festivals exemplifies Collabera's culture pretty well.
Working in night shift and when you are involved in all the extra curricular activities and definitely make you go hungry to perform even better and score money!

pros: The energy and encouragement of the team is one of the best reasons to work at Collabera. With long hours and high pressure, it is evenly weighed out by the amount of encouragement you get along side with it and everyone is willing to help you.
cons: Sometimes I feel like team members are compared to each other too much and makes you not focus on your goals but turns the focus more on beating your team member which I feel like is not beneficial.
story: My first sub, my first hire, my first morc, my first accomplishments at Collabera had the whole office including team members, delivery member's and managers praising me.

pros: Everyone here is very professional which I really like. and merging both onshore and offshore teams is interesting in its own way, there is lot of growth plus the training session to develop skills is amazing
cons: Not really every one here is very supportive. I never really faced any downsides so far and very sure I won't in coming days
story: I really like the competitive culture here that really encourages me do better from my teammates well it's a healthy competition though.

pros: Awesome work environment with fun coworkers that make you enjoy coming to work
cons: The job is tough and can be draining sometimes like when you call and call and call people and you can't seem to get someone on the phone. Additionally sometimes your search isn't great and you can't find resumes at all.
story: Even when you feel drained from work or you can't get anyone on the call, there is a supportive atmosphere from coworkers and managers that encourages you to keep going

pros: Best reason to work at collabera  is its people and its environment.
cons: None, as i am new in collabera and not yet joined office
story: People here are very helpful , and company thinks for the benefits of emplyee

pros: I love working with Collabera because i've got several opportunity to grow in to complete professional and made eligible to compete with some of the best managers in competitor firms.
cons: None that i can think of right now after the addition of the new CEO, his vision is very clear and he knows what he is doing.
story: I have worked and supported once of the enterprise client for 7 years and the way from top to bottom i have seen everyone being passionate to work for this client is amazing and it show one of our cultural values.

pros: It is rewarding to help everyone involved in the process (both candidates and clients). I feel seen at the company and know my managers really care about me and my success.
cons: I can't think of any downsides about working at Collabera. COVID just but some stress on the whole industry.
story: My team is very close and when I close a deal or land a new client, they all support me and encouage me to do my best. For ex, when I landed the the bulk hiring deal with Monstro, so many people reached out and said congrats. It meant a lot. Also my team voted me as MVP and that really stuck with me and made me feel apprciated!

pros: Young, energetic and passionate crowd that motivates me everyday to bring the best out of me. Being surrounded with people of same mindset at work really helps.
cons: Night shifts, diversity in behaviors of managers (not every manager behaves the same with their team members). I completely understand that every human being cannot be the same but I'm talking about the difference in thought processes of managers when it comes to making their team sit till late at work, not allowing their team in engaging in the Fun Friday activities (though we proudly say we work hard and then we play hard), there's much more to it.
story: Honestly, can't think of a story right now but I really respect and appreciate the 5 core values we have. I strongly agree that the top management puts all the efforts to cultivate these values amongst each one of us; however, I would also like to say that the culture is made by people and the ground reality is that not every one (every team) is even allowed to participate in the cultural activities. Work wise, it is a mixture, depending upon the person who drives it.

pros: The working atmosphere, Collabera take cares of their employees, Collabera's canteen, Collabera's culture
cons: I don't have anything as of now. I have not faced any problem while working in collabera.. So I have nothing to share the downsides of working at collabera.
story: When i joined collabera the people around me were so good. They help me a lot to understand how the company works and what will be your role & responsibilities. Apart from the work, managers keep checking on you about your families and health during this pandemic.

pros: Best thing is flexible hours policy. Company also provides good plateform to perform right candidate. Management does not prefer to do micro management in day to day operation and allow people to work by them self but that should be aligned with organizational goal and mission.
cons: As we know everything has two side but there are hardly few things about collabera which I consider on down side. In india working hours are too much I.e  10 hours which is way higher than other competitors in Vadodara.
story: Collabera is way of life. We spend more than 10 to 12 hours on daily basis, which is almost 50% of our daily time. So if we have more employee benefit activities then it will be encouraging. We have few activities but not enough to keep people encourage.

pros:
Collabera gives you an opportunity to work with some of the most passionate people in the industry - some of whom are really eager to service clients/consultants to the best of their abilities.
Close knitted teams, functioning together in sync.
Really excellent and knowledge people from whom you can learn.
Great Career possibilities.
Company is changing with time and trying to be at par with Digital Transformation that the world is going through.
cons:
Highly pressurized work environment.
Frequently changing work / KRA parameters.
Difference in the standards that Sales and Delivery are being held to. Pressure is too much on the Recruiters/Delivery than the sales. 
Delivery has too many parameters that they are being hold accountable for and failing in any one of them leads to taking a hit on the commission - on the same hand, sales have it very easy for them, even if they fail to meet their numbers, their commissions are not being hit.
Off-Shore/OnShore Mentality
Toned down commission plan for foreign workers.
story:
Spent my last 5 years working as a Technical Recruiter. But still was handling the entire team, straight from allocation to making sure everyone is successful. Creating and mentoring leaders - all without a title or any additional incentive.
all this cause of one basic cultural value that I follow myself: Passionate to serve client and employees.

pros: Work Culture is great here, also I am learning from here
cons: In my initial days, it would be night shift and the place where I am living
story: Work Culture is great. Everyone knows how to enjoy life and work hard as well.

pros: Culture is why I came to Collabera.  The competition aspect of the job, internally and externally, brings out the best in people here.
cons: The biggest Con for me as an AAM is the base pay.
story: Internal competitions bring out the best in us.  Whether it'ts being rewarded a free lunch for bringing in hot leads or an office happy hour for reaching a certain amount in spread, there is no lack of motivation here.

cons: Unless you are in sales, the compensation is not very good.

pros: The environment is incredible and everyone wants you to succeed.
cons: Time consuming (but worth it). I do feel more tired, but that's really all.
story: My AM has taken me under her wing and made herself my mentor. She constantly encourages me!

pros: Collabera helped me to grow in both personal and professional way. I have learnt so much and given ample amount of opportunities to grow. Collabera is one of the best companies I have ever worked with.I would recommend to work with Collabera to anyone who is seeking for career progression.
cons: I personally feel that despite of being a women and working in night shift, managers and leads don't recognize that how hard it is for women to work in nights. secondly, I have observed that all opportunities of being promoted as a lead or Manager given to mans only.
story: Collabera is known for having a best working culture.I feel truly blessed to be a part of such an amazing company.The kind of training, awards and recognition which collabera provides, I don't think any other company could match that. However, I am just looking for a day and when a man and women employee at collabera would be given same importance and opportunities to get promoted.

pros: The culture and the people. Everyone is genuine and really cares about their colleagues. The workplace is also very fun and entertaining
cons: Having to cold call numerous candidates everyday. Also your metrics are dictated by how many candidates you can get to answer the phone which is out of your control mostly
story: I recently just had a new born child and I was able to go home and be with her while still attending to my work responsibilities. My boss calls every one in a while to check up on me and ask how I am doing. Everyone in the workplace cares about my personal life

pros: I enjoy my team and working hard to mentor them throughout our process.  I enjoy learning from others and the challenges that they present.
cons: Staffing isn't easy.  I feel that the nature of the role itself is difficult for anyone to work with.  I am struggling with getting integrated while working remotely. But I think I am learning to get better every day.
story: I really appreciate the responsiveness that we emphasize with our clients and internal staff.  The way we support eachother and are quick to reply, whether we have the information or not, I think it is great that we follow-up.  I also am learning about how much I enjoy the shout outs in the mornings!! I think that is a really great way to engage/connect delivery and sales teams.

pros: It has been a very employee friendly organisation and has given me great exposure so far, handling the campus recruitment.
cons: At times, people exceed there shift hours rather than utilizing the given time. Which at times sets the wrong expectations.
story: I was not keeping well due to night shift as a TR, after discussing the same with my managers and HRBP. And based on my skill set I got a role of Campus Recruiter.

pros: At Collabera I am learning how to do multi-tasking, how to manage people and provide the best opportunity for them. Also, Collabera has a wonderful work environment and all the team leaders and managers are very friendly and supportive.
cons: As this is my first job and Collabera has given me a chance to prove myself and believed in me. Everything is excellent in Collabera and I think this is the best company to work for. I don't think that there are any cons about working with Collabera.
story: As I joined a week back, I am in the training period so my training is going wonderful and the L&D team is helping me really great through CCL and personally. Also, my manager, Mr Dipen Derashri is very friendly and very welcoming and my team leader, Mr Mehtab Sheikh is really helping me and is the best leader I could imagine of. The whole culture of Collabera is really great and I am really happy to be a part of Collabera family.

pros: There is high success rate and promotion rates. Everyone here is wanting to watch you succeed and grow with the company.
cons: Being in the middle of a pandemic and not having normal business.
story: The culture is clearly young, which enables everyone to push each other and succeed together as a whole group. Success is individualised, but it is also praised by the group cumulatively. I have nothing negative to say about my company.

pros: Overall culture withing the team, enjoying all the festivals flexibility to work.
cons: Collabera sometimes being biased in promotion and every team has their own type of promotion also you never get credit of your additional work that you do.
story: The best thing is that while in pandemic where most of the companies are cutoff the salary i am happy to be a part of Collabera who are paying full salary to all the employees.

pros: Excellent Infrastructure, Excellent Coaching and Mentoring, Adequate Training, Supportive Environment from the Colleagues
cons: Everything is just perfect here, I have never felt like being demotivated
story: In the Year 2018 I left the organization due to some personal reasons, however due to Collabera's culture and My Manager I joined the company back

pros:
Environment and Work Culture
Brand Value
Good Fame
cons: The Project distribution is random. No matter in which technology you are interested or good at, you will be given project on the random basis.
story: There were 3 to 4 scenarios where I personally feel that collabera's Culture is the best I have seen ever, which includes mostly festival like deepawali and holi.

pros: the environment and people that have a drive in this company.
cons: Cliques and caddy drama. Needs to come to the direct source and not discuss the problem with other colleagues.
story: Everyone has a great attitude and amazing at bringing people up, but has problem coming the direct source.

pros: Collbera is best staffing company and i loved the collbera culture environment and i  love the management which all-ways ready to support and give the opportunity to grow.
cons: i did not get huge Indian festival holiday to enjoy my family myself
story: i get lots of  the motivation to work in My team. Work hard play hard

pros: The following are reasons I love to work at Collabera: culture, growth, and environment.
cons: The only con so far is that it can sometimes be stressful and overwhelming when learning new material.
story: The first week on the job, everyone reached out to me and genuinely tried to get to know me. I felt so welcomed and appreciated.

pros: I do appreciate my manager/ boss. They give great feedback and I do appreciate the work I am doing in the broader spectrum.
cons: I feel like no matter how hard I try to work in the company, it does not get seen by others or recognized. It feels like there are broken promises and little room for growth if you don't fit a certain characteristic.
story: Working in the HQ office, I am able to get to meet and know individuals whom are either on executive board or higher up within the company which I truly value. I always appreciate walking into the office and being able to have conversations in the office and work with people who I may not get the opportunity if I were placed elsewhere.

pros:
Collabera is rewarding you the best for your efforts, their incentive structure is fair and apt.
The work culture at collabera is awesome which makes the company a dream company to work for!
cons: Working hours is the only set back, this job requires extra and unexpected working regime, as this business is all about availability of the 3rd person.
story:
The appreciation culture in collabera is the best, one can think of!
Once I got 7 hires in a day with client Accenture, and all of them got delivered. Team, acknowledged it to the best and boosted me for my performance via POB, that day, I felt motivated and I stopped scoring 50+ starts for year 2018.

pros: Working at collabera gives me a strong scene of belonging with my team and with the company at large.
cons: Some times their are to many celebrations, I personally am not a very huge fan of celebrations, but still it is over whelming to see the celebrations.
story: The story that best explains collabera is the story we are currently living, the way that collabera has handled and managed during the times of this Covid 19 Pandemic is  realy marvelous.

pros: one of the best company to work with in vadodara. infrastructure is amazing. inspiring leadership and employee policy.
cons: Night Shift. professional Attitude of colleagues. sometimes feels left alone.
story: Recognizing and rewarding employee hard work and contribution in the blaze.

pros: The people I work with are all great. I do not know what I would do if the people weren't all so great and fun.
cons: High stress, high workload, low pay. The metrics that are needed to hit are designed to push you, but they also have a lot to do with luck. People get lucky, then make a lot of money and say it is all attainable through hard work.
story: It is definitely looked down upon to be working from home right now, which is pretty crazy to think. I think we are the only office all working from the office despite a pandemic going on

pros: Collabera fosters a work hard, play hard attitude. Not only do you feel empowered by being around similar minded sales focused individuals but you get to become very close with them as well!
cons: No downsides to working at Collabera - I truly love my experience with Collabera in its entirety.
story: One of my managers was recently diagnosed with a brain tumor. I knew from my conversations with him that he was going to be participating in a Run for the Cure 5K. I was able to unite our internal team in order to all go run alongside him and show our support. I feel like this exemplifies our passion for our partners, our dedication to support them, and excellence in execution.

pros: I have been working from last 10 years & always felt like working with family & friends. Transparency from my bosses & mgmt. Support during tough situations & appreciations at the right time
cons: Inter departmental partnership is missing. Lot of internal systems can be better.. viz., HR system, referral programs, CSPL vs CTPL comparisons
story: Collabera doesnt give-up on its employees. There were situations were we had lost the projects & team members had tough times personally. However, Collabera stood with them & supported them through out the time.

I can definitely say that this is the best experience in my entire career.

pros: Diversity, team atmosphere, held accountable, fun, collaborative, innovative, understanding company
cons: One of the biggest downsides I would say that I have experienced with Collabera is the lack of communication between teams, lack of accountability, and lack of confrontation.
story: When I first came over to Collabera I was dealing with a situation where I was managing strongly out of fear as that is how I was trained at my last company. After grinding my gears and running many people the wrong way, I went to my boss to express my frustrations. My boss then settled me and while he understood and agreed with me, he taught me a much more positive way to handle various situations rather than the strong arm approach. This experience really opened my eyes and displayed Collabera’s true character.

story: Earlier on when I struggled to hit CO numbers, many of my co-workers began sending me resumes to help me out. This type of selflessness and teamwork is something I cherish working here.

pros: Great culture, great leadership. Collabera has given me the opportunity to make six figures in less than two years in sales. I’ve seen a ton of growth in the company and I like the current vision and goals we have set for the next five years.
cons: It can be high pressure, but that goes for an sales position. The systems we use on a day to day basis could really use some work, but again, it’s all manageable.
story: Collabera is a Global team. Everyone goes out of their way to support one and other. Whenever someone accomplishes something noteworthy, an email will be blasted out singing their praises. The email chain is then flooded with “congrats” emails coming from people all over the world. I am proud to see everyone supporting people they may never have even met.

story: From my past experience I just got the conclusion that whenever I am stuck or faced any issue in work, some one is always there to help & this best describe Collabera Culture.

pros: One of the best reasons for working at Collabera is the relationship building aspect - I have grown so close to my co-workers and clients that it has truly felt like a family and makes me excited to go to work every day and to help support other people and the success of their own business. There is a lot of potential for growth - professionally, financially and personally and that is the best thing that I love and am internally grateful for - this company has offered us the sky with no limit :)
cons:
as much as a work life balance is encouraged - it honestly is not. the fact that those who show success are working at least 50 hours a week and we only get the standard paid holidays  + the few days of PTO  is really discouraging. i feel like if this company recognized employees' hard work and grit by allowing more mental health days or PTO days then it would feel a little more worth it to put in the over time hours. each individual office is so completely different and has it's own culture in itself that it is even hard to comment on the culture of this company as a whole since it doesn't seem like overall as a whole corporate cares about the employees. sometimes it feels like we are just a number expected to bring in money and that every one is replaceable. sometimes it feels like there is not a whole lot of communication from corporate to each individual office - i feel like i am just working for one particular office rather than the whole company, which in a sense is true but i definitely do not feel like i belong to a company bigger than just my office. the health and wellness of employees especially during Covid/quarantine has not even been addressed - there are so many companies that have granted a few personal days here and there for the entire company to take a step back and mentally refresh from all that's going on in the world right now. even our clients have been given a Friday off here or there to take a mental day, educate themselves on what is going on in the world, debrief from the stressors and truly just take time for themselves. i have heard across the board that the hours we have been working from home are so much longer than the "standard hours" - there are days when myself and my coworkers are working until 9 or 10 at night just to wake up in a few hours to do it all over again in the same room. obviously i know you see the success from what you put into it, but sometimes it would be nice to hear from the employer that it is okay and actually encouraged every once in a while to take a step back and pause to refresh your mind body and soul so you can hit the ground running even harder after your break. we aren't given enough time off each year to take these breaks especially during the holidays when we want to spend it with our loved ones. I feel like I have to be very mindful and scarce of the time I am taking off to ensure I have time saved up throughout the year if I am sick or there is a family emergency - this wouldn't even let me live a life outside of work either. I have to be strategic and save up some time to roll over to the next year to allow myself that extra cushion in case there is an emergency or something comes up and I have to use it - we don't even have leave for bereavement. 

As much as I love this company and working for this company - it can get very overwhelming in the sense of a work/life balance not being fully respected or recognized by corporate as a whole. We don't live to work, we work to live and that needs to be celebrated and recognized so it makes it feel like our hard work and many hours spent overtime is worth it! 

Sometimes I feel like the burnout comes from the culture of the company coming across as very transaction driven rather than relational driven and it also shows from the benefits our own employees receive.
story: For being "the largest minority owned company" - it doesn't feel like it recognizes minorities. For example, during the BLM, it took quite some time for it to even be addressed and honestly as a company that employs people of all shapes, sizes and colors, it should have been addressed right away, educational resources should have been sent out, resources to talk about it with HR should have been sent out - there was a very surfaced level statement made by 1 person in this entire company and as a person of color myself, it truly didn't not seem like there was a whole lot of support given to the employees. It was so unbelievably difficult for me to wake up on that Monday morning after the passing of George Floyd and to call my clients and even talk to them about business. In the grand scheme of things, closing deals and bringing in reqs was not relevant at the time and even my close clients agreed with that so it was very hard to ask how people were doing and then to jump into a discussion about business - it was tone deaf to not even recognize what was going on and to act like it was just another day at the office. Of course, I know the world keeps on turning but sometimes when the whole world is paused and truly hurting like it has been in 2020 on an international level, there needed to be some encouragement or support to to just take a few steps back and breathe. Our company culture just pushes for numbers and transactions that we get so wrapped up in it all, we can sometimes come across as tone deaf to what is happening around us. We are a people serving business and I know that our culture should be represented each individual employee in their own way but overall our company's is saying else.

If your work is done by 6 PM (EST) and if I leave by 06:30 PM (EST), its not a good sign however in the same scenario if I'd leave by 07:30 or 08 PM (EST), it looks like you have put in lots of effort throughout the day. Sounds crazy but that's what I have felt. Imagine you leaving half hour later than the actual time and a curious question comes asking that "so early?" I mean how do you define early is something that I am not aware of

story: When I got put on a performance plan after my spread took a deep dive due to Covid and many of my hires fell through and it was one of the darkest times of my life. I was in a very negative place and mindset and was working 8 AM - 9 PM with very little reqs open but that never stopped me. The Account Managers saw immediately just how much time and hours I was putting into everything in order to simply keep my job and went out of their way to encourage me, motivate me and let me know that I am very good at my job and they do not understand how this is possible. It kept me going and pushing although it was one of the worst times I have had with the thought of "does management care about their employees because if they did they would realize how hard of a worker I am right?" or "why would I want to stay somewhere where I am not appreciated" but thanks to my coworkers they kept me strong and made me realize I am dang good at what I do and I am worth it!

cons: clunky, counter-intuitive systems make day-to-day efficiency impossible. internal departments lack continuity. little to no consistency of standards/messaging. too much division of and conflict between internal departments. not enough transparancy across divisions. Often too many cooks in the kitchen. We need to have an internal phone book that maps everyone to their function so that everyone can easily keep track of who gets involved in what and where to go for questions. too many internal processes. and too many login sso, security, password issues. overkill.
story:
I love Collabera, I really do, but here is an example of the internal battles we are constantly fighting. 
We bring in a service opportunity. We sell the opportunity through several client interactions at the regional level (with the help of our regional ITSS contact, of course). We have a final presentation call set up with the client, and on the day of the call, I start getting mtg fwd notifications. suddenly 4 additional collabera people from across the country who all have NOTHING to do with this deal are accepting the invite. People are arbitrarily looping other people in on our business. I then had to spend an hour calling around and explaining why we cannot just have our entire team on a call with clients who don't know them. That is not how sales works. Everyone wants to be involved in things that don't involve them. And they want to take credit for things that they had nothing to do with. It's messy and sloppy, and does not make us look very professional. I have had several of the same experience since then. I have also dealt with some petty internal "I should be the only recruiter allowed to work on this" nonsense. Not at all helpful for the "good of the group" mentality that we should all have. unfortunately fighting these internal political nuances takes up valuable time.

pros: I feel my co-workers and leaders match my passion, work-ethic and daily effort.
cons: I feel we are a bit over-engineered in the sense that departments are so compartmentalized that although it works on paper, many opportunities and basic best-practices are missed.
story: Collabera made a statement to me throughout the global pandemic. At a time that many companies look just to the bottom line, I feel so lucky to be apart of a company lead by leaders who see the value and long-term prosperity in investing in it's capacity and taking care of it's people.

story:
We've staff over 1k in our local office and at the time of pandemic it became mandatory to work from home as per govt. norms. We had at most 24-36 hours to get everyone prepared for their systems setup at their home to keep the business running and surprisingly we pulled it off. There wasn't a single day of lag for any sort of business activity and entire staff/employees worked OT from home keep their productivity at peak.
With great Team work and passion, it never feels like we are working from a different place.

It places us in a less competitive position at clients, where we are just seen as a staffing agency.

pros: Very Cultured Environment & Positive Leadership. Flexibility to learn & grow together. Providing platform very we can apply our skills to solve organizational & personal goals
cons:
1. As Collabera is a Recruiting & Staffing Organization, Compare to Sales & Delivery, No Strong growth & Incentive plans for GBS departments like Audit, Finance, IT. While these are most important departments and key growth driving teams. There is a lot of improvement need to be done for these teams in terms of an individual's financial growth as well as learning opportunities. 

2. There is a lot of gap between leaders & their managers. Leaders especially Team Leads/Mid-level leadership are being shadowed in many teams by managers being it by performance appraisals or recognition and shadowing their ability and visibility to higher management. Due to this, many talented & knowledgable leaders have not to be recognized which leads to an average rating of them. They are not able to perform with their full potential in spite of they are ready to take bigger roles. Managers Skip Level roles for leads will fully showcase their capability to higher management and then they should be benefited by promotions because employees in Lead roles are working with stakeholders at ground level & actually execute all the important projects with planning.   

3. There are very less flexibility benefits for Indian employees compare to US counterparts which create partiality experience for leaders between both the region. A couple of examples are different in policy for Work From Home, Flexi Benefits, different working hours, Less focus on People Health Policy, Limited Medical benefits compare to other Indian companies. These areas should be improvised   

4. Less Focused Financial Growth Plans for GBS People: Lack of Transparency in Performance Appraisals cycles. Goals defining vs Actual Roles/Responsibility performed.

pros: I like that I (to some extent) have control over how much money I make- I get out what I put in and have no one to blame but myself when I’m not earning. I also feel like my managers support that- they always encourage taking any opportunity.
cons:
It is INCREDIBLY draining to keep up with the task work- constant spreadsheets, constant updates as to where we’re at on something, every single day I probably accumulate 2-3 hours worth spent
On updating, filling things out, documentation, shared docs, etc. I work late every single day bc I prioritize my clients and recruiters and response time because I’m “staying closest to the money”. The micromanagement is at a level I’ve never experienced, and when I ask my friends in other staffing firms, their experiences are nowhere similar. It is giving me major anxiety these days and impeding on my sleep because the tasks keep coming and I can’t keep up while also conserving my mental health.
story: Two things come to mind: First, all of our incredible team/office outings. Always so fun because we work with such great people and I appreciate the “work hard, play hard” motto. Second, working as a recruiter for far longer than necessary on an account you’ve learned inside an out, being promised a territory after asking for reassurance the rug won’t be pulled out from under you, getting a promotion, and then getting moved off that account without an explanation even though everyone agreed you earned it.. aka having the rug pulled out from under you. You have to have extremely thick skin to work at Collabera, which I understand, and do.

pros: I can independently work yet contribute to the entire company.
cons: Downsides are very few and far between. Maybe some more compensation would be great.
story: Employee Appreciation week. It exemplifies the caring and togetherness we have in Collabea.

pros: culture, people, personal growth, great first job, room for growth professionally, experience in a corporate setting
cons: long days, repetitive, feels like busy work, micromanaging
story: When I broke an account, it was the best feeling. everyone was so proud and I really felt like in that moment I was doing something right. I was recognized many times, and everyone congratulated me. It really felt like a family

pros: I have experienced a lot of personal development, and team building events are nice.
cons: Our hiring strategy is deeply flawed, and creates additional burden for those who successfully passed through the training program. Hiring large classes of entry level associates with 90% 12 month atrition creates a financial deficit, weakened delivery, and negative client outlook. Direct hire is directly discouraged to sell other services, as no commission is rewarded, which negatively affects revenue and morale. Culture should not be equivalent to office drama, and there is a lack of maturity from the top down. Management (top to bottom) offers little positive reinforcement, but consistently project negativity and stress on staff that drive the business.
story: Verbal, promised encentives that never materialized represent the lack of delivery and positive affirmation within Collabera. Raises, commission restructuring, incentives, etc.

pros: The core team that i work with has a fantastic camaraderie & team spirit. We work together well and do so in the best interest of the group and the org.
cons:
no professional / career growth plans for anyone in the org.
Limited cultural integration
story: The colleagues are fantastic. everyone of them go out of their way to make you successful. They are very helpful and kind

pros: Has always been supportive of its employees - I have always enjoyed the flexible schedules & I was lucky to find an amazing team to work with at Collabera.
cons: Avenues for personality growth/development has been much.
story: Collabera takes care of its employees & makes them feel valued - When I had work visa issues, both my immediate manager & the company was willing to try their bes tot resolve the issues.

pros: Work Culture, lean org structure, opportunities to grow, opportunities to be creative
cons: Doesn't perceive as an end-to-end technology company.  People recognize it as a staffing firm
story: The quality of endurance - the understanding that we are all here for the long run - the ability to withstand any hurdles/ challenges - and standing as one team - celebrating success and moving forward

pros:
Collabera is the best company to work with. I have been assosiated with Collabera from past 7 months and it has been a great journey all in all. Be it learning new things or be it working together during this pandemic.

Just to highlight that Collabera has always taken special care of the new joiners.
cons: I do not see any downside as of now and it will be injustice with this company to judge it in just 7 months. My most of the time passed by working from home :)
story: During this pandemic collabera we were unable to go out and bring the food for ourselves however, collabera made everything available at the doorstep. They sent the goodies which made me feel like an integral part of Collabera family.

pros: I would say it has been an experience and lot of endeavors in Collabera good or bad but whats the point of living if you don't feel both.
cons: All the softwares I am using are outdated Since the whole world is using Office 2016 or higher we are stuck in the free/old version of Office 2007, I hate Cloud Office 365 I am much more an Outlook guy, It definitely hinders my core values (Responsive beyond imagination)

cons: The extensive time stretch of working sometimes is drainful. But afterall that's what it takes to be a successful is recruiting executive.
story: You start the day with work hard and down the line when it pays-off the palyfull and fun part becomes the part of your work-day.

pros: The best part working with collabera, makes every one the chance to stand out and be there own best part, and off-course the environment makes me comfortable.
cons: At first it felt it was easy to work at night timing, but as I realised, it's actually pretty hard for me to work at night timing. Still trying to figure out my schedule.
story: The work hard and play hard is the best and the most valuable examples set by collabera, because I still remember my starting days in collabera, and all I could do is work hard, and i know there will be success.

pros: Collabera is a place that has built careers. With solid leadership and growing mindset.
cons: Lack of work life balance. Lack of ability to change with changing times. Lack of digitalisation are a level where it needs to be to complete in this market .
story: It’s an organisation that truly keeps people at its centre . Company has grown over the last decade and has created successful careers. It has unmatched aggression and passion.

pros: There is solid financial opportunity if you are willing to put in work and the time. Day to day activities provides decent variety. It's easier to sell knowing that we are providing people with work opportunities that could have a long term impact on both the contractor and their families.
cons: In the past there has seemed to be a lack of top down transparency to the distinction between Regional and Enterprise goals. The internal systems are frustrating to say the least. Commission data and tracking is entirely on the employee which is understandable but considering the lack of transparency and inconsistencies with back end data, any potential discrepancy with commission payment will be exclusively beneficial to the company which can impact trust between employees and Collabera.
story: The President Club trip certainly exemplifies the idea of work hard/play hard. After a year of hard work on everyone's part it was nice to have a pretty extravagant celebration. Also, in my entire time at Collabera, I've never seen anyone celebrate a win or hire without still having an eye towards what is coming down the pipeline in the future which shows me the level of commitment and competitive nature each successful employee has.

It is nice to have people call and make sure I don't have any questions or make themselves available at all times if I need help.

pros: Great opportunity to grow if you have the hunger and great work environment

story: I was recruited for a Hands off Delivery Lead role with an expectation to do hands on recruiting for a year to understand IT recruitment. After 8 months or so when the leadership thought I had caught up on IT recruiting they promoted me looking at my numbers which is where I feel Collabera lives up to its promise.

pros: It has been a great 2+year working at Collabera. When I was new, I was concerned about the work environment and they type of people that I might encounter. But it was just the opposite, when we say we are a family, we mean that and I have seen live examples.
cons: There is nothing about Collabera, it's just that the working hour can be reduced by 1 hour. Also canteen food should be improved.
story:
There was an experience when a Non-Barodian fell sick and family was not able to reach her for 2-3 days and we had to get her hospitalized. The way everyone handled that situation with so much urgency and importance was commendable, visiting regularly to the hospital, staying there with her in turns.
I felt really touched with the gesture of the people :)

pros: Great Culture, Team environment, opportunity to learn new businesses, great people
cons: Staffing brand, at a times its too transaction oriented, discredits for others, lack of appreciation for support functions, HR decisions driven by business
story: Unbelievable passion to win, never give-up attitude, employee caring, high energy, employees are super responsive in nature, Corporate Recruitment have done a great job in hiring good quality people from diverse background from the competition companies, working against all odds, Management have always shown significant support to manage and navigate from difficult situations, I have been in Collabera for past 16 years and have seen significant aggression to drive business and grow the company organically despite tough competition

pros: I always wanted to go in HR field, talent acquisition is what i love doing, the best thing is the motivate you alot to do better but its become too hectic, otherwise the overall campany is good

story: I love recruiting here but they should pay for working saturday

story:
I can't actually think of anything right now about this. The only thing I can think of is Collabera celebrating different cultures both Indian & Western & making sure all employees are treated equally.
It's a great company to work for.
