story: Urge to respond to the clients and internal teams is something I am fascinated about Collabera also working among huge group of employees with different diverse employees.

pros: Working from home- having the freedom of working from home has been a very nice option for me. They do provide this when it was necessary for me and I did appreciate that.
cons: They cut our pay in the pandemic and cognixia is still preforming. They often put us down when we are selling things vs giving us any praise. Every week I feel as if I am being put down but then when something good happens it is often brushed offed.
story: I was being harassed by one of the Office managers and turned it into HR. When i went back to HR they had no record of me turning it in. They simply 'wrote it off'.  When the pandemic hit they cut our pay- we continued to sell pretty much as normal. When asked if our pay would be put back to normal we got a lot of negative backlash.

pros: Company's work environment and the way we actually live by one of our goal "Work Hard, Play Hard"
cons: Night shift which ruins the body cycle and stress related to targets that sometime creates self-doubt and anxiety, if not achieved.
story: The competitions held in like Margin Management, Champions league etc which according to me is such a smart way to create enthusiasm towards work in low times and helps achieving personal and company-wide target.

pros: Collabera is like a work family for me and I have never treated my work as a job for pay check.  Sham Patel is one of the best reasons to work at Collabera
cons: Some of our decisions are for very short term. We don't tend to think repurcussions of our decision in 12 months to overall business
story: Work hard and Play Hard. During T-Mobile RFP during COVID -19 the whole team worked for week including weekend 15 hours days to submit our response.

pros: The management at Baroda is very creative especially in critical times. I have seen this during the floods last year and now during this pandemic. Also, on larger scale yes the organization is people centric.
cons: The team structure that we have is bit complex and overlapping in many ways. I understand the on-shore and off shore challenges but anything that can be done to improve in dotted line reporting will help us (Collabera) in a big way.
story: I would pick a difficult situation of the same time last year during the floods in Baroda. Everyone had panicked due to overnight heavy rains and most of us couldn't go to office that day but the next day I saw everyone especially people from top management like Vinay, Himanshu, Vijaypal, etc going above and beyond to ensure that work doesn't get affected but at the same time more importantly people are safe too. Similar situation had come up during this pandemic too where we had to move entire work force to WFH overnight. Kudos to everyone who made this possible.

pros: Work environment is too good. There are people around you to help you out and make sure that you achieve the target hires. While talking to some of the candidates I got some of the good news from them that they trust collabera and their multiple friends are placed in different firms through Collabera.
cons: Work environment is too good. There are people around you to help you out and make sure that you achieve the target hires. While talking to some of the candidates I got some of the good news from them that they trust collabera and their multiple friends are placed in different firms through Collabera.
story: Work environment is too good. There are people around you to help you out and make sure that you achieve the target hires. While talking to some of the candidates I got some of the good news from them that they trust collabera and their multiple friends are placed in different firms through Collabera.

pros: I would describe working at Collabera as cycling through a mountain. Each climb prepares you for the next level, something that I can relate to personally.  It pushes you to the next level mentally and professionally and once you think you have reach the peak there is more to go. I have been lucky to have witness Collabera evolve to the company what is today from what it was back in 2014 and couldn't be prouder to be part of it. We provide the best solutions to our clients, and continue to be innovative and competitive. It keeps employees motivated to continue to grow their career within the company as I have in the years I've been here. Seen the SF team grow from 5 people- 3 AM, 1 recruiter, 1 CRE to a 25 person office is amazing and couldn't be prouder to have witness it. I continue to learn from my management, but also from our associates each year as they bring a new perspective to me as the office.
cons: Provide more training on new emerging technologies to seasoned account managers to keep up with the market.
story: I have so many but I will share the most recent one. I would say the story that best exemplifies Collabera's culture at this moment is my first JUMPro hire story which led to 8 additional hires throughout the first quarter of 2020. It was lot of discipline, responsive and research, passion and honestly it ended up being summed up to work hard, play hard. This was a true team effort, from pitching the idea by myself to a high level executive within bank, and involving my NAM, Director and CSO (after constant multiple meetings) we sealed the deal. It was a lot of following up, market research and maybe a glass of wine, but we landed our first JUMP hire in the account which open many doors to other account managers. It showed the client how far we would go to provided them the best talent solution in the market.

pros:
I love that the Collabera team environment that has been built throughout the years. I had the privilege of working with our first SFO team and help build the Collabera brand from the ground up. 
Even when you feel like your in a slump or at your lowest point. Not only do we continue to thrive through the roller coaster of sales, we push each other to strive for greatness. 
We are lucky to have a great support system to persevere through it all!
cons: I would lover to learn more about business development - and have a guide that gave us specifics to talk about every solutions that we can provide for Wells Fargo specifically.
story: My experience has been, a little bit of everything. I'm grateful for everyone, that has built me up along my journey. Any looking forward to the next chapter in 2021 :)

pros: Be fast and work hard to meet the competition and sustain in this tough competition
cons: long work hours sometimes it becomes more hectic sitting in one place for a longtime focusing on screen
story: Our celebrations best defines what we are ...what we have acheived so far and the way we all gather together makes every festival a special for every individual a remarkable one.

pros: Fun and engaging especially in the office when working with colleagues that makes work more easy.
cons: Long hours and sometimes lack confidence when working with some Account managers. Communication is a major issue.
story: Collabera's culture inspires our success and collaboration. We're an intersection of hopes, of dreams, of problem solving, and growth; it's a responsibility we take seriously. Our cultural values help us handle this responsibility with integrity. In short, they're the gut check of our day-to-day.

pros: I enjoy the team and family atmosphere and the support for one another. When one person succeeds, we all succeed. The team is very uplifting and we all want to help each other reach their goals, both personally and professionally.
cons: The work can be emotionally draining. People are unpredictable and we have to accept that we can not control their decisions in the hiring process but support them. We must stay positive and focus on what we can control.
story: Each time a person gets promoted or breaks an account, they get public recognition through an email, happy hour, shout outs on Red Zone, or what ever else it may be. We are genuinely excited for the small wins each other has. We focus on the positive, lift each other up, and always striving to be better in every way.

pros:
money. I think 90% of the employees here are here for money.

cons:
there is so much of dirty politics in management.
we are never allowed to celebrate our festivals. Like Diwali, we still have to work.

story:
let's take an eg of the festival Diwali. I know we have a grand celebration and then what after 10:00 PM you are asked to work. It's the most imp festival of Hindus and I think 80% population of Collabera is Hindu.
Secondly, you are questioned when you ask to take a day off even if you are sick.

pros: Success is praised, travel and collaboration is encouraged, willingness to adapt to change in industry, willing to invest in change
cons: Lack of diversity, lack of women in senior leadership, sometimes the focus of concern is in the wrong places (spread growth v. account growth potential), lack of communication, lack of mgmt addressing problems in the workplace
story: Cancun is always a positive experience centered around company strategy and team building.

pros: work hard, play hard philosophy and inspired to perform approach.
cons: individual contributor approach followed by the sales in accomplishing goals.

pros:

cons:

story: at that time some electronic error happen in company and we have solve the problem in late night. it's good example of work hard play hard.

pros: It has best working culture. As I am in this company from last 10 years. I have learn so many new things working with Collabera.
cons: I don't have any Cons as of now because I am at my best in this company.
story: It is good employee friendly company. All's good, means regarding the job culture and the environment.

pros: I have been working with Collabera from last 3 years and yes, i do have experience of 10 years and i can proudly say this is the one of the greatest organization i have ever been work with
cons: Lack of promotions after getting promoted as Senior executive
story: Insanely Competitive:- while working with Non Regional client i need to be more competitive for collecting the payment and so we have been succeed in reducing our past due payments

pros: Love the room for growth aspect, the commission and culture of course!
cons: Really cannot think of any as of today. I am really happy with my position and where I am at.
story: Presidents' Club! The epitome of Collabera's Culture I think. Everyone is made to feel super special and treated like royalty.

pros: The company culture as well as the people that work at Collabera - it has a family feel to it.
cons: There are a lot of internal meetings that don't produce any results or action items that are actually acted upon. The amount of spreadsheets and requests that don't produce revenue or action items that would turn into revenue are extremely frustrating.
story: Our team meetings / celebrations - you have a lot of hard work to do and get done but we all go out and celebrate together as a team after the work is achieved.

pros: Good company culture and they hire good people
cons: No 401k match, only minimum amount of holidays per year offered, I never feel like my accomplishments are enough
story:
Great people, but bad communication and processes throughout the different departments. The fact that we handle sensitive information such as SSNs, Passports, etc. over email with multiple people attached with no formal privacy training is not a good business practice. I would not want my information handled that way. 

I do like the company appreciation week, incentive trips, women's appreciation committee, etc. and the efforts made to make a good company-wide culture. However I think we need help on internal processes, communication, etc. that would make things easier. There are always too many people and departments involved with no continuity. It seems all processes make tasks harder when they could be easy.

pros: The people are why I stay at Collabera. I have had the chance to build some good relationships within the company. I feel that I am entrusted to get my work done and set my own direction on how to go about it.
cons: At times there is a sense of micromanaging or reporting for reporting sake rather than taking a realistic and efficient route to get the same kind of intel.  Doing this creates to many duplicates and wastes time. There should also be a push to have a more diverse leadership Team, especially at the director and executive level. Also, The new PTO rule where we only get two weeks and no roll over demotivates me and others greatly. I feel if we hire the right people then we should not need to restrict them from the balance they need between life and work in order to do a good job. I also believe there does need to be more flexibility after we return to the office for remote work now that we are in the new normal.
story: I think where we were and where we are headed are two very different things. Previously I think we had some good ideas and some good people but we couldn’t execute the way we should. I think previously there was a gap between leadership and the bottom line that had been ingrained into our culture. This was causing some real issues to not be addressed or truly seen by leadership enough to make necessary changes. I do think that the leadership that KK and Arun have brought in has started to shrink that gap. We need leadership that leads by example, that wants their work to be seen rather than hidden. I truly believe that we are on a better track now to get to the next level. I see how we are now truly investing in people’s training beyond the entry level. By doing so we are going to create long lasting careers for people and give them something to be proud of.

pros: Employees are helpful and do not hesitate to go the extra mile outside the boundaries of their work and role
cons: Tried to recollect but could not think of any such thing or a situation that I had to go through.
story: An good example from my team will be how we help each other without any second thoughts.

pros: Culture, and opportunity. Every one has equal opportunity but if you put in the work you have people that support you in overachieving.
cons: Initial salaries are tough, especially living in Chicago.
story: Our office lost a ton of spread during the outbreak of Covid-19. I never once thought that I was going to lose my job or I would not be able to attain more business. Especially since no one was hiring at the time. The leaders and every one else in the office stayed optimistic and adapted to the new norm. Here I am with 5 more hires and on the road to 10k. It is the people above and below me that made this possible.

pros: Fun environment/people, opportunity to make good money, flexibility
cons: Benefits need to be a lot better (Medical, 401k, PTO)
story: President's club, work hard play hard. Minimizing layoffs when COVID hit- taking care of our employees/consultants

pros: My peers and mentors trust me, value me and support me.
cons: Sometimes I don’t trust leadership in making the right decision when it comes to hiring, preferential treatment and even strategic account planning, action and mentorship. There's no trust or effective communication between different org's, specifically - Regional and Enterprise.
story: Sometimes it seems as though what collabera preaches and what it actually does are two very different things.

pros: Promotes work/life balance, enacts policies and tools to assist working parents especially in these pandemic times, decent benefits.
cons: Some of these happen in most, if not all workplaces.  Lot of pressure to meet deadlines, sometimes unreasonable colleagues, too many exceptions to rules
story: Too many stories to list as I've been here for quite some time.  A positive example is, our team was reviewing a contract for Sales/AM with a very short turn around due to client vacation/time off.  Through open and extensive communication plus a smidge of flexibility with all applicable/involved team members working later than normal, we were able to get the contract reviewed, modified to suit Collabera's requirements as well as signed before the client contact went away.
